detailedDescription:
Guide Price £600,000 - £625,000 Share of Freehold

Enviably located Chippendale Street is a quiet, residential street in E5, just a short walk from the eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along popular Chatsworth Road.

Superbly remodelled from top to bottom by the current owners, this charming share of freehold upper-maisonette arranged over three floors of a handsome mid-terraced Victorian home.

Bathed in an abundance of natural light and boasting a stylish finish throughout. The interior offers an elegant blend of original character and modern finishes. This perfect starter home boasts a stunning open-plan living room with stylish modern kitchen, Wood Flooring, polished plaster feature wall and views over gardens on the top floor. The first-floor hosts three bright and airy bedrooms with wood flooring and a modern family bathroom.

Located moments from Milfields Park where you follow the River Lea tow path down to The East, Crate Brewery and the Olympic Park.

Outstanding local primary schools are close by, and connections into the City and Central London are swift and simple with Clapton Station (Overground) within easy reach.

Offered with a share of Freehold.

detailedDescription: Charming, late Victorian terraced house located on this quiet and very popular road just south of Stoke Newington Church Street. The accommodation, which is beautifully presented has been extremely well extended to provide bright and well proportioned accommodation. There is a good sized 'through' living room which leads into a nicely fitted kitchen/diner which has been extended across the width of the house. Glass doors open onto a pretty, patio garden. There are four bedrooms in total and two bathrooms. A large, family bathroom on the mezzanine with two bedrooms at first floor level. A further bedroom has been created on the level above and finally a super loft conversion which provides a generous bedroom with en-suite shower room. Ayrsome Road is located just south of Stoke Newington Church Street with easy access to all the vibrant shops, bars and restaurants that this interesting part of London has to offer. Clissold Park and regular bus routes are also close by

Situated on the 4th (Top) floor of a development in Dalston with far reaching views via the floor to ceiling West facing Juliet balcony - this generously proportioned apartment offers two great sized bedrooms, a fully equipped kitchen and a striking communal roof terrace.

A lovely open plan living space with a floor to ceiling west facing Juliet balcony which is usable all year round and a perfect spot to enjoy those beautiful evening sunsets.

detailedDescription:
***no onward chain - available now with vacant possession***

Rayners are delighted to offer for sale a beautifully presented three bedroom town house with accommodation over 3 floors, located in the sought-after, award-winning Sutton Square development. The property has been well-maintained and modernised to a high standard throughout and provides a lovely family home in a quiet but convenient location.

The house is offered freehold. The front of the property is enclosed by a wall and wrought iron gate which leads into a small courtyard.

Inside the property, on the ground floor, the bright hallway provides access to an under-stairs storage cupboard. Off the hallway, the kitchen/diner is exceptional with a wonderful bespoke kitchen supplied and fitted by John Lewis. Work tops and up-stands are corian with an incorporated sink. Fitted appliances include induction hob; integrated oven with a hide and slide door; integrated microwave; integrated fridge freezer, washer/dryer and dishwasher. The dining area features attractive shelving and the floor throughout the kitchen and dining area is slate-coloured porcelain tiles. The spacious reception room on the ground floor has french doors to the garden.

The first floor landing has a further storage cupboard and leads to the large principal bedroom which has views over the rear garden, ceiling spot lights and bespoke wardrobes supplied and fitted by John Lewis. The other bedroom on this floor, currently used as a home-office overlooks the communal garden to the front of the house. The family bathroom is half tiled and has a panelled bath with shower attachment, WC, and the washbasin sits in a bespoke-built vanity unit which incorporates shelving, an abundance of storage and inset lighting and a mirror.

From the top floor landing there is access to the loft and a large eaves space, mainly boarded, which could be used as storage or, subject to planning consent, could be converted into a further room. The bright, sunny bedroom at the top of the house overlooks the communal gardens and contains another storage cupboard. There is a luxurious, recently fitted shower room with a vanity unit with washbasin, shower cubicle and WC. Walls and floor are fully tiled with porcelain tiles.

The rear garden is mainly paved with a brick built raised flower bed. It is exceptionally pretty with a secluded feel, provided by the bordering shrubs and planting. There’s a small shed and the garden has delightful views of St John’s church clock tower.

The house has gas central heating with Nest smart home connectivity and the main flooring areas are fitted with quality laminated flooring. The property is situated in a prominent central position in the square with great views of the beautifully maintained central communal garden with ornamental fish pond and has a private designated parking bay directly opposite the house. There is also perimeter parking around the square.

Sutton Square is a popular private square located in a conservation area close to Hackney Central Station. With direct access to the picturesque St John’s Churchyard via a private gate, the square is within walking distance of St John and St James C of E Nursery and Primary School and the City Academy, Hackney - both rated Outstanding by ofsted. Close-by is the popular town centre of Hackney with its many shops, restaurants and bars. The popular National Trust Sutton House, with its famous children’s garden is just around the corner and Hackney Empire is a short walk away as is the multi-cinema complex. Transport links are well catered for with local buses and Hackney Central station is close by. There is also a direct line from Hackney Downs to Liverpool Street.

Benefitting from large windows, high ceilings and an east/west aspect, this bright and well proportioned apartment comprises; a spacious master bedroom, fitted eat in kitchen-diner with a large sash window allowing an abundance of natural light in, a generous 13' reception room and a neatly tiled bathroom suite.

Albion Road is ideally positioned just minutes from the eclectic mix of independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants surrounding Newington Green as well as a short walk to Stoke Newington Church Street. address: Blackburn House, Prodigal Square, Hackney Gardens, London E8
detailedDescription:
Surrounded by greenery, lies this three bedroom apartment with West-facing balcony, in recently completed development, Hackney Gardens.

Its, considered, layout maximizes the space, creating the illusion of a house. The apartment offers extensive storage throughout and includes built-in Siemens appliances, underfloor heating, engineered oak flooring, LED lighting, video entry system and daytime concierge.

Hackney Gardens is a collection of 58 luxury apartments surrounded by landscaped pathways and gardens, in the grounds of an 18th Century Church, moments from Hackney Central Overground.

The apartments are split between two new buildings, Wyles House and Blackburn House, which are situated off Prodigal Square, a new, semi-public space at the heart of the development. Here a new community center, focused on arts-based projects has been created.

Situated next door and soon to be restored to its former glory by Es Devlin and John Pawson is St John-at-Hackney church. Dating back to 1792, it has a capacity of 2,000 so unsurprisingly, it doubles up as a concert venue for the likes of Ed Sheeran, Coldplay, Emeli Sandé, Elbow, Florence & The Machine and international DJs.

Hackney Gardens, offers an abundance of choice. Be it London Fields park and its open air Lido, Broadway Market, the East End institution, Hackney Empire or Dalston with its thriving nightlife. The local community is buzzing with its multicultural mix of creatives, entrepreneurs, city workers and parents.

For transportation, Hackney Central Overground is 2 minutes away as is the number 17 bus route which traverses across London. By train, Hackney Downs will transport you to Liverpool Street in under nine minutes. Alternatively, a two-mile cycle south takes you to the City.

* Photos in this listing are of the Show Home and are indicative only.

address: Stoke Newington Church Street, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
Stately, elegant and exquisitely preserved, this five-bedroom Grade II* listed Georgian house soars above Stoke Newington Church Street. On the market for the first time in 35 years, it’s a piece of living history—ideal for visionary souls searching for a truly forever home.

Brickworks Says

Time seems to fall away the moment you enter this Grade II* listed, five-bedroom house, built in 1734. One of four originally known as the "High Houses" of Stoke Newington, this isn't just a home with a few historical features; it's history at home. The twisted-baluster staircase, the ornate marble and cast-iron fireplaces, the original wainscotting, the sash windows with panel shutters, the frieze-adorned front architrave: Each alone would be a showpiece fixture, and this house has them all.

The result is a space in perfect harmony with both its past and its present. The proportions are grand, but each room has its own homely, welcoming character. The formal dining room is at once elegant and intimate. The airy reception room and magnificent master suite are suffused with painterly north light. The upstairs bedrooms are quiet roosts above the bustle. And the kitchen is bright, cheerful and awash in green from the large, lush south-facing garden—its footprint nearly twice that of the house itself.

Its imposing position on Church Street puts all the finest shops, restaurants, cafes, pubs and bars quite literally on the doorstep. That meandering Victorian wonder, Abney Park Cemetery, is just across the road. Pretty Clissold Park is a five-minute stroll away. All the while, plentiful bus links and an Overground service from nearby Stoke Newington station put the City less than 30 minutes away. The only question then: Will you ever find a good enough reason to stray from this magnificent house and its vibrant, friendly neighbourhood?

The Owners Say

This is probably the best-preserved early Georgian house in Stoke Newington, which when the High Houses were built was a fashionable out-of-London village. Barely a dozen years before them, Daniel Defoe was living in his detached house immediately to the west. Isaac Watts, the hymn-writer (“Oh God our Help in Ages Past”), was still staying opposite in the house called Abney Park, whose gardens survive.

We bought the house 34 years ago from an architectural historian, then Chairman of the Society for the Protection of Ancient Buildings. She had carefully removed the detritus of centuries to reveal the details of the wooden carving and panelling, which had uniquely survived on the stairs and in all the principal rooms. We have brought up three girls very happily here, and we are all absolutely devoted to it.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current Energy Efficiency Rating and Environmental Impact Rating: D.

In the Borough of Hackney, the house falls into Council Tax Band G (£2670.22 in 2021/21).

The current owners have found their new home, so the chain is already in place.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

The Legal Bit

While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

hkr brings 66 fantastic urban residences to Hoxton. Raised on Hackney Road, hkr is situated close to both the heart of Hoxton and Shoreditch, two of London’s most trendy and popular locations.

Being in a Zone One location, the scheme sits within easy reach of Shoreditch High Street and Hoxton Overground stations, as well as Old Street, and Liverpool Street stations taking you into the City and beyond.

The building itself is exceptional, designed by Hawkins Brown Architects, it features toned weathering steel frames spanning the façade. The metal repairs itself, constantly evolving - painted by the rain, bleached by the sun and sculpted by the wind.

A courtyard terrace at first-floor level provides a place of relaxation and also links the two service cores of the development. The fifth floor landscaped garden terrace is a further place to relax. Landscaped by Hawkins Brown the terrace will provide external seating, children’s play equipment and access to wifi. The fully-equipped private residents’ gym is also located within the fifth floor landscaped garden terrace. Enclosed, but still affording commanding views over the City and Docklands, there are further outside areas for yoga or fitness classes.

Higher still, the tenth-floor sky terrace is at the pinnacle of hkr taking in panoramic views of the City and Canary Wharf.

Enquire now to arrange your appointment.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Evering Road, Stoke Newington, London E5
detailedDescription:
Neatly arranged over two floors of a classic London terrace, this superb two-bedroom flat has its own sunny, southwest-facing roof terrace. Designed around architectural details and positively awash in light, it's a serene nest above one of the most popular streets in Stoke Newington.

Brickworks Says

All things bright and beautiful, this two-bedroom flat attracts sunshine from every angle. Downstairs is essentially a self-contained floor with a spare room and full bathroom; upstairs is the open-plan living room/kitchen and master bedroom with en suite. That rare combination of discrete private and communal areas make it adaptable to a variety of needs.

Yet, arguably its greatest appeal is the atmospheric design that takes advantage of every inch of space—exposed brick, warmly worn floorboards, clever storage, a cosy window seat—and makes it feel like home. And it’s quite literally topped off by that sunny terrace, with views across the trees and chimneypots to the city skyline beyond.

The indie shops, foodie hotspots and favourite watering holes along Stoke Newington High and Church Streets are on the doorstep. Leafy Abney Park, lively Hackney Downs and lovely Clissold Park are all walkable, too. At the end of the road, Rectory Road station offers Overground service to Liverpool Street in less than 15 minutes.

The Owners Say

This flat is such a magical space: A true sanctuary where you can shut out all the busy-ness of the city and relax—on the roof terrace, in the cosy bedrooms or in the fresh bathrooms. The natural light and decor are the perfect blend of unique and classic, and it has so many wonderful features for a flat its size. I am gutted to leave this place but am really looking forward to passing it on to someone who will love it as much as we have!

The area is fabulous and full of fun activities, and I have never once felt unsafe walking around here, even at night. The transport links to the city are amazing; it’s so lovely not to have to go underground on the tube. Evering Road is a wonderful street, full of friendly faces and glorious in the springtime when the blossoms are out. And our neighbours are phenomenal—I truly love some of them like family.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current Energy Efficiency Rating of C.

In the Borough of Hackney, the flat falls into Council Tax Band C (£1,421.11 for 2021/21).

One of four in the building, the flat has a share of freehold and no service charge.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

The Legal Bit

While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A super first floor flat in a desirable convenient location.

Location

This apartment is located on Newington Green Road, close to Newington Green Garden Square and is well placed for the many amenities in the locale including excellent shops, restaurants and bars. Clissold Park with its 55 acres and multiple activities is 0.7 miles away approximately. Bus routes provide easy access into the City and West End whilst Canonbury Station (London Overground) is approximately 0.2 miles away.

Description

A most attractive flat on the first floor of the classic late Victorian town house. The accommodation is both light and airy and being on the first floor enjoys particularly high ceilings and large sash windows. The current owner has maintained the apartment to a high standard with care and attention to detail. There are fine fixtures and fittings throughout. The bedroom is at the rear of the building and is very quiet. The entrance hall is a good size with the mid bathroom off it, which contains a full-size bath with strong power shower. The open plan living space is at the front of the building and is very light throughout the day. The fitted kitchen is cleverly built-in on the side wall leaving a really useful space for a work station. The discreet colour changing spot-lights can be set by remote control, lighting up the walls in an array of atmospheric and relaxing colours. For cyclists you have sole use of the bike pulley in the entrance hallway, for your easy access to cycle.

Altogether a very appealing flat in a convenient and desirable location.

Square Footage: 333 sq ft

title: 4 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
There's nowhere hotter than Hackney: Urban hipsters of all ages flock here for cool bars, great restaurants and east London edge, then stay for boring but important stuff like great housing stock, gorgeous parks, superb schools and easy access to the rest of the capital.

So this three-bedroom flat in a heritage building near Victoria Park would be a real find at the best of times, but for Hackney's househunters, this is definitely not the best of times. A cyberattack on the local council has left it unable to process local authority searches, bringing property sales in the borough to a grinding halt. It's a situation that could last for months - but Sail Homes has a solution. Lenders will accept our unique search insurance, so if you're looking to buy in Hackney in a hurry, this property could be your only option.

Happily, it's a cracker: A stunning split-level apartment in a former Victorian school, across the road from Wells Street Common and a short walk from Homerton and London Fields Overground stations. The open-plan layout on the lower ground floor is tailor-made for weekend lounging or entertaining, with smart dark wood floors, glossy white kitchen units and a double-height void around the spiral staircase, which brings in floods of light. There are three double bedrooms, including one with an ensuite shower room and a delightful children's room with a mini climbing wall and monkey bars.

There are dozens of pubs, restaurants and independent shops within walking distance - Victoria Park village has been judged one of the best places to live in Britain by The Sunday Times. And if you have children, Bramshaw Road is in the catchment area for several primary and secondary schools deemed good or outstanding by Ofsted. Estate agents always recommend viewing as soon as possible, but in this case you really should get your skates on.

Location and Transport Links
Bramshaw Road is a five-minute walk from Homerton Overground station, which runs east to Stratford for the Westfield shopping centre and the Olympic park, and west to Highbury & Islington for Victoria Line Tubes to King's Cross St Pancras (a 15-minute journey) and the city centre. It's a 15-minute walk to London Fields for Overground trains to Liverpool Street.

It's a half-hour drive to the city centre, traffic permitting. The A12, a five-minute drive from the property, heads northwest to the M11, for Stansted airport and the M25, and south through the Blackwall Tunnel for the Channel ports.

Nearby amenities

East London is one of the most vibrant areas on the planet, with a host of world-class restaurants, bars, clubs, shops, galleries, cinemas and gig venues. But you don't need to head to Hoxton, Dalston or even Victoria Park village to soak up the vibe: The Kenton pub, at the end of the road, is Bramshaw Road, is described as a "hidden gem" by Time Out. For a special occasion, head to Nest, 0.4 miles away, a restaurant that does a seven-course set menu featuring sustainable produce from small farms.

There are several gyms within walking distance, including the Hackney Weightlifting Club, 0.5 miles away, and you can get all manner of outdoor exercise in Victoria Park, 0.3 miles away: It has a boating lake, tennis courts, a playground, cricket and football pitches, a skatepark and an athletics track. If you just fancy a stroll or a high-summer picnic, Wells Street Common is across the road.

There's a Tesco Metro supermarket 0.3 miles away from 1 Bramshaw Road and a Lidl 0.6 miles away. Independent shops in the area include What Mother Made, 0.3 miles away, for children's clothes, and Earl of East, 0.8 miles away, a candle and homewares store. Look out for outlet shops, too, including a Nike Factory Store, 0.5 miles away, and Burberry, 0.6 miles away.

The property is in the catchment area for several primary and secondary schools rated good or outstanding by Ofsted. A near Primary option is Orchard, 0.4 miles away; at secondary level, there's Mossbourne Victoria Park Academy, 0.4 miles away, and Hackney City Academy, 0.6 miles away.

The nearest gp is the Elsdale Street Surgery, 0.4 miles away. Wood Street is 0.5 miles from af Dental Hackney and 0.2 miles from the nearest pharmacy, Clockwork. The nearest optician is InFocus Optometrists, 0.3 miles away.

Central heating

Gas, with radiators throughout the maisonette. The property is double glazed upstairs, original window in living room.

Room by room

The property has three double bedrooms with dark wood floors; there's a tiled ensuite shower room off the light-filled main bedroom, which has large internal windows, built-in storage and a small office area. The second bedroom has been set up for children, with a partitioned sleeping area and a very cool playroom with a mini climbing wall and monkey bars on the ceiling. There's built-in storage in the third bedroom. The main bathroom has tiles on the floor and walls, a bath and a rainforest shower head.

The large living area is a stunning open-plan space with a dark wood floor, glossy white kitchen units, an island with a wooden breakfast bar, a five-burner hob, an electric oven and integrated appliances. There's a stylish and space-saving metal spiral staircase and one side of the room is a double-height void, which brings in loads of light. There's a WC off the living area and extra storage off the kitchen.

There is gated parking at Bramshaw Road, with a dedicated parking spot for the flat. There is also bike storage in the building.

Open-plan living area - 7.15m x 6.56m, dark wood floor, double-height void, kitchen island with breakfast bar, five-ring gas hob, electric oven, sink with mixer tap, integrated appliances, built-in storage, separate WC, separate storage area.
Bedroom 1 - 4.65m x 4.57m, double, dark wood floor, built-in storage, office area, ensuite shower room
Bedroom 2 - 5.48m x 3.74m, double, dark wood floor, children's play area
Bedroom 3 - 3.73m x 2.74m, double, dark wood floor, built-in storage
Bathroom, bath with shower head, toilet, sink, tiled floor

Making an offer through us

We already have the title plan, register, searches and leasehold pack on the property. A conveyancer's dream. Request details to see the information. Having these documents upfront will save time and stress when you have had an offer accepted.

address: Goldsmiths Row, Bethnal Green, London E2
detailedDescription:
This well-proportioned, one bedroom mezzanine apartment sits in the attractive facade of this iconic conversion.

Location

The property is situated amongst a handful of charming, quiet residential streets, just around the corner from the delights of the historic Columbia Road flower market, and the vibrant and busy Shoreditch High Street, and as such, offers splendid access to the City and West End.

Description

The look and feel throughout has been carefully curated to work with this historical footprint, with butchers' tiles in the kitchen bringing a bit of traditional Hackney indoors. The heritage features are offset by modern hi-spec appliances, and range from the convenient fully-fitted kitchen to the underfloor heating throughout. The bustling flower market on Columbia Road, and food market on Broadway Market, injected a new lease of life into the Hackney Road, and soon after, some of London's most talked about restaurants and shops followed suit.

Photographs are of a similar unit in the building.

Square Footage: 608 sq ft

address: Carysfort Road, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
A truly exceptional well presented five bedroom Victorian Terraced house split over three floors offering excellent family accommodation and provides a unique opportunity to acquire a substantial space and a vast family home.
The property is situated on a much admired road and is perfectly placed for all the wonderful amenities on Stoke Newington Church Street, Newington Green and surrounding areas. This superb property features spacious and flexible accommodation of approximately 1,900sq ft including cellar.
The ground floor has large dual aspect reception leading onto a superb kitchen-diner and bathroom with doors opening onto a South Facing patio garden. The first and second floors boast five double bedrooms and a large family bathroom. The property boasts Canadian oak flooring throughout.

Carysfort Road is moments away from Clissold Park and Highbury Fields also a short stroll from Church Street which boasts an array of independent shops, cafes and award winning restaurants.
With excellent transport links to the City and West-End nearby with numerous buses on Newington Green to the City and West End. Canonbury Overground is a short walk away and links to Highbury & Islington tube.

Early Viewings Highly Recommended.

Please Call To Arrange A Viewing.

title: 5 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
We're open! Viewings available via Virtually, Your Home as well as in-person following safety guidelines.

This stylish and spacious home is tucked away from one of Londons most exciting areas - Dalston. The light filled interiors are calm and quiet and the garden is a luxury that we all require right now.

One of the beauties of the house is its anonymity - it is so hidden away that you feel far from the hustle of the city. There is a parking space for a car, which could be used instead for a bike shed or perhaps a separate studio.

The large entrance hall welcomes you into the light-filled, modern interior. Downstairs has a subtle twist on the traditional, and we are here for it. The open-plan main living space comprises of a comfortable living area, a contemporary kitchen and a smart dining space. There′s no better place to try out new recipes whilst half watching your favourite program. In the summer months you can throw the French doors open and spill out onto the lush garden to try your culinary creation. This wedge-shaped room also boasts a dramatic glass sided staircase which transports you to the first floor bedroom suite. To the right on this floor, there are two bright bedrooms - one with an en-suite shower room - and the main bathroom.

A beautiful, private and quiet garden is a luxury we all require right now. The paved area to the front of the house would be a lovely home for potted plants, hanging baskets, and some storage space.

This unique home is the city dwellers dream, as well as being a sanctuary for the slower evenings. You really have it all here. The double bedrooms are perfect for a family, or a sociable couple who want a guest suite - everyone will feel right at home.

There is a purposeful, simple and beautiful aesthetic throughout the home.

Even though the current owner extended the home some years ago, there is still potential scope to increase it′s footprint. The creative potential from simple decor to creating a garden studio is exciting - you can seek inspiration from the diverse and dynamic neighbourhood.

detailedDescription:
Join us for the Property Launch on Saturday 10th July 2021 - call now to secure your viewing slot!

Spread across the raised ground floor of a handsome mid-terraced Victorian home on Albion Road, this charming apartment is filled with natural light from its large sash windows and high ceilings. Boasting a convenient location with quick links across the City, it makes a great starter home.

Having been thoughtfully refurbished by the current owners, the apartment is well-appointed throughout and is ready to move into. At just under 600 sq. Ft., it comprises; a spacious master bedroom overlooking the leafy rear gardens, a further study or single bedroom, a neatly tiled and contemporary bathroom suite, plus a charming and light fitted-kitchen/reception room which has space to dine and entertain. The property has clever storage solutions throughout and is sold with a share of freehold, too.

Albion Road is ideally positioned just minutes from the eclectic mix of independent shops, cafes, bars and restaurants surrounding Newington Green. Connections into the City and Central London are swift and simple with the many bus routes that run along Green Lanes, Newington Green and Albion Road, and Canonbury Station (Overground) is just a 7 minute walk away. Although the property does not have private outside space, Newington Green, Butterfield Green and the award-winning Clissold Park are all within easy reach (all offering a perfect picnic spot in the warmer months), and Church Walk allotments are just around the corner (applications can be made to Hackney council).

Offers in Excess of £450,000.

Pownall Road is perfectly positioned in between leafy Haggerston Park and London Fields, and is just footsteps from Regents Canal, too. Connections around the City and into Central London are swift and simple, with Haggerston Station a short walk away, and the numerous bus links that run along Queensbridge Road all readily available. title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Widford Court, Brownswood Road, Finsbury Park N4
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?
It's a gorgeous layout with so much room and unusual amount of storage space. We fell in love when we walked in, every room was flooded with light even on the greyest day, thanks to the floor to ceiling windows in every room. The flat is fitted with high spec appliances (smeg and Blanco) and very well kitted out, including air filtration system, digital meter to track heating bills and the fasted broadband we've had - fibre to premise BT. With only 8 flats in our block we know our neighbours very well and its a close knit community.

Why are you moving?
Our family is growing with a dog and an under 1 year old baby. With both sides of the family living abroad we are looking to upgrade to a 3-4 bedroom to be able to have our families over.

What do you love about the area?
We live right bang in the middle of a vibrant community. It especially became clear to us during the pandemic, where even the wider community knows each other on a first name basis. There are amazing local businesses sprinkled on Church Street and Blackstock road. Our favourite coffee shops are Finks and Hourglass just 2 minutes away, Clarence Tavern and Bank of Friendship have beautiful beer gardens. We are spoilt for choice whether it's Spence Bakery for their delicious egg cress n mayo, Good Egg for brunch or the numerous boutique shops like Search n Rescue, Gathering Moss, Ollie Loves Alfie etc for those Sunday strolls. Clissold Park is the best! Dog and kid friendly with loads of stuff to do for adults too! We love the brand new tennis courts and spend quite a few weekends there, they even have deer and goats. The water reservoir and the adjacent nature reserve is a 5 minute walk as well.

Property Details:
Boasting fantastic modern style living space, beautifully appointed with floor-to-ceiling triple glazed windows and finished to a high specification throughout, this beautiful property offers ready-to-move-into accommodation in a fantastic central location. Accommodation comprises entrance hall with plentiful inbuilt storage and attractive wood effect flooring (evident through much of the property), leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen with ample space for both relaxing and dining, and direct access onto a delightful covered private balcony. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white high gloss wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor, wall mounted electric oven, and further integrated appliances (smeg and Blanco). There are two well sized double bedrooms, with a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling enjoying 'Jack and Jill' access via both the master bedroom and the hallway.

The property is very conveniently located close to beautiful Clissold Park, and within easy reach of Finsbury Park, Arsenal, Manor Park, Canonbury and Highbury & Islington stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes linking the surrounding area. There are also an array of fashionable local amenities, shops, bars and restaurants within just a short distance, with Church Street also close by.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

title: 2 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
An elegantly appointed, expertly developed five bedroom family home, impeccably finished in an artful blend of vintage style and original features to create just under 2,300 square feet over three floors!

If you lived here

You'll have a whole host of entertaining options at your fingertips – the front lounge makes for a welcoming reception space, with handsome double doors and a large bay window, lovingly restored vintage timber floorboards underfoot and an exposed brick hearth opposite a trendy crittall window pane allowing extra light into the hallway. Dual aspect, this is a fine party venue - with bluetooth controlled in-ceiling speakers for the perfect post Covid party! But this is really only just the start. Exiting the lounge, from the hallway you’ll have access to a beautifully designed lower ground floor bedroom, boasting ample and classy spaces while mixing a thoughtful blend of natural light and internal lights.

Towards the rear of the lounge with second access from the hallway you have a stylish kitchen/diner and it's beautiful. Pride of place is taken by a large chef's island/breakfast bar, illuminated by suspended filament lighting. The floor is classic porcelain tiles, and one wall is lined by beautifully fitted cabinets, housing a full suite of fitted appliances and topped off with luxurious white quartz countertops. Exposed brickwork and wall lighting gives this room a definite wow factor.

An un-interrupted skylight bathes the space in natural light, with more flooding in from the floor-to-ceiling crittall doors. Push these open and you can throw it all open to the garden –immaculate slate grey tiles leading onto a generous length of lawn surrounded by slatted timber fencing for privacy. Back inside and be sure you take a second to admire the ornate original coving and ceiling roses overhead in the hallway before heading up the timber staircase to the first floor.

Up here you have your generous master bedroom and a flawlessly ensuite bathroom as well as a second bedroom – and another generous bathroom. The expertly executed loft conversion adds two more bedrooms a master bedroom with its own ensuite and another double bedroom – both decked out with thoughtful lighting.

Before you leave, be sure to note the Nest central heating system, underfloor heating to all bathrooms and the kitchen as well as the gorgeous double glazed timber sash windows.

Outside, and you have perhaps our most sought after locale on your doorstep – the eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along Church Street are just a few minutes away, and tranquil Abney Cemetery and award-winning Clissold Park (Green Flag) are both just a short walk away, too.

What else ?

• Within a 0.5 mile radius you have nine primary / secondary school all rated ‘Good’ or better by Ofsted
• Perfectly positioned for quick trips across the City, this perfect first home is within easy reach of Stoke Newington Station (Overground), which offers direct links into Liverpool Street Station and onto the Victoria line (at Seven Sisters)
• The house is offered chain free – please register your interest now!

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A spacious and bright top floor period conversion, located very close to Newington Green, N16. This split level property offers a well arranged open plan kitchen reception, good sized double bedroom, modern shower room and exclusive access and use of a loft storage space, not to mention the use of a charming communal roof terrace at the rear. The largest internal space of three residential flats in this building, not to mention the great storage space in the loft, makes this unit a very special find.

Green Lanes is located just moments from the vibrant shops, bars and restaurants of Stoke Newington and the local eateries of Newington Green, with beautiful Clissold Park on your doorstep. There are excellent transport links with Canonbury Station (National Rail) within walking distance and an abundance of buses servicing the city and central London.

What the seller says:
I have enjoyed living in my flat in Green Lanes. The flat itself is modern and bright. From the front windows you can see the city of London, which looks great at night and you can also see the beam of light from the arsenal stadium. Being on the third floor, it is private and quiet. My neighbours in the building are friendly. We have a group chat to resolve any problems. As part of the service charge, the shared stairs and landings are cleaned weekly.

The local area has a young and urban feel to it, being close to Islington and central London. The number 73 bus takes about 20 - 30 minutes to Oxford Street. Newington Green itself is lively with many interesting retail shops, restaurants, and pubs. There are also many wonderful Turkish takeaways and 24-hour shops for convivence. Clissold park and the local leisure centre are 5 minutes away, following onto Church Street with all its many attractions. I have really enjoyed living in the flat and the local area. I feel lucky to have been there.

The open plan apartment benefits from floor-to-ceiling windows and an en suite bathroom with a skylight. The stylish kitchen has fully integrated modern appliances and is finished with a quartz worktop. There is a double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, a modern wetroom and the flat further benefits from under-floor heating throughout.

Richmond Road runs through the centre of London Fields and the renowned amenities of Mare Street and is ideal to access the many excellent independent restaurants, coffee shops and bars in the area. With venues such as E5 Bakehouse, Mayfields, The Spurstowe Arms all within a 5 minute walk.

The Picturehouse cinema is located on Mare Street, The Lido and the new fashion hub off Morning Lane are just around the corner.

An array of transport links are close by including Hackney Central and London Fields Overground, Bethnal Green Underground as well as numerous local bus routes all offering easy access to the City and beyond.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Genie Properties are pleased to present this 2 bed room flat situated just off Clapton. The property is in a popular residential location just opposite Clapton pound, local amenities such as shops and bus routes. The accommodation comprises: 1 reception rooms, kitchen, 2 bedrooms and a first floor family bathroom. Other benefits include newly refurbished to a high spec, gas and central heating. Viewings are highly recommended.

120 years left on the lease.

No maintenance fee's.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This exceptional four bedroom house has been beautifully renovated to a fantastic standard and sympathetically combines tasteful contemporary design alongside traditional Victorian features. The ground level offers a truly wonderful double reception room whilst a stunning contemporary kitchen is located to the rear. The dining area is flooded in natural light through a large south facing window and offers views over the sizable private garden through double doors. The garden has been perfectly designed to include an immediate decked area outside the kitchen and further terrace at the far end and has been thoughtfully planted to include apple tree, pear tree and grape vine.
Four bedrooms feature over the upper levels with master suite including walk in wardrobe and luxurious bathroom spanning across the entire first floor. A further bedroom alongside handy WC features on the half landing as well as access to a private roof terrace.
The upper level offers a further two double bedrooms and family sized contemporary bathroom.
Lots of storage is provided in the basement, second floor and attic space which provides further scope for extension subject to necessary planning consent.

Ambler Road is a tree-lined street in the Blackstock triangle which is renowned for its neighbourly feel whilst being located within the catchment area for a number of highly regarded local schools.
The house is perfectly situated for an array of local amenities including independent shops, restaurants and coffee shops as well as being in easy reach of three local parks and Gillespie Nature Reserve. Upper Street is only a short distance away and transport links are some of the best around with Arsenal station providing the Piccadilly line and Finsbury Park offering overground services (including the Thameslink network serving the City and Gatwick Airport) alongside direct links to Moorgate as well as underground services on the Victoria line. Numerous bus routes offer effortless transport to the City and West End whilst international links are facilitated from St Pancras.
title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented and architecturally designed, four double bedroom, two bathroom, Victorian mid terrace freehold, situated within the heart of Stoke Newington, moments from Stoke Newington Church Street. Accommodation is well balanced and generously proportioned comprising; an impressive double reception space housed on the raised ground floor, retaining original period details including coving and fireplace, bathed in natural light courtesy of the dual aspect. There is also a bathroom on this level. The lower level features a W.C, family room/further reception space and the beautifully designed kitchen/dining room, which provides access via bi-folding doors to the secluded rear garden, featuring a studio at the rear. There are two double bedrooms and the principal bathroom suite on the first floor, with a further two double bedrooms and shower-room on the top floor. This is a special house which must be viewed to be truly appreciated. Neville Road is located moments from Stoke Newington Church Street and within close proximity to the greenery and amenities of Clissold Park. Stoke Newington Church Street provides superb local shopping and a wide range of eateries.

Kenworthy Road is located in close proximity to many local amenities, including the open spaces Victoria Park (450m) and Hackney Marshes (850m), and the many local shops restaurants, delis and pubs of Chatsworth Road (900m) Victoria Park Village and Central Hackney.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Kings Group are proud to present this one bedroom purpose built - flat located in the heart of dalston.
This property is very close to the ever popular Kingsland Road in Hackney offering a multitude of local amenities, places to eat and to shop, as well as bars and restaurants to enjoy. Though close to the hustle and bustle of lively Dalston, the property backs onto a calm and peaceful communal garden, giving the best of both worlds. Transport is also not an issue here as you have Dalston Junction, Dalston Kingsland stations within minutes of the property, and Haggerston Train Station within half a mile, as well as bus routes to multiple locations. Oxford Circus is accessible within 20 minutes, Shoreditch and Stratford, with a forthcoming crossrail link and Westfield shopping centre, are 10 minutes away on the overground line.

Entrance

Front door to:-

Open Plan Kitchen/ Living Room

Double glazed window and door leading to terrace, range of base and wall units with roll top work surfaces, sink and drainer unit, integrated electric hob/oven, integrated fridge/freezer, spotlights, radiator, two storage cupboard, power points, laminated wood style flooring.

Bedroom

Double glazed window, radiator, built-in storage, power points, carpeted flooring.

Bathroom

Part tiled walls, heated towel rail, spotlights, panel enclosed bath with mixer tap and shower attached, wall mounted wash hand basin, low level W.C, tiled flooring.

detailedDescription:
Stunning warehouse conversion with roof terrace.

Location

Tabernacle Street is located close to Old Street roundabout, close to City Road and Great Eastern Street. It is a relatively peaceful turning with no through traffic and a mixture of residential properties and offices.

Old Street Tube Station is approximately 260 yards, Moorgate 750 yards and Liverpool Street 820 yards (source:streetcheck.co.uk).

Perfectly located to access the City within close proximity of a host of restaurants and nightlife including; Hoxton Hotel, Nobu Cafe, Gloria, Eatlay and The Ivy.

Description

A stunning warehouse conversion occupying the first floor of a beautiful Victorian building on one of the best streets in Shoreditch.

The apartment is finished to an impeccable standard with the classic loft features; high ceilings, large double glazed windows and exposed concrete. The kitchen and bathroom have both been carefully designed and constructed using the best of modern design techniques.

To the rear of the building, the apartment has a private roof terrace which enjoys the afternoon sun.

Square Footage: 711 sq ft

address: Navarino Mews, Navarino Grove, London E8
detailedDescription:
Hidden away at the end of a quiet cul-de-sac just north of London Fields, Navarino Mews is a uniquely secluded collection of 14 one, two and three bedroom apartments.

The L-shaped building wraps around a central paved courtyard and is surrounded by landscaped green space. The apartments are light and spacious, with high ceilings, generous circulation space and private balconies or gardens. The development is gated and car-free with secure bike storage and is due to completed in a matter of weeks.

All apartments are light and spacious, with zonal underfloor heating, with engineered herringbone pattern wood flooring and high-spec fixtures and fittings. The designer kitchens and bathrooms have been carefully planned to optimise space, with integrated appliances and fittings from Bosch and Grohe.

This spacious 2 bedroom apartment is on the first floor and has a Westerly aspect overlooking the gardens, with the balcony receiving the evening sun.

* Photos in this listing are included for reference purpose only (show home photos) *

Navarino Mews is ideally located between the green spaces and Overground stations at London Fields and Hackney Downs, and just a ten minute walk from central Hackney and Dalston. The local neighbourhood is vibrant and welcoming, focused on the popular Wilton Way with its independent deli, bakery, coffee shop et al. Everything you need is within a 15 minute walk of your very own piece of hidden Hackney.

address: 121 Royal Oak Court, Bowling Green Walk, London N1
detailedDescription:
This immaculate purpose built duplex two bedroom apartment is tucked away in a quiet oasis behind Hoxton Square. The apartment is in excellent condition throughout and enjoys great natural light due to its dual aspect and location on the top two floors of a four storey block. It is accessed via a gated courtyard area with residents’ parking spaces.

The second floor private front door opens into a fully fitted kitchen and generously sized living room with dining area, Juliet balcony and westward views over the gardens and green space below. Both third floor bedrooms have built-in storage, and the master bedroom is spacious with two west-facing windows. The second bedroom and separate bathroom face east, perfect for the morning sun.

Bowling Green Walk forms the southern boundary of the Pitfield Estate, a popular post-war low-rise development with a generous amount of green space and a strong sense of community. This apartment offers all the advantages of City living, such as proximity to amenities and public transport links, alongside the benefits of being part of a thriving local neighbourhood.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
***no onward chain - available now with vacant possession***
Rayners are pleased to offer for sale this very spacious, multi-level, three double bedroom flat situated on the upper floors of a well maintained period property in a popular residential location. The flat is offered for sale with a share of the freehold and potential to add further space (subject to the usual consents) with the addition of a mansard roof.
The entrance to the flat is via a communal hallway entrance, leading, via a door to a small hallway and stairs to the lower first floor where there is a double bedroom with loft access.
Further stairs lead to the first floor where there is a large, bright open-plan reception room/kitchen. The kitchen area features a full range of modern fitted units, integrated electric oven, hob, fridge freezer and dishwasher. Also on this floor is the bathroom which is hall tiled in a modern style and features a white suite consisting of bath with shower fitment, washbasin and WC. There is a cupboard which houses the central heating boiler and washing machine/dryer. Lastly on this floor there is an additional WC with washbasin. Both the bathroom and additional WC have tiled floors with underfloor heating.
On the top floor is a landing with loft access and two double bedrooms, one of which also has loft access.
The flat has gas central heating and there is a Local Authority residents' parking scheme in operation. Chatsworth Road is a sought-after Hackney location with its popular Sunday Market, bars, coffee shops, restaurants and shops. It's located close to Hackney Marshes, Millfields park and Hackney Town centre and a short walk from the picturesque nature reserve and the banks of the river Lea.

This spacious third-floor apartment boasts leafy views and a private south-facing balcony. Located on leafy Evering Road, this ideal first home is beautifully presented, and a short walk from Rectory Road station.

Spread over 830 sq. Ft, this well proportioned flat comprises: Three double bedrooms (two include built-in cupboards), a large kitchen with fitted white goods and ample storage, a bright reception with a working log burner and doors leading out to a private balcony, bathroom and separate WC. Additional benefits include fob-entry doors into the block, lift access to the third floor, outdoor storage (suitable for bicycles), and well-maintained, large communal rear gardens.

Evering Road is well connected for quick trips into the City and Central London. Clapton and Rectory Road overground are minutes away with Dalston Junction and Kingsland within a short walk. The vibrant Chatsworth Road, Stoke Newington Church Street and Ridley Road Market, an array of local and larger retail stores, restaurants, bars and cafes are all within walking distance. As is the ever popular London Fields. The green spaces of Millfields Park and the Marshes are nearby as are excellent primary and secondary schools.

detailedDescription:
The development has a EWS1 certificate of compliance.

A lovely bright one bedroom second floor flat with a balcony within a modern development in a great location between Stoke Newington & Highbury and to be offered with no onward chain.

The accommodation briefly comprises of a spacious entrance hallway with inbuilt storage cupboard, video entryphone and wood flooring. Door off into the open plan reception room/kitchen with wood flooring and 2 x full height windows and fully glazed door to the balcony. The kitchen comprises a good range of wall, base and drawer units with integrated washing machine, dishwasher, fridge/freezer and granite worktops.
There is a good sized double bedroom with fitted wardrobes, full height picture windows and fully glazed door to the balcony. There is also a modern 3 piece white suite.
There is also secure bicycle storage in the basement.

This well maintained development with lift access is situated opposite Petherton Road and within easy reach of a wide variety of shops, bars, restaurants and recreational facilities.
There are many bus routes to the City and West End and Manor House & Canonbury Stations provides Underground & Mainline train services.

Viewings of this superb property are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:

detailedDescription:
This excellent three-bedroom apartment is positioned on the fourth floor of Aumbrey Apartments, a riba award-winning development by Matthew Lloyd Architects which adjoins St Mary of Eton Church in Hackney Wick. Floor-to-ceiling glazing surrounds the open-plan living spaces, allowing an abundance of natural light to flood in. There is a beautiful communal terrace with far-reaching views over Victoria Park, in addition to manicured communal grounds to the rear of the building.

The Building

Completed in 2014, Aumbrey Apartments is one of three blocks that have been integrated across the site of a 19th-century Anglican church. It is defined by its diamond-patterned brickwork; the patterning of traditional red, glazed pastel-blue and oyster-white bricks is an homage to the Victorian style of masonry known as ‘diaper-work.’ This façade is augmented by reconstituted stone architraves, creating a sense of harmony with the neighbouring ecclesiastical architecture.

The scheme won Matthew Lloyd Architects a Housing Design Award, a riba National Award and a New London Architecture Award. The housing replaced existing unused church buildings, resulting in a dynamic mix of historic Grade ii-listed architecture and striking contemporary additions. At the centre of the development, beyond a beautiful limestone arch, is a courtyard with a box-edged green space overlooked by the vicarage, a florist’s workshop and stall, and further apartments.

The Tour

Access to the building is gained via a private gated entrance and courtyard that flanks the buttressed walls of the church. The apartment itself occupies the whole of the fourth floor of the building.

Internal accommodation extends to 855 sq ft, configured around a large open-plan kitchen, living and dining room with wonderful views of the Olympic Park in the distance, as well as the adjoining church. Engineered floorboards with underfloor heating run throughout and natural light floods in through timber-framed floor-to-ceiling glazing. A sleek, minimal kitchen with white cabinetry is configured towards the rear of the space.

There is a palpable sense of flow between the bedrooms and open-plan living spaces. The main bedroom has dual-aspect windows and is positioned at the front of the plan; it has an en suite bathroom and plenty of built-in storage space. Two further double bedrooms and a contemporary family bathroom lie at the rear of the plan.

Outdoor Space

A spacious communal roof terrace with southerly views towards Victoria Park can be found on the third floor. There are also beautifully manicured communal gardens nestled between the historic church and the contemporary apartment building at the rear.

The Area

Aumbrey Apartments is located in Hackney Wick, between Victoria Park and the River Lee. Since the 2012 Olympics, Hackney Wick has seen a significant influx of cultural investment. There are numerous restaurants and bars including the award-winning Cornerstone, Silo, Crate Brewery and mother vegan cafe. The Here East campus is a short walk away and operates as a co-working hub and cultural centre, while award-winning theatre and music venue The Yard is also close by. The amenities of the Olympic Park are close at hand, where the East Bank, a new world-class cultural quarter, is now under construction, with new facilities for the V&A Museum, Sadler’s Wells Theatre, the bbc and the London College of Fashion, as well as a new campus for ucl.

Victoria Park is a short walk away and is surrounded by a number of good pubs. On the north side of the park is Victoria Park Village with its excellent range of restaurants and shops including The Ginger Pig butchers, Bottle Apostle and Jonathan Norris Fishmongers.

The apartment is an eight-minute walk from Hackney Wick station which runs London Overground services to Highbury & Islington in around 10 minutes and Stratford International in approximately six minutes.

Service Charge: Approx. £3,200 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £375 per annum
Council Tax Band: D

detailedDescription:
A magnificent, three double bedroom, two bathroom period conversion set across the ground and first floor in Finsbury Park, N4. Standing in excess of 1,000 sqft, the property has been tastefully decorated whilst offering a wealth of character, from original fireplaces to ornate cornicing in the main rooms. A spacious living room leads directly out onto a fantastic, decked terrace taking you further down into your own private, west facing garden with mature shrubs and grassed area. The kitchen is larger than average and offers plentiful worktop and storage space for any budding chef. All three bedrooms are genuine doubles, the master and second bedroom featuring floor to ceiling built in wardrobes and an en-suite, while the further two bedrooms are on separate levels. The property is completed with a family bathroom and a long lease.
St Thomas's Road is set in the popular 'Blackstock Triangle' known for its village atmosphere and tree lined streets. The property is located a short distance to a number of leading Islington schools and the Highbury Barn locale. For the outdoor enthusiast there are a number of sporting options nearby with Finsbury Park, Clissold Park and Highbury Fields offering wonderful spaces for recreation, and Gillespie Nature reserve and the Parkland walk for a leisurely stroll. Transport links are amongst some of the best in London with the Finsbury Park hub (Victoria and Piccadilly lines and over ground services and substantial bus network) offering speedy access to Upper Street, the City, the West End, and International rail services at Kings Cross St Pancras.

detailedDescription:
Substantial family house in the heart of Stoke Newington

Location

Burma Road is a tree-lined residential street of similar terraced period properties on the borders of Stoke Newington and Islington. The local shops at the regenerated Newington Green, along with Church Street and Green Lanes, are all within easy reach, as are the many amenities in Highbury and Islington. Newington Green provides excellent bus links to the City, the West End and beyond. Canonbury station (Overground network) is a short distance away and provides access to Highbury & Islington station (Victoria line) and to Canary Wharf via Canada Water (Jubilee line). Clissold Park is nearby, offering pretty, green open spaces, along with Highbury Fields. The house is within the catchment area for good local primary schools.

Description

This very impressive and substantial family house offers wonderful accommodation throughout. The double reception room on the ground floor has many period features and bay front windows. To the rear is the stunning and newly extended kitchen/dining room which has great light. A beautiful glass door leads you out to the south-facing mature garden with patio area near to the house. There is also a guest cloakroom on this level. The cellar is currently used for storage. The five bedrooms and two bathrooms are on the two upper floors. There is potential to develop the cellar and to add a further room on the first floor subject to planning requirements.

Square Footage: 2179 sq ft

Offering well planned living accommodation, the flat cleverly makes the most of its space and comprises an open plan kitchen and reception room with space for dining, living. detailedDescription:
Full description This charming, light and airy apartment is offered with no onward chain, in the popular Brownswood conservation area of Finsbury Park. The property has undergone a full renovation to a high standard, which has just been completed. Arranged laterally, the private front door opens onto an entrance hall offering access to all rooms. There is a large, square reception room with fireplace and a good sized kitchen diner which has access to the garden at the rear of the property. Two double bedrooms and bathroom complete the accommodation which is practically laid out and beautifully presented.

Situation and tenure Queens Drive runs parallel to Blackstock Road, and offers fantastic access to a range of transport links and amenities whilst boasting peace and tranquillity. Finsbury Park transport hub is a short walk away, and has Victoria, Piccadilly and Overground lines on offer. The great thing about this precise location is that the shops, restaurants and amenities of Stoke Newington are all very easily accessible via beautiful Clissold Park, while Highbury Fields and the shops and restaurants in Highbury Barn are only a short walk away, equally jumping on the tube from Finsbury Park or Arsenal is also straightforward. The Woodberry wetlands and reservoirs offer a range of water sports and wild swimming, and nearby Blighty Coffee, Salvation in Noodles, Farang and many more are perennial favourites of the local residents.
This dwelling enjoys a Share of the Freehold, and the upkeep and maintenance costs are split between the flats.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful single storey house was built in 1969 by the London County Council and has recently been the subject of a comprehensive renovation by Casswell Bank Architects, who have approached the redesign with a fluency in colour and tone that is typical of the practice. Original features have been sensitively preserved across the bright, flowing plan, which wraps around a private walled garden. Full-height glazing to the front and rear creates a wonderful sense of space, while a palette of mid-century-inspired pastels introduces a playful softness, cleverly accentuating the flow of light throughout the house.

The Tour

The house sits in a leafy residential estate on Daintry Way and is surrounded by well-kept communal lawns. Externally, the house presents a modest façade of brick and cement cladding, set behind a small front garden with a black picket fence. Entry is via a generous entrance hall with a frosted panel to one side of the front door, where there is also a cloak cupboard and a large storage cupboard.

On edge oak parquet flooring runs underfoot throughout, leading from the hall to a large living and dining room. This space is the heart of the home and opens out via new wood aluminium composite framed doors to a beautiful garden. A recently fitted double galley kitchen is accessed beyond the living room. There are smart black Valchromat units on one side, with white Corian worktops and a splashback opposite; there is also an integrated sink, induction hob and extraction fan. The kitchen leads seamlessly through to a study with a built-in storage cupboard, shelving and a birch plywood desk, overlooking the communal gardens to the front of the house.

The plan extends off the entrance hall to the sleeping quarters. The three bedrooms are generously sized and all have new aluminium-framed windows and views out over the back garden. The family bathroom is located opposite and has contrasting tiles and mirrored cabinets, illuminated by a skylight over the shower and bath.

Outdoor Space

The house opens up to a private walled garden at the rear, which has been recently redesigned by Casswell Banks Architects. It is paved with grey tiles and lined with a vast array of mature plants and climbing shrubs, creating a wall of evergreen views from each of the bedrooms. There is a mature rosemary bush, as well as an elder and numerous ferns. The current owners have set up an outdoor dining area opposite the indoor dining area, establishing a wonderful extension of the internal space.

The estate is pedestrianised and formed of single-storey houses linked by communal lawns; the garden has a door leading directly to the estate’s green areas, creating a wonderful sense of spaciousness. The trees, lawns and planting that link the houses are all carefully maintained. Residents often use these spaces for children’s parties and neighbourhood gatherings.

The Area

Daintry Way is located in Hackney Wick, between Victoria Park and the River Lee. Since the 2012 Olympics, Hackney Wick has seen a significant influx of cultural investment. There are numerous restaurants and bars including the award-winning Cornerstone, Silo, Crate Brewery and mother vegan cafe. The Here East campus is a short walk away and operates as a co-working hub and cultural centre, while award-winning theatre and music venue The Yard is also close by. The amenities of the Olympic Park are close at hand, where the East Bank, a new world-class cultural quarter, is now under construction, with new facilities for the V&A Museum, Sadler’s Wells Theatre, the bbc and the London College of Fashion, as well as a new campus for ucl.

Victoria Park is close by and is surrounded by a number of good pubs. On the north side of the park is Victoria Park Village with its excellent range of restaurants and shops. In addition, there are wonderful green spaces and walks in Wick Woods, Hackney Marshes, Mabley Green and the beautiful canal path that leads to the Greenway. There are numerous highly regarded local nurseries and primary schools.

Daintry Way is an eight-minute walk from Hackney Wick station which runs London Overground services to Highbury & Islington in around 10 minutes and Stratford International in approximately six minutes. Stratford International is within walking distance and runs direct trains to Margate, for spontaneous seaside excursions.

detailedDescription:
Long & Waterson is a boutique collection of ready to move into luxury lofts, apartments and penthouses in Shoreditch.

This apartment consists of two spectacular bedrooms, the master is complete with an en-suite, a further guest bathroom and separate cloakroom. 3 bedroom apartments in this development vary from 808 sq ft and are comfortable yet edgy, the design is effortlessly cool, quintessentially urban with exposed original brickwork in a number of apartments in the building. The interior details of each apartment have been carefully chosen by an international team of world-class designers to reflect the individuality of each home. Large warehouse-style windows flood spacious living areas with light, while detailed brickwork walls, bespoke Italian kitchens and oak engineered timber floors bring quality and character to your home.

The landscape takes shape on four levels, including ground, sunken garden, podium deck and upper sun deck. Located in Shoreditch, where plants cling to brick façades, artists paint bold geometric patterns on blank walls and people’s dress sense embraces the weird, the wonderful and the unconventional. In the back room, timber fences and bamboo create a secret garden, while also providing a barrier to adjacent beautifully landscaped private gardens.

London's Overground rail runs along the west side of the site with links from Hoxton (0.2 miles) followed by Haggerston (0.5 miles) . It is completely urban, yet due to the network of routes surrounding it, the location is surprisingly calm and quiet, providing a place of tranquillity in this inner city development.

detailedDescription:
Fabulous extended four bedroom Victorian terraced house in a sought-after location moments from Church Street, Clissold Park and popular local schools.
Effortlessly combining beautiful period and contemporary features, this bright and stylish family home offers generous living and entertaining space throughout. The property further benefits from having just been completely rewired (including the garden and outbuilding), totally redecorated, and the extensive addition of new spotlighting.
The accommodation comprises on the ground floor an elegant double reception room with bay window, folding interconnecting doors, period fireplace and wood-burning stove; to the rear a stunning kitchen-dining room features smart modern units, a central work-island, breakfast bar and quality integrated appliances. Twin sets of French doors open onto a delightful manicured garden (60’ approx.) replete with attractive trees and shrubs framed by an elevated studio/office space with WC and its own veranda. Back in the house, the basement is put to good use by the addition of a large utility room, huge cellar and further WC.
The first floor provides a family bathroom and three double bedrooms including an extra spacious bedroom to the front. Finally, the top floor boasts a grand split-level principal bedroom with ensuite wet-room, feature brickwork chimney breast and Juliet balcony with leafy garden views.
Grayling Road is a wide tree-lined street situated close to leafy Clissold Park and Church Street's impressive array of eateries, independent shops, pubs and coffee bars. There are excellent transport links to The City and West End with numerous good bus routes and trains from Stoke Newington Station (Overground) to Liverpool Street in under fifteen minutes.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Located on the fifth floor of No. 9 Long Street, this two-bedroom apartment with a 281 Sqft private terrace combines the charm and character of the renovated former warehouse with a sleek and modern interior. Featuring an expanse of wall-to-wall Crittall windows, high-quality oak engineered hardwood timber flooring throughout, bespoke Italian kitchen by Poliform Varenna, Waterworks family bathroom, and integrated comfort cooling, this property is the epitome of the Shoreditch loft-style apartment.

Set back from the bustling intersection of Old Street and Shoreditch High Street, in a peaceful enclave, Long & Waterson is a gated development that has been designed to capture the unique aesthetic of Shoreditch. Drawing on the heritage of the site, which was originally a collection of artisan workshops, the development offers an unrivaled range of homes and on-site facilities.

Long & Waterson offers residents a quiet sanctuary in the heart of Shoreditch, with beautifully landscaped gardens, a High Line-inspired sundeck and podium and a luscious living wallscape by Alexandra Steed urban. The development is serviced by a 24-hour concierge and luxurious waiting area. In addition, a residents Library provides quiet work and meeting space. The private residents gym benefits from state-of-the-art equipment and floor-to-ceiling windows which bathe the space in light and provide views across the landscaped sunken garden. A bookable spa treatment room, wet and dry saunas and intimate residents' cinema offer space to relax and unwind.

Izaki Group Investments is a global real estate development company, with over 60 years' experience, who specialize in design-led developments that create considered communities by delivering best-in-class specification and residents' amenities.

N.B - All photography is of the show apartments at Long & Waterson Apartments.

address: Landmark Heights, 172 Daubeney Road, London E5
detailedDescription:
Boasting fantastic views across Hackney Marshes is this well presented and spacious two-bedroom apartment moments from Chatsworth Road.

Set on the seventeenth floor of this popular purpose built development, the property comprises a hallway entrance with storage area, master bedroom, a further double bedroom, a good sized modern kitchen, bathroom, and a large reception area leading to a balcony boasting exceptional views east towards the Olympic Park.

Landmark Heights is a gated development that benefits from secure private parking available to rent or buy, 24-hour concierge and a private gymnasium. Located just a stone's throw from the open green spaces of Hackney Marshes and the River Lea, popular amongst cyclists and runners. The ever-changing Chatsworth Road is also close to hand. Bus links allow for swift access to Hackney Central and beyond, whilst Homerton Overground offers direct links to transport hubs, including Stratford and Highbury & Islington. An ideal first purchase and/or investment.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Defoe Road, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
A renovated one bedroom flat offering stress-free village-living in one of North London’s most treasured neighbourhoods.

Brickworks Says

This fresh, one bedroom flat is simply and effectively laid out and is found in a dream Stoke Newington location. Part of a mid-century block, the current owner has renovated the space to create a modern and stylish home, replacing the kitchen and bathroom and adding some lovely touches such as solid wood floors, slate tiles and wooden worktops.

Mere steps from Church Street and its cafes, restaurants and independent stores, this is the ideal spot for soaking up Stokey’s village vibes (and being first in the queue for a table at your favourite spot for brunch). Much-loved Clissold Park and Abney Park act as back gardens, only a few minutes away by foot. And with Stoke Newington Overground station a short walk away, this is a comfortable base for hopping around North/East London when you need to venture further afield.

The Owners Say

Defoe Road was my first flat purchase and experience living alone, and I absolutely relished the time I spent here. I had lived in Hackney for years with friends, but moved up to Stoke Newington when I bought, as I loved the village-y feel it offered. The flat is so perfectly placed by Church Street.

This was my bolthole and escape from the world, but also had everything I could possibly want on the doorstep; loads of great pubs - The Londesborough for the best roasts and the Clarence literally steps away, great restaurants like The Good Egg at the end of the road, and Wholefoods, where I could spend hours (and lots of money!) buying late suppers or salads to take to Clissold Park in the summer. I did yoga round the corner, and when I wanted to get away, the trusty 73 bus would have me in Islington in 15-20 minutes, for a bit more action. It's still my favourite bit of London and the flat holds nothing but great memories.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current energy rating of C.

In the Borough of Hackney, the property falls into the Council Tax Band B (£1,246 in 2021/21).

One of a block of 13 flats, the property is leasehold with 88 years remaining.

There is a monthly service charge of £64.47, which includes the yearly ground rent of £9.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

The Legal Bit

While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

address: Clissold Court, Greenway Close, London N4
detailedDescription:
Located in a peaceful no through road next to Clissold Park, this bright first floor flat is set within the iconic 1930s low rise blocks sharing a large, well maintained, colourful garden boasting a fish pond & fountain.The apartment is modern & bright throughout with large windows in all rooms giving leafy views from reception & bedroom. It has a modern fitted kitchen, a large reception room, wooden floors & there is a resident caretaker on site. It benefits from a long 129 year lease & no chain. Ideal for first time buyer or a pied a terre.

Situation
Ideally located for excellent transport with numerous buses, Manor House (Piccadilly line) Finsbury Park (Victoria & Piccadilly lines) & Arsenal station all within easy walking distance. Church Street with its eclectic mix of restaurants, shops & bars is in one direction with a nature reserve offering peaceful walks, wild swimming, sailing & rock climbing in the other direction. Upper St, Hoxton and Shoreditch is in easy reach offering an array of attractions & vibrant night life.
