title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £875,000 to £895,000

Rare to the market four bedroom period maisonette located on the top two floors and over 1,164 Square Feet.

The current owners have tastefully and carefully refurbished every aspect of the property to emphasise the underlying key features of the property.

The reception room is one of the main draws to the property with high ceilings and windows flooding the space with natural light and offers ample space for a dining table making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

The master bedroom is also located on this floor and can be used as another reception room depending on your requirements.

The kitchen is fully integrated with all your everyday mod cons and allows access to the private terrace.

There is also a separate WC on this floor suiting young families.

On the third floor there is a further three double bedrooms, family bathroom and second bathroom.

The size and finish is unique for the area and others options for all walks of life.

Location;

Moments from an array of everyday amenities on Stoke Newington High Street, and Stamford Hill.

Alongside this, there are several award-winning bars and restaurants. Church Street and Clissold Park are both within walking distance, offering more boutique shops and coffee shops.

A short walk from Abney Park, Hackney Downs Park and Woodberry Wetlands that has activities from rock climbing to sailing.

Transport;

Stoke Newington, Rectory Road and Clapton Overground Stations are all a short walk away that will take you to Liverpool Street within 15 minutes.

Manor House, Seven Sisters and Finsbury Park Underground Stations are a short bus journey away for quick routes to Central London in under 30 mins.

Ideal for first-time buyers and those looking to upsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

Inset stainless steel sink basin with a drainer and mixer tap and an integrated oven with a countertop hob and overhead extractor system. Space and plumbing for appliances and a double glazed window.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

address: Dekker House, Dalston Square, London E8
detailedDescription:
Situated on the fourth floor of a secure modern development is this stunning three-bedroom apartment.

Boasting over 1,000 square feet of space, the living/reception area is the perfect entertaining space thanks to the open-plan flow and excellent natural light from the floor-to-ceiling windows. A standout feature of this apartment is a private east-facing balcony which offers the perfect spot for a morning coffee. There is a modern kitchen complete with integrated appliances alongside a designated dining area. All three bedrooms are larger than average with the master benefitting from en-suite facilities. The main bathroom is well-proportioned and stylish, and the apartment has been well-maintained by the current owner. Further benefits include a utility closet and ample storage throughout. Offered chain free.

Residents of Dalston Square are able to make use of the 24-hour concierge service, communal roof terrace and residents’ gymnasium. The development is perfectly located with easy access to the restaurants, bars and markets of Kingsland Road, Broadway Market, and Colombia Road. Also within walking distance are east London’s green spaces including Clissold Park, London Fields and Victoria Park. Within the square itself is a café, library, nursery and primary school. Shoreditch, Islington and the City are on your doorstep, with numerous and frequent bus routes. Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland Stations are moments away, providing access into Central London in under 30 minutes.

A spacious five bedroom, bricked terraced house set within a beautiful three storey Victorian building, located in the heart of Hackney Central is now available to buy.

The property features high ceilings throughout, many original features as the current owner has not done any work for a few years.

A spacious entrance, two reception rooms which lead to the garden. In addition, there may be the option for a loft conversion subject to planning permission and freeholder consent.

Perfect for first time buyers and/or investors who are looking to add value by adding some cosmetic work and/or possible planning in order to convert into apartments.
The house has not had any work done for over 20 years, so it holds many of its features, which can be reused when renovating.

Houses on this road range from £1.5M to £1.7M/£2M.

Location

Located moments from Hackney Central Station, this property is ideal for first time buyers looking for a thriving location where local amenities are close by including some great coffee shops, restaurants and entertainment venues, located on Graham road, this property is perfectly placed for the amenities of Hackney Central, London Fields and offers easy access to Dalston, The City and West End.

detailedDescription:
Stamp duty holiday extension - Continue your search for the perfect property with JLL and benefit from the same incredible stamp duty savings previously offered by the government, up to £15,000.

A two-bedroom, two-bathroom apartment offering 840 sq ft of well-appointed living space and a winter garden in The Makers.

The Makers is a residential development of 175 new homes, including studios, two and three-bedroom apartments and family duplexes. Tucked away from City Road, between the vibrancy and dynamism of the Shoreditch area and the financial district of the City of London, the location provides a quiet retreat within the capital. Residents will benefit from a generous provision of private communal facilities including a screening room, two landscaped garden terraces, a gym, a treatment room and three lounges, perfect for ad-hoc meetings.

A breathtaking double-height entrance lobby hosts a 24/7 concierge, providing peace of mind, secure mail and delivery services, and access to bookable facilities. With interior design by Woods Bagot, the material palette takes inspiration from the 1920s – a stunning feature wall, terrazzo flooring, bespoke lighting, custom furniture, brass details and smoked oak chevron floors set the tone for what is to follow.

The apartments have been designed for modern living, making the most of the architectural merits of the building. Smoked oak front doors with unlacquered brass door handles open into the spacious apartments. Those in the tower part of the building feature floor-to-ceiling picture windows to maximise magnificent views of the city, while south-facing windows in the Nile Street podium apartments bathe them in natural light. The majority of the Nile Street apartments have open balconies accessed directly from the living areas, while the top floor family duplexes have large private landscaped roof gardens offering an enviable inside-outside connection that is rare in the heart
of the city.

Regsiter your interest today

address: Buckingham Road, De Beauvoir, Hackney, London N1
detailedDescription: A unique, gated, low level three double bedroom, two bathroom freehold, benefitting from a sunny and secluded courtyard garden, enviably positioned within the heart of De Beauvoir, moments from the sought after amenities of Southgate Road. Accommodation is well arranged and cleverly designed comprising; a courtyard garden leading to a dining area via bi-folding doors, as well as the principal bathroom suite, double bedroom, and kitchen which benefits from high ceilings and is flooded in natural light. The spacious, separate reception room is positioned on the split level of the ground floor. There are two double bedrooms on the top floor, both of which feature vaulted ceilings, with the principal benefitting from an en-suite shower room. This is a special house that must be viewed to be appreciated. Buckingham Road is quietly tucked away in De Beauvoir and conveniently located for access to the trains at both Dalston/ Kingsland and Dalston Junction, which forms part of the London Overground network, whilst a plethora of shops, bars and restaurants can be found locally, such as the renowned De Beauvoir Deli. For those wishing to travel by bus, Kingsland Road, Southgate Road and Essex Road provide a number of good routes, with the delights of vibrant, trendy Hoxton and Shoreditch just a short journey away, as are the National Rail, Northern Line trains of Angel Islington and Victoria Line trains of Highbury & Islington.

This beautiful one bedroom flat in the heart of E5 is a property for all seasons. Light and bright in the Spring and Summer thanks to the beautiful sash windows, it’s also the perfect place to hunker down in the depths of Winter, when the lustre of the parquet wood flooring will add to the feeling of warmth as you settle down for an evening in with the latest Scandi Noir drama. title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Full description A great deal of love, care and attention has been lavished on this apartment, with the kitchen, bathroom and décor all having been re-done by the current owners. The front door to this dwelling leads to the second bedroom on lower level well away from the rest of the accommodation for privacy.

The upper level is comprised of a lounge diner, with recently fitted kitchen with butler sink. The feel is almost rustic giving this lovely property a homely and comfortable feel. There are many lovely touches that have to be seen to be appreciated, for example a narrow Crittal style window at the top of the kitchen through to the hallway letting the light in.

A short flight of stairs leads to the bathroom, metro tiled and recently fitted. It is notable that the loft space is demised to the flat rather than to the Freehold which may make it easier for a loft conversion to be done. The owners have also investigated pushing out to the rear and creating a roof terrace.

Situaton and tenurei This dwelling lies in the popular top section of Wilberforce Road. Victoria, Piccadilly and Overground lines are all within walking distance. To the East, Clissold Park and Stoke Newington beckon, offering an eclectic array of amenities and plenty of green space. To the South, Highbury Barn is a short walk, and Islington just beyond. There is a good range of local amenities, eateries and boutiques - Blighty Coffee, Yard Sale Pizza, Salvation In Noodles and many more.

The property enjoys a Share of the Freehold, and maintenance costs are shared between the owners

address: Long & Waterson Apartments, 7 Long Street, Hackney, London E2
detailedDescription:
An exceptionally well proportioned 3rd floor, 1 bedroom apartment located in the heart of Shoreditch, E2.

Description

Set back from the bustling intersection of Old Street and Shoreditch High Street, in a peaceful enclave, Long & Waterson is a gated development which has been designed to capture the unique aesthetic of Shoreditch. Drawing on the heritage of the site, which was originally a collection of artisan workshops, the development offers an unrivalled range of homes and on-site facilities.

Located on the 3rd floor of the Waterson Building, this 1 bedroom apartment features high quality oak engineered hardwood timber flooring throughout, bespoke Italian kitchen by Poliform Varenna, Waterworks family bathroom and integrated comfort cooling. The newly built Waterson Building takes cues from its architectural surroundings, with large windows and an industrial chic feel which, combined with the carefully considered interior, reflects the urban feel synonymous with Shoreditch.

Long & Waterson offers residents a quiet sanctuary in the heart of Shoreditch, with beautifully landscaped gardens, a High Line-inspired sundeck and podium and luscious living wallscape by Alexandra Steed urban. The development is serviced by a 24-hour concierge and luxurious waiting area. In addition, a residents Library provides quiet work and meeting space. The private residents gym benefits from state-of-the-art equipment and floor-to-ceiling windows which bathe the space in light and provide views across the landscaped sunken garden. A bookable spa treatment room, wet and dry saunas and intimate residents' cinema offer space to relax and unwind.

Izaki Group Investments are a global real estate development company, with over 60 years' experience, who specialise in design-led developments that create considered communities by delivering best-in-class specification and residents' amenities.

Square Footage: 653 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 997 years remaining
title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
** guide price £700,000 - £715,000 **

Spacious and characterful maisonette over the upper floors of a late Georgian period property with original features, its own front door and access to a south facing roof terrace and garden.

The property also offers huge potential for extension to the 2nd bedroom and into the loft subject to the necessary consents.

The property is situated in the De Beauvoir Conservation area, enviably located on the border of Dalston and Islington a stone’s throw away from plentiful array of amenities, whilst the delights of Upper Street, Broadway market, London Fields and Church Street are within walking distance.

For transport links Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland Overground are both no more than a 5 minute walk away, providing fast links to The West End and Canary Wharf. As well as this, there are a number of frequent bus routes running along Balls Pond Road itself.

Highbury & Islington Station (Victoria Line, National Rail) is only just over 1 mile away .

The accommodation briefly comprises of its own entrance on the raised ground into the hallway with a large inbuilt under stair storage cupboard.

The reception room has feature full height double windows with stripped wooden shutters, original fireplace and wood flooring. A large square arch takes you into a superbly fitted kitchen/diner with a comprehensive range of wall, base and drawer units with quartz work tops and quartz flooring with underfloor heating.

Off the entrance hallway stairs lead you up to a fully glazed door onto a large and sunny south facing roof terrace and stairs down to the rear section of garden.

On the 1st floor there are 2 double bedrooms and a recently refurbished bathroom suite with Victorian style fitments and quartz wall tiles.

To book a viewing instantly of this spacious maisonette just visit our website or download our award winning app

detailedDescription:
Accommodation comprises entrance hall with wood effect flooring (evident through much of the property) leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing and dining, and direct access onto a pleasant private balcony with far-reaching views. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. To the upper floor, there are two well sized double bedrooms, plus a modern family bathroom with white three piece suite.

The property is superbly located just a short distance from Homerton station, with Hackney Wick and Hackney stations also within easy reach, as well as Stratford and Stratford International stations for unrivalled cross-London and inter-city connections. This new development is perfectly located within one of London's most creatively dynamic and culturally vibrant boroughs, Shoreditch is the ultimate destination for modern city living. Within walking distance of the City, the area is also superbly connected to the rest of London and beyond.

Great transport links are another reason why living at Shoreditch is so convenient. Shoreditch Station is on the doorstep, easily connecting you to major transport hubs. Liverpool Street is within walking distance and provides easy access to the new Crossrail line.

From Michelin stars to rustic chic, there is something to excite every palette.

Shoreditch is within close proximity to an abundance of green spaces that provide a calming escape from the buzz and energy of the city. Regent’s Canal is a ten-minute walk with colourful cafés on its banks, and leads to historic Victoria Park, while Hackney City Farm brings the countryside into your life.

address: Apartment 8.06, The Arc, City Road, London EC1V
detailedDescription:
This stunning two bedroom apartment is located on the 8th floor of The Arc in Shoreditch and measures 704 sq ft. Alongside a spacious master suite, it benefits from a 60 sq ft balcony and wonderful dual-aspect views.

The Arc is a collection of 100 apartments, just five minutes' walk from Old Street station.

The interiors have been beautifully designed by the award-winning Bowler James Brindley and floor-to-ceiling windows mean the apartments are flooded with light.

Residents will benefit from an exclusive collection of amenities, making The Arc a perfect investment. Amenities include a landscaped 7th-floor terrace, yoga studio, cinema room, golf simulator, residents' lounge and a fitness suite.

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many virtual viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

*Please note that the CGIs used are for illustrative purposes only

Located in the heart of Tech City, The Arc is just a short walk to both Shoreditch and Islington. From Old Street station, Bank and King's Cross are just 3 minutes and 5 minutes away by tube, respectively.

detailedDescription:
Stunning 15th floor penthouse apartment occupying the top three floors of Dalston’s premier development.

Offering unencumbered panoramic views across London, this property benefits from a spectacular roof terrace in addition to a full-width curved balcony. The living space offers brilliant natural light thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows, whilst the kitchen is of excellent specification throughout with plush appliances. Both bedrooms are of a generous size and offer access to the balcony as well as en-suite facilities. Further benefits include an additional bathroom and ample storage throughout. Residents can also make use of the on-site concierge service alongside access to the well-kept communal gardens.

57 East is perfectly positioned in the heart of Dalston with residents being able to enjoy the plethora of amenities the high street has to offer. The east London hotspots of London Fields, Stoke Newington and Shoreditch are all close by whilst Upper Street is a short walk away. Both Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland are within striking distance of the property and offer swift access into Shoreditch and Islington. There are numerous and frequent bus routes directly into the City and West End. Offered chain free.

agency_name: Notting Hill Genesis - Heron Quarter at Woodberry Down- shared ownership
detailedDescription:
If you've been inspired by our new show home, for a limited time only, reserve a home at Heron Quarter and indulge in a shopping spree at John Lewis worth £2,000!*

Our expert teams are online and on call to guide you through a virtual viewing of your chosen development and answer any questions you might have about it. Once your virtual viewing is complete you will then be able to book your private appointment to safely view in person.

Heron Quarter offers a new collection of 2 bedroom apartments available with Shared Ownership situated in the much sought-after Woodberry Down development. With a spectacular setting facing the West Reservoir - now an exhilarating sailing lake and panoramic views of the London skyline, it's hard to believe Heron Quarter is only a short journey to King's Cross on the underground.

This tranquil selection of new homes has been designed as an oasis of calm, every inch of each apartment has been carefully considered to make the best of natural light and space. Each luxury apartment offers the finest in modern open-plan living, with high quality fixtures and fittings and a private outdoor space. Directly outside of Heron Quarter you will find a peaceful courtyard garden where there are plenty of places to sit and relax.

Ready to move in now! Book your viewing appointment today.

Price Breakdown**
Full market value: £620,000
Share percentage: 25%
Shared Price: £155,000
Deposit Required: £15,500
Estimated monthly mortgage: £736
Estimated monthly rent: £969
Estimated monthly Service charge: £261
Total monthly payments: £1,966

Location

Located just a few minutes' walk from Manor House underground station, there is no better place to explore what the City has to offer. You can enjoy direct links via the Piccadilly line to King's Cross St Pancras, the West End and easy journeys to Heathrow Airport, plus incredibly quick travel to the City. The development is also just a convenient short walk to Highbury and Islington station which is served by the London Overground, connecting you easily to Shoreditch High Street, Canary Wharf, Stratford and many more locations.

Specification

Interior Finishes

• Oak wood effect flooring in kitchen and living area

• Smooth finished ceilings emulsioned in white to complement the white emulsioned finish of the interior walls

• Painted satin wood colour internal doors

• Traditional opening hinged doors onto balconies

• Communal gas fired heating system serving white radiators with individual thermostatic controls

• Low energy LED white downlighters to kitchen / bathroom and en-suites

Bedroom

• Eminence smoky mountain carpeting

Kitchen

• Contemporary matt cappuccino units

• Bronze black laminate worktops

• Electric ceramic hob

• Splashback in white toughened back painted glass

• Built in electric oven and grill

• Integrated fridge freezer

• 1.5 stainless steel sink with drainer

• Compartmental recycling bins

• Freestanding washer dryer in separate utility cupboard (where shown on plans)

En-suite & Bathroom

• Roca White bath panel with glass screen

• Light grey matt wall and floor tiles

• Roca Laura hand basin and Hansgrohe chrome mixer tap

• Floor mounted white WC

• Shower with fitted clear glass screen and step in shower tray (where shown on plans)

• Adjustable wall mounted chrome shower head

• Polished chrome accessories

• Feature mirror above basin and shaver socket

Living Area / Master Bedroom

• Media plate inclusive of 2 double sockets

• TV points

• Satellite points

• Telephone points

Balcony

• Upper floor terraces and balconies featuring aluminium decking and powder coated handrails with glazing.

Communal Areas

• Landscaped courtyard

• Passenger lifts located within entrance lobby

• Tiled communal entrance hall and carpet floor finish to communal corridors

• Cycle storage

• CCTV

• Audio visual door entry system

What is Shared Ownership?
Shared Ownership is a government backed scheme allowing you to buy a share in a property from 25% to 75% of the full market value and pay a subsidised rent on the remainder. Because you only have to put down a deposit on the share you buy, you won't need to save as much for a deposit as you would if you were buying outright. **Affordability and eligibility criteria applies.

***Images and CGIs are for illustrative purposes only.

*Offer available on selected two bedroom plots only subject to availability. Terms and conditions apply, contact our team for details. Offer is for £2000 worth of John Lewis vouchers given on completion of sale only. Reservation fee must be paid by 07/06/2021. Offer only valid if exchange deadline as agreed with Notting Hill Genesis is agreed and completion is before/on 16/07/2021. No cash alternative. Offer may be removed or changed at any time.

detailedDescription:
Join us for the Property Launch on Saturday 26th June 2021 - call now to secure your viewing slot!

In excess of 2,300 sq. Ft., this substantial family home offers space to grow into, boasting excellent proportions and retaining a wealth of original charm. Having been fully remodelled by the current owners, the house is complete with a stylish finish, too.

Spanning three full storeys, the property offers a huge master bedroom with bespoke wardrobes, four further ample double bedrooms and two well-appointed bathrooms. There is a gorgeous through-reception on the ground floor, with original flooring, cornicing, rosette and bay window, plus a fully extended kitchen/diner, with sleek bi-fold doors that lead out to the leafy and secluded rear garden. Additional benefits include a WC on the ground floor, a huge cellar space, wood-sash double glazing throughout, and a landscaped front garden.

Foulden Road is a brilliant location, with a fantastic sense of community, having annual street parties and a resident's WhatsApp group. It's also close to popular Hackney Downs, and near to super speedy transport links serving the City and Central London. Hackney Downs Studios are just a short walk (a real hidden gem), and the eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along Stokey High Street, Church Street and surrounding Dalston are all within easy reach. This perfect property also falls within catchment of outstanding local primary (including Shacklewell Primary) and secondary schools, too.

Offers in Excess of £1,450,000.

A classic Victorian four bedroom house of over 1900 sqft internally, retaining many original features, set on this quiet leafy side turning, on a sought-after residential street in the heart of Lower Clapton.

This deceptively spacious, characterful four bedroom property would make an excellent family home and has a great location within minutes of Clapton Pond and the wide open spaces of Lea Valley Park, Hackney Downs Park as well as being within the catchment area for some excellent local schools rated 'good' to 'outstanding'

Although the house needs some updating, it has retained much of the sought after original detail that many of these properties lose over the years, including high ceilings, some fine original period fireplaces with marble surrounds and ceiling cornice to the principal rooms.

For easy access into the City, nearby Clapton station is just 4 stops and takes around 15 minutes into into London's Liverpool Street.

detailedDescription:
Substantial Grade II listed family home

Location

Located on a quiet garden square, there are plenty of local amenities, a gym, swimming pool, supermarkets, and independents close by. Near to the square, there are some of Hackney's finest restaurants, cafes, and eateries, together with Chatsworth Road Market which is 0.5 miles away. Hackney Central and Hackney Downs stations are conveniently located approx. 0.5 miles away.

Description

Savills are delighted to offer on to the market this incredibly charming Grade II listed family home which forms part of a handsome Georgian terrace and enjoys an enviable location, overlooking a pretty garden square. Internally the house is very light. It retains many period features and benefits from high ceilings, working shutters, ornate fireplaces, and large sash windows throughout. The house boasts a magnificent fully enclosed garden to the rear.

Accommodation: Double reception room on the raised ground floor along with a bathroom and separate fitted kitchen with direct access to the rear garden. There are seven double bedrooms and a family bathroom over the first, second, and third floors. The lower ground floor benefits from an additional entrance and offers three further bedrooms and a shower room.

Square Footage: 3334 sq ft

title: 10 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A charming three bedroom 1860s Victorian terraced home located by London Fields. The property totals near 1,500 sq ft across two floors plus cellar. The ground floor is home to a brilliantly bright reception space with wooden flooring, original sash bay window with shutters, coving, and marble fireplace. This space flows through to an open plan kitchen and dining area with stone flooring heated under foot, island, and built in Siemans appliances. The skylights and glass doors to the rear garden are in keeping with the architect’s mandate to keep the space free flowing while maximising green views and natural light. The garden reaches 52ft and is laid to lawn with separate patio and decked areas. The first floor offers three double bedrooms and a family bathroom finished in limestone with under floor heating. The principal bedroom boasts the original wooden flooring, stained black. You are in close proximity to Gayhurst Road Primary School and within the catchment area of several, Ofsted Outstanding, primary schools.

Situation
London Fields is one of London’s most desirable green open spaces moments from your front door. Hackney offers grand period homes ideal for family living close to amenities and transport. Local attractions include Broadway Market, Hackney Empire and Columbia Road Flower Market. Transport links can be found at Dalston junction and London Fields.

detailedDescription:
*** This property is EWS1 compliant. A certificate can be provided upon request.

A unique, wonderfully bright and extremely spacious duplex level penthouse apartment set within the iconic Royle Building.

Measuring approximately 1,694 square feet, this beautifully presented apartment is the largest in the development and boasts a far reaching west facing view across the Wenlock basin, canal and beyond through floor to ceiling glass doors and windows.

Comprising a vast reception area leading to a private terrace, generous separate kitchen/dining area with double height ceilings and a tall southerly aspect window, study/third bedroom, downstairs bathroom, WC and a number of useful storage spaces.

Stairs lead up to two double bedrooms, both of which enjoy gallery views over the reception and can be cleverly divided off with glass sliding doors to enable privacy, a rarity for mezzanine level lofts. The master bedroom further benefits from a large walk-in wardrobe and en-suite bathroom.

Formerly a print works factory, the impressive Royle building enjoys a sought-after canal side location in the Wenlock Basin and benefits from a secure entrance system, on-site porter and lift access. A secure parking space is also available with this property.

detailedDescription:
A five/six bedroom semi-detached Victorian family home dating back to the mid-1800s with unique garden and shoffice. Totalling close to 2,600 sq ft across four floors with period features preserved and accentuated. The exterior is striking with yellow brick, black paintwork, pillars and grand steps to the entrance. The raised ground floor boasts a double reception room with fire places, wood flooring, coving, original internal doors and sash windows with shutters. There is access to a terrace from this floor. The lower ground floor is home to a guest area with family bathroom and separate entrance, the floor is complete with an open plan kitchen and dining space. This leads you through to the south facing rear garden which is undoubtedly the jewel in the crown. A unique space reaching near 60ft in length with a 70ft width. It was originally two gardens and so offers ample potential. There is a shoffice too, complete with shower room, an additional work from home/studio space or further guest area being the most common uses The upper floors house the remaining bedrooms and bathrooms. The top floor has been opened into one impressive room however the space is flexible. There is ample loft storage too. We expect high interest in such a rare proposition and the property can be made available chain free.

Situation
London Fields is one of London’s most desirable green open spaces and is moments from your front door. Hackney has drawn comparisons to New York’s East Village for its gentrification over the last decade. Offering grand period homes ideal for family living close to amenities and transport. Local attractions include Broadway Market, Hackney Empire and Columbia Road Flower Market. Transport links can be found at Dalston junction and London Fields.

Vanquish Real Estate is delighted to offer this well-presented modern one bedroom apartment located on the 6th floor of The Shoreline building of the Woodberry Down development, one of the biggest regeneration projects in the UK.

The apartment contains of one bedroom and one bathroom, an open-plan kitchen/living area and a large private balcony and it comes with allocated parking

A walking distance from Manor House Underground Station.

The Nature Collection invites residents to enjoy the harmony and calmness of uninterrupted nature and City views. Set on the banks of the Woodberry Wetlands, a tranquil, abundant nature reserve, animated by urban wildlife year-round. This is London living of an entirely different nature.
The four buildings that make up the Nature Collection – The Shoreline, Goldcrest, Sandpiper, and Skylark Point – vary in scale from five to 18 floors, offering an array of apartments to suit individual needs. An attractive Residents’ Garden is a prelude to the idyllic parks, and the open water of the Woodberry Wetlands. The beauty of nature is captured at every turn, kindling a remarkable sense of retreat from the City.
Residents will have access to a wealth of communal amenities including, a generous swimming pool and gym within the development. A concierge will connect residents to a wide range of services.

detailedDescription:
This absolutely stunning two bedroom apartment is presented in excellent decorative order and is set on the top floor of a well maintained low rise building that offers 727 sq.ft of internal accommodation. Consisting of a 14'4 reception room, a large separate kitchen, two double bedrooms, allocated parking space and a good sized modern bathroom suite. There is also access to an unofficial south west facing roof terrace with stunning view of London. The flat is set back from the from the road and its positioning making it a very private flat with only two apartments on the top floor, separated by a very wide corridor.

Albion road is a sought after residential street and a short stroll from the area’s many boutique shops, award winning restaurants, coffee shops and pubs. Islington’s Upper Street is a short bus ride away and trendy Dalston is within easy reach. Stoke Newington offers a range of outstanding and good rated primary and secondary schools. For recreation, Clissold Park is just at the end of the street, with its playground, tennis courts, paddling pool, skate park, animal enclosures and Clissold House. Clissold Leisure Centre is nearby and the Shakespeare Walk adventure playground at Butterfield Green is within easy reach. Also within walking distance are Highbury Fields, the West Reservoir and Woodbury Wetlands, with their wildlife, open spaces and play areas.

There are excellent transport links with numerous bus routes along Albion Road, Green Lanes and at Newington Green, including direct to Angel, the West End and the City. Finsbury Park, Highbury and Islington, Arsenal, Rectory Road, Dalston Kingsland & Junction and Canonbury Stations are all within easy reach.

detailedDescription:
Ready to move into - a spacious and light dual-aspect, 3 bedroom apartment located on the 4th floor of Hackney Wick's landmark Bagel Factory development.

Description

Arranged over 1065sq ft, this property offers an expansive south-facing kitchen reception room which opens out onto one of two private balconies, overlooking the internal courtyard.

Finished to an exceptionally high standard, with German engineered Nobilia kitchen and integrated Bosch appliances, the apartment benefits from porcelain tile flooring throughout, zoned underfloor heating and feature brick slip wall to the reception room. Integrated ceiling speakers in the reception room and principal bedroom connect to the Sonos audio system, allowing music to be played and controlled remotely within the apartment.

Three double bedrooms benefit from floor-to-ceiling Crittall windows bathing the rooms in light. Master bedroom offers built-in wardrobes and en-suite, whilst bedrooms two and three open directly onto a separate private terrace. Both family and en-suite bathrooms feature herringbone tiled walls, Roca ironmongery and sanitary ware, with feature industrial lighting.

Located just moments from Hackney Wick Overground Station and 0.4 miles from the greenery of Victoria Park, Bagel Factory boasts best-in-class amenities including residents' gym, 24-hour concierge and beautifully landscaped communal roof gardens. Transport links to Stratford International Station and Highbury & Islington Underground interchange from Hackney Wick Station provide ease of access across London.

Hackney Wick is one of East London's most exciting and vibrant neighborhoods, offering residents a plethora of independent restaurants and bars on the doorstep as well as some of London's finest public parks such as Victoria Park and Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park combined with the peaceful serenity of the River Lea.

detailedDescription:
This fantastic maisonette with a significant private garden is positioned on Stoke Newington’s Albion Road, between Newington Green and Clissold Park. Configured across two expansive floors, the apartment has been the subject of a comprehensive renovation by the current owners, who have opened up the traditional Victorian spaces to create a beautiful open-plan bathed in natural light.

The Tour

The apartment presents a typically Victorian façade to the street, with its London brick and white stucco frontage, large sash windows and two-storey bay window. Access is gained via a private entrance at raised ground level, which opens into an entrance hall that has uninterrupted sightlines through the kitchen, to the garden at the rear of the house.

To one side of the hall, two former reception rooms have been opened up to create a large living room and an adjoining dining room. These spaces are characterised by wonderful levels of natural light, high ceilings, limewashed floorboards and two marble fireplaces. Original cornicing has been preserved, while contemporary shelving and cast-iron radiators have been introduced.

The hallway leads through from this section of the house to a fantastic contemporary kitchen at the rear. Birch ply kitchen units flank each wall, there are Corian worktops and taps by Studio Ore. Beautiful tiles by Bert & May, created in collaboration with The Conran Shop, run underfoot; these lead up to a newly installed set of Fabco steel-framed glazed doors, which open out onto a terrace that overlooks the private garden below. This elevated area acts as an extension of the kitchen in the warmer months and is perfectly positioned for a morning coffee or early evening drinks.

The first floor comprises two large double bedrooms and a bathroom. The main bedroom, positioned at the front of the plan, has built-in wardrobes, two large sash windows and original limewashed floorboards. The second bedroom is currently configured as a home office and nursery; it has views over the garden, as well as built-in wardrobes. The bathroom is calm, tranquil space. It has dark-stained oak parquet flooring, Bert & May tiles, Studio Ore taps, a walk-in shower, concrete sink and a wonderful freestanding bath.

Outdoor Space

The west-facing garden is accessed via a staircase leading down from the kitchen terrace. The garden is large and laid mostly to lawn, offering something of a blank canvas for an enthusiastic gardener. The current owners have set up a seating area at the foot of the garden to capitalise on the sunshine. There is also a patio area on the lower-ground level, perfect for alfresco dining, and a storage shed.

The Area

Albion Road is located within easy reach of the independent shops, cafes, restaurants and pubs of Stoke Newington and Newington Green; Esters and Jolene are particular neighbourhood favourites. Much-loved Church Street is home to The Spence Bakery, Whole Foods and The Good Egg, as well as many other independent businesses. A short walk away is Primeur; recently described as “the perfect neighbourhood restaurant”, it serves modern European cuisine and natural wine.

There are several green spaces nearby; Abney Park & Cemetery and Clissold Park with its tennis courts, cafe, beautiful lakes, and resident deer are local favourites. Stoke Newington is very popular with young families, in part due to the number of good schools in the area. Particularly noteworthy are the Betty Layward Primary and Clissold School.

Canonbury, Dalston Kingsland and Stoke Newington stations are all walkable from Albion Road and run London Overground services to Liverpool Street in around 10 minutes, or Seven Sisters in around four minutes, for connections to the Underground. A number of buses run into central London and the neighbouring Dalston area.

Tenure: Leasehold with Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 976 years remaining
title: 2 bed maisonette for sale

address: John Campbell Road, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love about your home?
I love the large spacious rooms with high ceilings and period features. It has ample outdoor space with a sizeable south facing garden and a good size south facing balcony.

Why are you moving?
This house has a lot of memories and has been in the family for some time, I grew up in this home and so did my children. Now they have grown up, we are looking for a smaller home.

What do you love about the area?
I love this area, it has something to offer everyone, old, young and also families. The area has a combination of both old and new and has many tree lined residential streets. The property is in the Stoke Newington area and borders both Islington and Dalston. There are many different shops and local amenities, including the Rio Cinema which is just at the top of the Road and a local library. There are excellent comprehensive schools, brilliant transport links, Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland Stations are both within walking distance. Kingsland High Street is full of neighbourhood coffee shops, restaurants and eclectic eateries. The area is very vibrant and has something to offer everyone.

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs rising to the first floor and further access down to the under-hall basement, leading into the bright and spacious double length reception room with attractive bay window and two attractive feature fireplaces. To the rear of the property, the separate kitchen enjoys direct access out onto the decked private garden. The kitchen area itself comprises a range of matching wooden wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor, electric oven, and further space for appliances. To the first floor, there are two well proportioned bedrooms, each with inbuilt storage, plus a generous family bathroom with three piece bath suite and walk-in shower unit, plus adjacent separate WC. To the second floor, there are a further two double bedrooms, again with inbuilt storage, plus access from the landing onto a private terrace with roof-top views.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Dalston Junction, Dalston Kingsland and Canonbury stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Nearby Kingsland High Road offers an array of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, all within just a short distance from the property, with nearby Butterfield Green, Hackney Downs Park and lovely Clissold Park providing beautiful open spaces. Stoke Newington is also within easy access offering a further array of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

address: Britannia Building, 12 Ebenezer Street, London N1
detailedDescription:
This wonderfully bright two-bedroom duplex is set over the first and second floor of this former live/work building in the heart of rapidly growing Tech City. There is a generous hallway with guest WC which leads into an dual aspect open plan reception which attracts a lot of natural light and has 2.7 meter high ceilings as well wood flooring throughout. The galley kitchen is well equipped with plenty of storage and has its own window for natural ventilation. The master bedroom also has dual aspect as well as built in wardrobes and en suite where the adjacent second double bedroom is currently used as guest bedroom and home office by the current owners.

The Britannia Building is located on Ebenezer Street, N1 is a ‘close knit’ residential block where many of the existing residents still live in the building since the building was first converted ten years ago. Ebenezer Street has recently been blocked off to through traffic creating a more residential feel which is part of Hackney’s ‘greening’ policy to introduce more pedestrian and cycling areas in the local borough. Old Street Station is only a five minute walk where Shoreditch and Hoxton are within the immediate vicinity offering an array of bars, cafés and restaurants. The Regents Canal is also nearby providing a very popular pedestrian and cycling route towards Angel and Kings Cross as well as Broadway Market and Victoria Park to the East. The weekly flower market on Columbia Road, E2 is only 15 mins walk while the Barbican Centre and Exmouth food Market are eighteen and twenty four minutes respectively in the opposite direction.

The City is within easy walking distance where bus routes are plentiful, southbound towards Moorgate from City Road and northerly towards Kings Cross and St Pancras (12 mins) offering local national and international destinations.

detailedDescription:
Well presented, light and spacious one double bedroom fourth floor flat with private balcony affording superb far-reaching views. Enviably located just a short walk from fashionable shops, amenities and lovely Clissold Park, the property provides bright, well proportioned accommodation with stylish interiors throughout. Features include an impressive dual aspect open plan reception/quality fitted kitchen, modern family bathroom, gas central heating, double glazing, wood effect flooring and ample inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with inbuilt storage, leading into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen with direct access onto the delightful enclosed private balcony and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There is a well sized double bedroom, with inbuilt wardrobes, plus a stylish family bathroom with white three piece suite and elegant tiling.

The property is very conveniently located close to beautiful Clissold Park, and within easy reach of Arsenal, Drayton Park, Canonbury and Highbury & Islington stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes linking the surrounding area. There are also an array of fashionable local amenities, shops, bars and restaurants within just a short distance, with Stoke Newington also close by.

address: Stone Studios, 80-84 Wallis Road, Hackney Wick E9
detailedDescription:
Situated just moment's away from Victoria Park & Queen Elizabeth Park, this spectacular three bedroom apartment is arranged over the 4th & 5th floor and boasts a large private terrace.

Description

Built on the site of a former metal works, Stone Studios is a micro neighbourhood of five distinctive buildings, just 0.1 miles from Hackney Wick Station.

The development features 110 expansive, light-filled apartments above shared creative workspaces, a café, gallery and a courtyard.

Homes at Stone Studios have been designed for comfortable, luxury loft-style living, with floor to ceiling windows, private outside space, high spec kitchens and flexible, free-flow living space.

Stone Studios benefits from having some of London's best green spaces nearby, including Victoria Park, Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, and Hackney Marshes.

Hackney Wick is home to many aspiring young artists, musicians and creatives, making it a vibrant and diverse community to live in. 'The Wick' is fast becoming one of London's most important work and cultural hubs.

With its array of independent cafes, trendy restaurants and eateries, and some of London's best breweries and canal-side bars, you'll be spoilt for choice when exploring your new neighbourhood.

Stone Studios offers direct access to Hackney Wick Overground station, with 16 arrivals and departures per hour, bringing the rest of the city into easy reach.

Square Footage: 1118 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 998 years remaining

title: 3 bed end terrace house for sale

detailedDescription:
An artfully appointed and beautifully bright two bedroom apartment on the second floor of a sought-after Art Deco development built around communal gardens and with a parade of shops just below. It's all sat in the heart of Clapton, surrounded by green spaces and the lively locale's bustling nightlife.

You have a communal balcony with lovely views across the borough, from treetops to rooftops. The perfect spot to enjoy a morning coffee or mix with your neighbours.

If you lived here…

You'll be revelling in delightfully sumptuous Design & Decor from the start, with rich vintage fittings and striking designer touches throughout. Your 220 square foot kitchen/lounge is a particular highlight, with rich dark engineered oak underfoot and a cream Corian breakfast bar and matching work surfaces. Lounge walls are a striking statement red while your kitchen's sleek in matt cream units.

Stroll round the corner and into your first bedroom, a lovely double currently in use as a second reception, with a statement wall matching the floorboards. Bedroom two's every bit as characterful, with blonde laminate underfoot and integrated floor-to-ceiling storage finished in eye-catching purple. Finally, head back into your hallway, itself nicely spacious with some handy incidental space, and your bathroom's on the right. Pristine in pure white from head to foot.

Outside, and Clapton station is a mere two minute walk and will get you directly to Liverpool Street in eleven, putting the City less than a quarter hour away door-to-door. Heading to the West End? Walthamstow Central is just two stops and six minutes in the other direction for a quick swap to the Victoria line. You also have secure residents parking, and drivers can be speeding out of London on the A10 in just seven minutes.

What else?

- Millfields Park is just three minutes away for morning jogs and evening strolls, and you also have a fine choice of natural spaces within easy reach; Hackney Downs Park and Hackney Marshes are both within walking distance.
- The development has secure bike storage and a two wheeled ride will open up vast swathes of East London to you, putting the hearts of Dalston and Hackney less than ten minutes away.
- Local legends The Crooked Billet and Clapton Hart are both just moments away, while closer still you have The Tram Depot for delicious Sunday Roasts. Alternatively find out what all the rave reviews for Biddle Bros (half a mile on foot) are all about or check out the sumptuously innovative surroundings of the Clapton Country Club, just two minutes round the corner. There's so much to explore...

Bedroom (3.89m x 3.70m (12'9" x 12'1"))

Bathroom

Kitchen/Reception Room (4.84m x 4.32m (15'10" x 14'2"))

Bedroom (3.31m x 4.32m (10'10" x 14'2"))

A word from the owner...

"We have been very happy living here over the past 8 years. We fell in love with the art deco building immediately, not to mention the huge amount of light in our flat, which is even better since we renovated. It really has been the best of both worlds, with exceptional transport options into town including great cycle links (we have two bikes in our communal shed), endless café, bar and restaurant options, and an epic amount of green space right on our doorstep. Our daily dog walk begins at Millfields Park (only two minutes away), with the marshes, Springfield Park and the riverside pubs and shops of Chatsworth Road only a stroll beyond. We also love to hang out with our Stokey friends in Hackney Downs, Abney Park Cemetery and Clissold Park. We won’t be moving far, but no doubt will still be frequenting two of the top pubs in East London: The huge, utterly hipster
Clapton Hart and the cosy Crooked Billet, with the best beer garden in the capital."

address: Wyles House, Prodigal Square, Hackney Gardens, London E8
detailedDescription:
Surrounded by greenery, lies this three bedroom, apartment with balcony overlooking the gardens and church, in recently completed development, Hackney Gardens.

Its, considered, layout maximizes the space, creating the illusion of a house. The apartment offers extensive storage throughout and includes built-in Siemens appliances, underfloor heating, engineered oak flooring, LED lighting, video entry system and daytime concierge.

Hackney Gardens is a collection of 58 luxury apartments surrounded by landscaped pathways and gardens, in the grounds of an 18th Century Church, moments from Hackney Central Overground.

The apartments are split between two new buildings, Wyles House and Blackburn House, which are situated off Prodigal Square, a new, semi-public space at the heart of the development. Here a new community center, focused on arts-based projects has been created.

Situated next door and soon to be restored to its former glory by Es Devlin and John Pawson is St John-at-Hackney church. Dating back to 1792, it has a capacity of 2,000 so unsurprisingly, it doubles up as a concert venue for the likes of Ed Sheeran, Coldplay, Emeli Sandé, Elbow, Florence & The Machine and international DJs.

Hackney Gardens, offers an abundance of choice. Be it London Fields park and its open air Lido, Broadway Market, the East End institution, Hackney Empire or Dalston with its thriving nightlife. The local community is buzzing with its multicultural mix of creatives, entrepreneurs, city workers and parents.

For transportation, Hackney Central Overground is 2 minutes away as is the number 17 bus route which traverses across London. By train, Hackney Downs will transport you to Liverpool Street in under nine minutes. Alternatively, a two-mile cycle south takes you to the City.

detailedDescription:
A sensational, two double bedroom, period conversion set across the top two floors of this handsome, semidetached building on Wilberforce Road, N4. Standing at a very impressive 838 sqft, the property has been tastefully decorated throughout by the current owners with a perfect blend of modern and characterful features. The second floor consists of a wonderfully bright, east facing living room/kitchen spanning the full width of the front of the house creating the perfect space to entertain, while situated at the rear is a larger than average second bedroom with a fantastic view over neighbouring gardens. The top (third floor) occupies the spacious master bedroom featuring plentiful eaves storage while the property is completed with a modern, family bathroom.
Wilberforce Road is one of Finsbury Park's most desirable locations being a wide tree lined, quiet, no-through road, with ample on-street parking and is set just moments from the prestigious Highbury Barn and Clissold Park. The property is close to highly renowned local amenities, including Fink's café, Godfreys butchers, La Fromagerie, Da Mario's Deli, Bournes Fishmongers and Highbury Vintners all of which are hugely popular with locals as well as drawing those from further afield. It is also moments from the ever-popular Blackstock Road, with its community feel, local cafés and shops, whilst the property is also close proximity to three great open spaces, namely Clissold Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields.
Transport links are well serviced by Finsbury Park (Victoria and Piccadilly lines, National Rail and Thames Link) and Arsenal (Piccadilly line) stations. There is also a selection of good bus routes taking you into the City and West End.
title: 2 bed flat for sale

Accommodation is well balanced and comprises; A generous reception space, semi open plan to the kitchen, bathroom suite, study and a large double bedroom. This flat benefits from its own private entrance and must be viewed to be truly appreciated. This apartment affords convenient access to an absolute wealth of local shops, bars and eateries, with particular note to those on Upper Street and Exmouth Market. Angel Underground (Northern Line) provides convenient access to both the City and the transport hub that is Kings Cross / St Pancras International, with bus routes on St John Street, Upper Street, Pentonville Road and City Road.

detailedDescription:
This third floor, dual aspect three bedroom apartment boasts natural light throughout and a private south facing balcony. Live moments away from the canal & the green spaces nearby.

Description

Built on the site of a former metal works, Stone Studios is a micro neighbourhood of five distinctive buildings, just 0.1 miles from Hackney Wick Station.

The development features 110 expansive, light-filled apartments above shared creative workspaces, a café, gallery and a courtyard.

Homes at Stone Studios have been designed for comfortable, luxury loft-style living, with floor to ceiling windows, private outside space, high spec kitchens and flexible, free-flow living space.

Stone Studios benefits from having some of London's best green spaces nearby, including Victoria Park, Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, and Hackney Marshes.

Hackney Wick is home to many aspiring young artists, musicians and creatives, making it a vibrant and diverse community to live in. 'The Wick' is fast becoming one of London's most important work and cultural hubs.

With its array of independent cafes, trendy restaurants and eateries, and some of London's best breweries and canal-side bars, you'll be spoilt for choice when exploring your new neighbourhood.

Stone Studios offers direct access to Hackney Wick Overground station, with 16 arrivals and departures per hour, bringing the rest of the city into easy reach.

Square Footage: 1043 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 998 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Unique, double-fronted detached house, situated on one of London Fields sought-after residential roads; moments from Wilton Ways' local shopping facilities, cafes, restaurants (including the famous bakery, Violets), Broadway Market and Columbia Rd flower market. This beautiful family home is set back from the road, with a delightful path leading you through the front garden to a welcoming entrance. Offering ample living space spanning over 1350 sq ft, to include 4 bedrooms and a study, downstairs cloakroom/wc, a first floor bathroom/WC, an en-suite shower room/WC, a large open plan double reception with a large bay window to the front and French double doors to the rear, a bespoke family size kitchen/diner, a private rear garden and front garden with potential to extend to side (subject to planning). Dalston Junction is less than 10 minutes’ walk which provides easy access to Highbury & Islington which is on the Victoria Line, and the City. Liverpool Street Station is just 3 stops from London Fields Station, which you can walk to in just 10 minutes. With the green spaces of London Fields, Wilton Way and Broadway Market’s plethora of shops and eateries just on your doorstep; this location is a perfect spot for anyone looking for a peaceful space to call home but be within easy reach of Hackney’s vibrant day and night life.

Full description:

Wild & Co. Are delighted to offer for sale this unique, double -fronted detached house, situated on one of London Fields prestigious roads; moments from Wilton Ways’ local shopping facilities, cafes, restaurants (including the famous bakery, Violets, Broadway Market and Columbia Rd flower market. This beautiful family home is set back from the road, with a delightful path leading you through the front garden to a welcoming entrance.

Offering ample living space spanning over 1350 sq ft, to include a lobby area with oak wood flooring, leading to an impressive double reception room with a large sash bay window with bespoke shutters, flowing through to a charming patio garden via large French doors.

Front garden, olso offering potential to extend to side (subject to planning).

A spacious kitchen has a range cooker with generous wall cupboard storage and plentiful work surfaces, essential for the keen cook. The bi-folding doors allow you to open on to the reception, making it a perfect entertaining space. Off the lobby is a study with another opulent bay window, providing lots of natural light and downstairs cloakroom/wc.

As you go up the stairs to the first floor landing, it’s hard to miss the magnificent ceiling height, taking you to 4 bedrooms and a three piece suite family bathroom. The grand master bedroom also has a pristine en-suite shower room.

Dalston Junction is less than 10 minutes’ walk which provides easy access to Highbury & Islington which is on the Victoria Line, and the City. Liverpool Street Station is just 3 stops from London Fields Station, which you can walk to in just 10 minutes.

With the green spaces of London Fields, Wilton Way and Broadway Market’s plethora of shops and eateries just on your doorstep; this location is a perfect spot for anyone looking for a peaceful space to call home but be within easy reach of Hackney’s vibrant day and night life.

Alex Crown are pleased to present this beautiful one double bedroom flat in Dalston N16.

The property consists of; one lovely large double bedroom, spacious separate reception room, a beautiful fitted kitchen, fitted bathroom suite. The property also has gas central heating and double glazed windows throughout.

Area:
Shacklewell Road is just a short walk from the mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along Kingsland High street and Stoke Newington High Street. It’s also within easy reach of the increasingly popular Church Street. Connections into the City and Central London are swift and simple, with Dalston Kingsland (Overground) and Dalston Junction both within easy reach and offering direct links into London Liverpool Street. Popular Hackney Downs is just around the corner offering an excellent picnic spot in the warmer months and also hosting outdoor events for locals during the summer.

The local area is almost like a little village, with everything you need on your doorstep. We know all of our neighbours and there's a great sense of community. We'll be really sad to move on but this place will always hold special memories for us.

address: Carriage House, City North, Finsbury Park, London N4
detailedDescription:
*Virtual Tour Available!*

Looking for a bright 6th-floor apartment in a modern development – with a private south-facing balcony and a residents rooftop garden?

This one-bed with floor-to-ceiling windows and underfloor heating lies in the heart of the vibrant and cosmopolitan Finsbury Park community – perfectly placed within easy reach of the Tube, the National Rail, and the expansive green space of Finsbury Park itself.

As you step through onto the engineered timber flooring of your new entrance hall, youll find a contemporary bathroom on your left, with soft overhead spotlights, a Villeroy & Boch basin under a recessed vanity mirror, and a glazed-screen rain-style shower over an integrated bath – all beautifully finished with dark wooden panelling on bespoke cabinetry storage, contrasted against porcelain and ceramic tiling on the walls and floor.

Further down the entrance hall, youll come to a large storage and utility room on your left before entering the south-facing double bedroom, with a full-height integrated mirrored wardrobe and a floor-to-ceiling window for maximum natural light.

Across from the bedroom, youll step through into a deep and long open-plan living area. To your right, youll find a bright and contemporary kitchen, finished with stone worktops and glass splashbacks, and fitted with fully integrated Bosch appliances (including a touch-control induction hob, a combination oven, a full-height fridge-freezer, and an integrated dishwasher).

Opposite the kitchen area, youll be met with an abundance of natural light pouring in through the floor-to-ceiling glass of the south-facing private balcony. Its the perfect relaxing spot to admire the far-reaching views out to the horizon and the Central London skyline – or a quiet extra space when youre entertaining guests.

Beyond the walls of your stunning home, youll be a part of the City North residential development, with a range of exclusive facilities on your doorstep. As a resident, youll have access to:

* A 2,000-square-foot Landscaped Rooftop Garden at the nearby Pavilion
* A Residents Wi-fi Lounge
* A 24-hour Concierge Service
* On-site Bicycle Storage
* And a private Roof Terrace on the 10th floor of Carriage House.

Youll be just a 5-minute walk from Finsbury Park Station, giving you close access to two of the most convenient Tube lines in London – the Victoria Line, for a 9-minute trip to Oxford Street or a 4-minute trip to Kings Cross, and the Piccadilly Line, for a 14-minute trip to Covent Garden, Holborn, or Leicester Square.

Youll also be just 5 minutes from the National Rail service, for trains as far as Cambridge and Peterborough, as well as being just a 5-minute walk from the expansive green spaces of Finsbury Park, with 110 acres of open fields and natural beauty right on your doorstep.

This nearly new one-bed in the heart of Finsbury Park comes with its own private balcony, south-facing natural light, and an exclusive residents rooftop terrace.

And that means it wont be on the market for long.

So if youre looking for a fully equipped and untouched property with extensive transport links to take you all over the city, give us a call and well show you everything City North has to offer.

detailedDescription:
Stow Brothers are excited to present this new waterside one bedroom apartment within an exciting new development.

Boasting a spacious balcony with peaceful west facing views towards the reservoir and the internal courtyard. The development provides use of a modern gym, swimming pool, residents lounge & 24 hour concierge service for residence use only.

A sleek modern design with a great high quality finish. Offering comprehensive links to the city with a commute time of 15 minutes to Central London.

This beautiful apartment offers a rare opportunity to purchase a brand new and completed home in a fantastic development.

A landmark development transforming 64 acres of land into a picturesque, sustainable and award winning modern development.

At the forefront of this development is the integration of its vibrant surroundings of nature. Making a fluid design between the outdoor and indoor space, committing to preserving energy and protecting the environment. Working hand in hand with the London Wildlife Trust, maintaining a habitat for many species to co-exist with its local residence.

Explore your local area with great amenities & transport links on your doorstop. Within the development itself you have everything you need it couldn't be more convenient; gym, 24 hour concierge, schools, health centre, fruit & veg store, post office, Zer cafe and much more.

If that wasn't enough you have fantastic transport links within a short walking distance of the property. Taking you to Central London in a flash. A 4 minute walk to Manor house station, making it possible to be in Oxford Circus within 15 minutes. The line is part of the night tube service providing 24 hour service on Fridays and Saturdays to aid with any late nights out.

detailedDescription:
Occupying part of the ground floor of this purpose built block in the heart of Hackney wick with its wide array of trendy coffee shops and riverside bars, comes this wonderful one bedroom garden flat, close to Hackney Wick station for great connections into Canary Wharf and the city. The property is well proportioned and comprises a spacious reception room with access to the patio garden and leading to the separate fitted kitchen, a double bedroom which again provides access to the patio garden, and a family bathroom, whilst on the outside there is secure gated residents parking. Leabank Square is next to the picturesque banks of the River Lea with views across to the Olympic Park along with Westfields with its array of shops, bars, restaurants and entertainment spots. Transport links are fantastic with Hackney Wick Station (London Overground) only a short distance away, whilst motorists can also gain swift access into the Docklands and out of London to Stratford and the M11 via the A12 and A13 road links.

address: The Makers, Nile Street, London, Greater London N1
detailedDescription:
The Makers is a residential development of 175 new homes, including studios, two and three-bedroom apartments and family duplexes. Tucked away from City Road, between the vibrancy and dynamism of the Shoreditch area and the financial district of the City of London, the location provides a quiet retreat within the capital.

A generous provision of private communal facilities includes a screening room, two landscaped garden terraces, a gym, a treatment room and three lounges, perfect for ad-hoc meetings. The sensitive modern design conceived by Avanti Architects ensures the building responds to its environment by referencing the surrounding warehouse typology, but reinventing it for contemporary residents.

The co located school; New Regent-s College, will provide 150 pupil places, between the ages of 5 and 16, all housed within a state-of-the art facility. Additional facilities will include a multi-use games area, sports hall and community hall, all of which will be available for hire by the local community and new residents.

A breathtaking double-height entrance lobby hosts a 24/7 concierge, providing peace of mind, secure mail and delivery services, and access to bookable facilities. With interior design by Woods Bagot, the material palette takes inspiration from the 1920s – a stunning feature wall, terrazzo flooring, bespoke lighting, custom furniture, brass details and smoked oak chevron floors set the tone for what is to follow.

- Concierge

- Lobby & Library Lounge

- Screening Room

- Gym & Separate Treatment Room

- Communal Roof Gardens

Woodberry Down

Vanquish Real Estate is delighted to offer this exquisite 1 bedroom 1 bathroom apartment with stunning South & Sout West aspect with a unique Natural Reservoir View.

detailedDescription:
A substantial and imposing semi-detached Victorian house measuring an impressive 2,449 sqft. This stunning and rarely found home benefits from off street parking for two cars, a huge 130ft south facing mature garden and enormous studio space perfect for working or running a business from home.

Accommodation comprises; a grand entrance hallway that retains ornate cornicing and corbels, leading to the impressive double reception room featuring high ceilings, two original cast iron fireplaces, stripped wooden floorboards and many more stunning original features. There is a large kitchen/diner on the lower half landing (as well as a shower/W.C), which provides access to a well kept south facing rear garden, rarely found within the location. The first floor houses the master bedroom, with a further two double bedrooms and shower/wc room. The top floor is arranged as a self contained one bedroom flat with independent bathroom and kitchen utilities, ideal for families who have guest stay. There is a large loft space that's currently being used as storage but can easily be extended in to (subject to the necessary permissions). This is a special house that must be viewed to be truly appreciated its size and potential. Manor Road is situated within easy reach of Stoke Newington Church Street and moments from the greenery and amenities of Clissold Park. Stoke Newington Church Street provides superb local shopping and a wide range of eateries. The property affords peace and tranquillity in a superb central position.

title: 5 bed property for sale

address: Gate House, Southgate Grove, London N1
detailedDescription:
This wonderful two-bedroom apartment in Gate House has been the recent subject of a complete renovation by its current owners. A sensitive set of interventions have brought hardwood floors, a contemporary kitchen and striking green tiles to the bright, flowing set of internal spaces. The apartment has a private balcony at the rear and is located in the heart of De Beauvoir, a short walk from the restaurants, pubs and cafes of De Beauvoir village.

The Tour

Access is gained on the first floor of Gate House, a three storey apartment block set back from Southgate Grove behind communal lawns, which are lined with well-kept hedgerows.

The apartment’s traditional plan has been opened up to create a wonderful set of flowing spaces, centred around a bright, expansive living room with engineered oak floorboards underfoot and a new, tiled fireplace. A glazed door to the eastern aspect provides access to the balcony, which enjoys verdant views across the communal gardens and towards De Beauvoir.

A new kitchen adjoins the living room, with Corian worktops, a new induction hob and sleek, pale green units. This room has dual aspect windows, allowing natural light to pour through the plan. A dining area has been set up to one side. The current owners have installed a brand new boiler and have reengineered the central heating system throughout.

The main bedroom is generously sized, with dual aspect windows, a built-in wardrobe and a newly installed wrought-iron radiator. The second bedroom is currently configured as a home office with plenty of storage space. A new bathroom has been created by knocking through a separate bathroom and WC to create one larger space. Deep green tiles line the walls, while large format concrete tiles run underfoot. There is a large walk-in shower to one side with a heated towel rail, as well as a new basin and stand, with a built-in mirrored cabinet.

The apartment comes with its own storage unit on the ground floor.

The Area

Gate House is brilliantly positioned for the pubs, restaurants, shops and cafes of both Islington and Dalston. The De Beauvoir Deli Co is a firm favourite with locals, offering locally sourced produce, alongside seasonal fruit and vegetables, plus sandwiches and salads. The Scolt Head and De Beauvoir Arms are both excellent local pubs renowned for their food and atmosphere. Regent’s Canal is within easy reach and can be used as a pleasant footpath to the rest of east London, providing access to the excellent Towpath cafe, galleries such as Victoria Miro and Parasol Unit, and Broadway Market. The green spaces of London Fields, Stonebridge Gardens and Shoreditch Park are all close by.

Haggerston Station is less than five minutes’ walk away, where the Overground provides connections to Canary Wharf via Canada Water. Regular buses run to the City and beyond from Kingsland Road.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 95 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £1,000 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £9 per annum
Council Tax Band: C

A beautiful and extremely spacious, one bedroom apartment in arguably East London's coolest residential area. Two bathrooms, polished concrete flooring throughout and private balcony running the entire length of the property.

This large, open plan loft style apartment sits on the first floor of Monohaus development, located in the beating heart of London Fields.

The apartment extends to 637sq/ft, and is comprised of: One double bedroom with en-suite; another powder room WC; polished concrete flooring throughout with underfloor heating; a large, open plan kitchen/dining/reception room; and a private balcony. This luxury apartment comes with 24 hour concierge, basement bicycle parking and bookable conference room. Kennaland celebrity hairdressers and SID21 bakehouse are located within the development as well as Michelin star restaurant - Behind. A close community of residents and business owners make Monohaus a truly unique place to live in.

address: Shore Mews, Shore Road, Hackney E9
detailedDescription:
Set within a charming private cobblestone mews, this two bedroom mews style house (with share of freehold) combines clean, contemporary living with a decidedly homely vibe.

The mews itself is peacefully tucked behind the bustle of Well Street, within easy reach of Victoria Park Village and London Fields and is accessed via a private residents gate and communal cobblestone entrance and paved courtyard.

The property benefits from informal outside space and comprises a dual aspect open plan living area with reception to the front and a stepped kitchen with natural wood worktops and ample preparation, storage and dining space.

The feature open tread staircase leads up to a light-filled landing with skylight, two double bedrooms and a family bathroom.

Shore Road is a superb location to enjoy the endless bars, restaurants, cafes and amenities of surrounding London Fields, Broadway Market, Victoria Park and Hackney Central. London Fields Lido is a short stroll - a 50m Olympic size, heated outdoor swimming pool open all year round.

Running east off Mare Street, Shore Road has a number of great transport links with London Fields Overground station approx. 0.4 miles away and a number of well-connected bus routes run from surrounding Mare Street, Well Street and Victoria Park Road.
