detailedDescription:
In the heart of Hoxton is this smart, one-bedroom flat with its own south-facing balcony. Crisply redecorated to make the most of the space and its unique proportions, this flat is a quiet haven perched above the buzz all around.

Brickworks Says

Clean lines, an airy aspect and sweeping views define this one-bedroom flat with private balcony on the third floor of a venerable block built in 1950. There’s a remarkable sense of quiet self-containment to this space—quite a feat, considering it looks down on one of the liveliest stretches of the East End. The living room, nestled into the Deco-esque curve of the building and opening onto the south-facing balcony, is a whitewashed suntrap, perfect for entertaining, inside and out. The peaceful bedroom has plenty of storage, including original built-ins. The subway-tiled bath and kitchen feel somewhat Scandi-fresh, and there’s even a separate WC - a rare (and handy) reminder of the building’s post-war roots.

East London’s greatest hits are on the doorstep. Shoreditch Park and the meandering towpath along Regent’s Canal, all the way to Victoria Park. Columbia Road and Broadway Markets. Recently opened Curzon cinema right around the corner. The shops, pubs, restaurants, museums and nightlife from Hackney to Shoreditch to Bethnal Green. There are transport links aplenty, but the City is walkable in about 20 minutes, making the morning commute a stress-free hoof.

The Owners Say

We have loved our time on Fanshaw Street—near the water and the City, with giddy London on either side. Whilst it is predominantly a small residential street, it feels like the crossroads of Hoxton, with two lively main streets, Hoxton and Pitfield, at either end, both packed full of bars, restaurants and cafes, and frequented by the brash, outrageous and free.

Our favourite Hoxton haunts: Rapsa@100 Hoxton, an Asian/Euro crossover great for indulgent weekends as well as special day events in an intimate, industrial-chic space; The Lion & Lamb, an arty audiophile gastropub serving up a smorgasbord of deluxe sandwiches, Brazilian jazz, craft beer and everything in between; Friends of Ours, an independent, Antipodean-style cafe, which does great food but mainly mind-blowing coffee from exceedingly knowledgeable baristas; The George & Vulture, London’s tallest pub, but also a great place for pizza and some brilliant weekly quizzes.

Points To Consider

The EPC gives a current Energy Efficiency Rating of C.

In the Borough of Hackney, the flat falls into Council Tax Band B (£1,175.76 in 2020/21).

One of 59 in the building, the flat is leasehold with 92 years remaining and a monthly service charge of £93.21, including ground rent.

The property is being sold chain-free.

About Brickworks

Brickworks is an independent company committed to an intelligent and ethical approach to estate agency. We were founded on one guiding principle: To bring positive and significant change to the way people buy and sell a home.

Like our ethos, or want more detail on a particular property, including our Brickworks Loves section of local places we adore? Visit us:

The Legal Bit

While we endeavour to maintain accurate photographs, floor plans, and descriptions, these are intended as a guide and purchasers must satisfy themselves by personal inspection. Total floorplan measurements have been rounded for ease. Distances are also provided as an approximate.

detailedDescription:
A stunning three bedroom penthouse apartment in an award-winning development.

Location

Located at Woodberry Down development, spanning over 67 acres of open water and landscaped parkland, you are part of superb community which is extremely well-connected. By foot, you can enjoy a riverside walk within the unique waterside community surrounded by nature. The reservoirs offer a variety of activities which are very popular with families and individuals of all ages. Woodberry Down lies 8 minutes by Tube to King's Cross and only 20 minutes to The City. Just to the west is Finsbury Park, while to the south lies Stoke Newington, with lots of independent shops and cafés, pubs, bars, arts spaces and picturesque parkland to explore

Description

This stunning modern three bedroom penthouse apartment in award-winning waterside development. Riverside Apartments is a beautifully designed residential development within the Woodberry Down development and is positioned by the famous reservoirs of Woodberry Wetlands, offering breath-taking views across the water and London. This highly sought after home with floor to ceiling double glazed windows and underfloor heating throughout, offers far-stretching views, and excellent natural light. Spacious in size, over a lateral floor plan, the layout of the home offers perfect separation from the living space and sleeping area. The living room and open-plan kitchen is finished with premium standard engineered wooden floors consisting of a large high-specification kitchen, with built-in appliances. Open plan to a generously sized living room area, which leads on to your large private balcony with panoramic views. To the front of the apartment there are 3 large double bedrooms, with a high graded tile flooring en-suite bathroom and dressing area to the primary bedroom and fantastic storage space throughout.

Square Footage: 1022 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 990 years remaining

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
At close to 2,000 sq. Ft., this substantial family home is located on one of Stokey’s best streets, right by vibrant Church Street and award-winning Clissold Park. Beautifully designed and retaining a wealth of original charm, this perfect property also falls within catchment of outstanding local primary and secondary schools.

Positioned in a handsome terrace on leafy Clissold Crescent, this three storey home offers a beautiful reception room on the ground floor, with original bay and high ceilings, plus a stylish shower room, and a stunning, fully-extended kitchen/diner, with ample cooking, dining and entertaining space. There is a handy utility room, too, and the rear of the house benefits from a south-westerly aspect, meaning the kitchen/dining space is light and bright right into the evening. The landscaped rear garden has been carefully designed to create a useable but secluded space, complete with poured concrete planters, mature boarders and room for al-fresco dining, too.

The upper floors offer five double bedrooms, including a sumptuous full-width master bed, with original fireplace and bespoke storage. There is a second bathroom, too, and access to a large loft space on the top floor. Views from the upper floors are pretty at the front (across Clissold Crescent to Clissold Park) and back (across the rear gardens to the allotments on New River Path).

Additional benefits include; new wood-sash double glazing in the front two bays, a coal chute cellar (a great storage solution), and a landscaped front garden, complete with a custom-built bike shed.

Clissold Crescent is a quiet, no-through road, just a short walk from the eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along Church Street and surrounding Newington Green. Connections into the City & Central London are swift & simple, with the numerous bus links that run along Church Street & Green Lanes all readily available. There is a fantastic sense of community on Clissold Crescent and within the surrounding streets, and there is a brilliant choice of outstanding primary and secondary schools nearby, too.

detailedDescription:
Ideal for first-time buyers or investors alike, this bright and spacious studio apartment is now ready to view and it is offered chain-free.

With stylish decor and a practical open-plan layout, this lovely home has been cleverly designed offering great space and the comfort of modern living.

Location

Location

Saint Mark's Rise is conveniently located in the heart of buzzy Dalston, just moments away from popular Ridley Road Market and walking distance from Kingsland High Street with its array of independent cafes, pubs, restaurants and clubs.

For those commuting to central London, the studio is located between Dalston Kingsland, Dalston Junction and Hackney Downs stations, allowing easy access to the City.

In addition for those who enjoy green areas, Hackney Downs and London Fields parks are within easy walking distance.

General Information

Additional information

• Lease remaining: 119 years
• Service charge: £885 per annum
• Ground rent: £200 per annum

A word from the owner:

I recently moved from this homely studio flat due to changes in my personal circumstances. I absolutely loved living in the heart of Dalston and have made life-long memories. The location is excellent, with everything you could possibly want from London-life right on your doorstep, with many bars, restaurants, etc. - Escudo de Cuba; Cafe Route; Speakeasy; Dalston Curve Garden; Stone Cave; Rio Cinema; Ridley Road Market Bar were just a few of my trusty favourites. Fresh groceries from Ridley Road Market and tfc are delicious and cheap! There are many great local walks and parks to choose from - Hackney Downs; London Fields; Victoria Park along the canal. Hackney Marshes; Stoke Newington and Clissold Park are also easily accessible on foot.

Even though there is so much going on around you, this flat is very quiet and homely. It sits at the back of the building and overlooks greenery, there is no road and zero traffic noise, which is pretty unbelievable for zone 2 London. I found it was easy to wind down and relax there after a busy day. The studio itself is modern and only 6 years old, with high end fixtures and fittings, I particularly loved the floor to ceiling wardrobe with bi-folding doors, perfect for all your storage needs! The skylight above the bed was also one of my all time favourites, great for stargazing and waking up to a sunny summer morning. The bathroom is an incredible size and a perfect place to wind down. The building itself is quiet, clean and new, with only 5 flats. The neighbours are wonderful, friendly and helpful people, as are the neighbours along Saint Mark's Rise. There is a real community spirit in this area. I hope this delightful flat finds itself a new owner very soon, who is as happy there as I was - happy viewing :)

address: Grange Street, Bridport Place, London N1
detailedDescription:
This unique two-bedroom house is located on Hoxton Street, a short walk from the shops, bars and restaurants of Shoreditch. Configured across four storeys, it was designed by Leonard Manasseh for the lcc in the 1970s as the street-facing focal point of the Arden Estate. The house, which has two large balconies, has been the subject of an ingenious extension in recent years care of Lynch Architects, who used the penthouse floor as their design studio for a number of years.

The Building

The aesthetic of the building, particularly the prefabricated penthouse addition, was developed against the trend of British high-tech architecture, which favoured layers of glazing and steel cross-bracing. Instead, a largely natural palette of materials has been used; timber frames and birch plywood ceilings not only create a sense of warmth but also serve as structural alternatives to heavily manufactured materials. The result is a series of flowing spaces that reflect the honesty and integrity of their materials.

The Tour

Entry is on the ground floor, where a staircase ascends to the first-floor communal areas. The L-shaped plan has been exploited on this level to allow for two large balconies; the west-facing balcony has the house’s defining external feature, a conservatory with a large vertical section of glazing above that extends to the second floor. The steep pitch of this glazed section not only allows wonderful levels of natural light to stream into the first and second floors, but also echoes the linear sections of glazing on the penthouse level. The conservatory is currently used as a winter garden and is a wonderful spot for breakfast year-round.

The kitchen adjoins the conservatory; this is a calm, considered space with birch plywood cabinetry and space for a dining area. Linoleum floors run across this level and beautiful exposed copper pipes run along sections of the wall. The balcony at the rear faces north towards the Arden Estate; it is accessed via a set of glazed doors which open from the living room.

The second floor contains two bedrooms and a family bathroom. The larger bedroom has plenty of built-in storage space, while the smaller has a large section of sloped glazing with wonderful views.

The penthouse makes up the third floor. Currently configured as a second living room, it also has a WC and a second kitchen. As per Lynch Architects’ instruction, it was constructed offsite and craned onto the existing structure, along with the many glass panes that run around its edge. Oak mullions frame each section of glazing, as well as breathtaking panoramic views of the city beyond. The windows and roof light open to create natural ventilation, while the rooftop lantern acts as a solar chimney.

The Area

The house is positioned on Hoxton Street, which was the centre of the Shoreditch furniture and carpentry trade in the 19th century. Today, Hoxton is renowned for its exciting mix of restaurants, bars and galleries, including Lyle’s, Rochelle Canteen, Shoreditch House, the Blue Mountain School and Victoria Miro gallery. The boutiques and cafes of Redchurch Street and Spitalfields are also nearby.

There are plenty of transport links within walking distance. Hoxton Station runs London Overground services; Liverpool Street Station provides access to the Central, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines, as well as nationwide National Rail services. Old Street Underground station is a short walk away, running Northern Line services across the city.

detailedDescription:
Ideal for first-time buyers or investors alike, this spacious two-bedroom flat is now ready to view.

Offered chain-free, the bright and spacious accommodation comprises a large living room, a fitted kitchen, two good size double bedrooms and a family bathroom with separate WC. The property also benefits from ample storage, residents' parking and it has been well maintained throughout.

Viewings can be booked 24 hours a day and an internal viewing is highly recommended.

A word from the owner...

Hackney Downs offers a range of excellent cafes and restaurants within the locality. Vibrant areas such as Hackney Central and Dalston provide opportunities for dining at a number of independent restaurants and bars. The Pembury Tavern is a two minute walk from the property. It has been updated over the past couple of years but still possesses a local feel – a great place to try local ales and play board games. The real rock and roll! My favourite restaurant was the Anatolia along Mare Street just a bit further up from the Hackney Empire – amazing food with a real authentic feel to the place.

Transport links are excellent too – the 56 and 30 buses take you straight into Islington and onto St Pauls and Ftizrovia. Hackney Downs Station is a 5 minute walk from the property with Liverpool Street Station a mere 10 minutes away. If you fancy a walk in nature, the 56 then takes you in the opposite direction towards the Waterworks Local Nature Reserve and Walthamstow Marshes. Jump off at the Ice Rink and you’re there! If you have a car, and want to escape London for the day, then the M11 motorway is a short drive away to head into Suffolk and Norfolk. Hackney Downs Park is just two minutes away, whether you want a game of Tennis, go running, or simply lounge around within a relaxing green space, it was really nice to have this on the doorstep.

Location

Location

Marden House is located on Pembury Road moments from the many bars, restaurants and coffee houses of Mare Street and moments from the wide open spaces of Hackney Downs where you can enjoy 5 tennis courts and a great place for recreation and relaxation. Transport links include, Hackney Downs Station (Overground), Hackney Central Station (Overground) and a variety of Bus routes into The City & West End.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
The Sight of Eternal Light Church has been a landmark in the Hackney community for decades and its steeple was used as a landmark for pilots in the Second World War. While any refurbishment will require patience and expertise it has the potential to be a fantastically impressive residential space. The ceilings of the main Church reach nearly 8 metres and the foot print amounts to a shade under 4,000 sq ft. It is Grade II listed and much of the building is protected to include the aforementioned steeple and the impressive altar. Other original features include the tin façade, the stained glass windows and the wooden and steel ceiling joists. The property is currently designated for commercial use but there is an appetite from the local authority to redevelop the Church as residential space to avoid it falling into disrepair. The most likely scenario would be as one single dwelling. It is unlikely that permission would be given for the church to be converted into multiple dwellings. This opportunity is ideal for any potential buyer looking to create a one of a kind home in a sought after area. The property comes with off street parking. All comments are opinion and any renovation is subject to the usual consents and approval.

Situation

Broadway Market and Mare Street provide ample amenities and some outstanding restaurants including Mare Street Market. Transport links can be found at Dalston Kingsland, Dalston Junction, Hackney Downs and Hackney Central stations.

On the first floor you will find the master bedroom that used to be two rooms that indicates the size and potential. The exposed brickwork is a stunning feature and further benefits from a built in wardrobe.

Access to the balcony is off this room and is another great sun trap and adds to the enjoyment of living within the property.

The property is a must see to get a sense of the size of the property and beautiful features that run throughout.

Location:

Alexandra Grove is a quiet tree-lined residential road located between Finsbury Park and Clissold Park.

Also, conveniently located between Stroud Green and Highbury Park with several award-winning bars and restaurants.

For other activities, there is Rowans Ten Pin Bowling and The Park Theatre.

Blackstock Road and Seven Sisters Road are closest for your everyday amenities and supermarkets.

The soon to be finished City North development will further benefit the area with a GymBox, Cineworld and Marks & Spencer.

Transport:

Finsbury Park Underground on the Victoria and Piccadilly Lines and National Rail Station offers quick routes to Central London, the West End and beyond.

Ideal for young families and those looking to upsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended​.

detailedDescription:
Being Sold by Online Auction

Starting Bids from £550,000

Buy it now option available

Please call or visit Purplebricks Online Auctions for more information.

This property is for sale by Modern Method of Auction. The Modern Method of Auction is a flexible buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will have 56 working days to exchange and complete once the draft contract has been issued by the vendors solicitor. Allowing the additional time to exchange and complete on the property means interested parties can proceed with traditional residential finance. Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer with be required to put down a non-refundable reservation fee. The fee will be a fixed fee including the Vat, this secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. The buyer will be required to agree to our terms and conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found on the online Auction website or requested from our Auction Department.

Please note this property is subject to an undisclosed Reserve Price which is typically no more than 10% in excess of the Starting Bid. Both the Starting Bid and Reserve Price can be subject to change. Our primary duty of care is to the vendor. Terms and conditions apply to the Modern Method of Auction, which is operated by goto Auctions.

To book a viewing visit Purplebricks

Location

The property is enviably located in a much sought after residential road in the heart of Stoke Newington, within easy access of Stoke Newington and Rectory Road stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes. Stoke Newington offers an array of shops and amenities, with Stoke Newington Church Street providing a wonderful array of fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants. The area is well served by excellent local schools and beautiful open spaces including Clissold Park, Abney Park and the Wetlands. Stoke Newington Common and Hackney Downs are also within walking distance.

Lease Information

106 years. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

Service Charges

Service charges are approx. £490 per annum and ground rent is £10 per annum. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries and verify this information with a solicitor.

General Information

Auctioneer's Comments

This property is offered for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer, but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract is issued by the vendor’s solicitor.

By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, normal residential finance can be arranged. The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative.

The buyer will be required to give the Auctioneers authority to sign the Reservation Form on their behalf and to confirm acceptance of the Terms and Conditions prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation Form and all Terms and Conditions can be found in the Information Pack which can be downloaded from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction, or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyer’s Premium of £7,800 including VAT, plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £8,154. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Any additional fees and charges over and above this will be confirmed within the terms and conditions available on the auction website.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.

Property Description

Stunning three bedroom split level period conversion, set within an attractive end of terrace property close to the heart of Stoke Newington. The property offers bright and spacious accommodation, stylishly appointed and updated with high quality finish throughout, whilst still retaining a wealth of period character and appeal. Features include a beautiful open plan reception/newly fitted kitchen, re-designed contemporary style bathroom, new wood flooring and carpets, gas central heating, sash windows, ample inbuilt storage and long lease.

Accommodation comprises entrance on the upper ground level and stairs rising to the first floor via a half landing double bedroom with ample inbuilt storage. To the first floor, there is a further well sized double bedroom and stylish adjacent bathroom with white suite and elegant tiling. To the second floor, a doorway opens into the bright and spacious, open plan dual aspect reception/kitchen with feature fireplace and ample space for both relaxing and dining. The kitchen area comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with hardwood work surfaces and breakfast bar area incorporating inset sink unit, hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. A further double bedroom completes the ample and luxurious accommodation.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
Fig trees, olive tones, rustic Victorian living awash in a simple, elegant and modern palette that makes this house a delight for the ages. Hackney-s hidden garden treasure.

Set on the end of a run of terraces, this two bed house, dating back to 1870s has a fascinating history and an abundance of potential to take it into the next era of living for its new owners.

Stood not far from Mare Street and London Fields, this Hackney home boasts unusual treasures, light, location and a hidden walled garden.

A striking, open plan Victorian Terrace house, this is the epitome of something discerningly different. For those not obsessed with perpendicular layouts, brace yourself to enjoy the quirky attitude of this welcoming home.

Take the stairs up to the house from street level, the hallway inside has numerous options; from the doorway that takes you to a handy little cellar, a downstairs WC, and a staircase up to the first floor. Follow the parquet flooring through to the open plan living, dining and kitchen space and you will find a suite of treats awaiting. The owners have let the bright and sunny demeanour of the house speak for itself, accenting with pops of colour here and there but letting the natural beauty of the wooden flooring do all the talking, the modernist style a sidekick to the ingrained style of the house.

The living room, with its large windows looking out onto a birch tree and sunny mimosa is a fresh, fuss-free canvas to apply your own design stamp. Connecting through to the kitchen dining area is like stepping back in time. The iroco wooden surfaces, Smeg range cooker, reclaimed butler sink and Istanbul tiles serving oodles of impact, with the main event, that Nocellara olive green kitchen creating art in this quirky hub. The dining area allows you to gather your favourite people for experimental cooking late into a summer-s evening, before heading out into the garden to lounge under that Hawthorn tree. Just imagine it.

Head upstairs and the two bedrooms sit, equally spaced, equally lovely with high ceilings and exposed wooden boards that have been left natural for the flooring. The main bathroom has been beautifully renovated with lava stone floor tiles and underfloor heating for those chillier winter months. Blue terracotta wall tiles give yet another burst of colour when needed, giving this Victorian property a wonderful Mediterranean vibe. The dual aspect of this living and eating space means light is never limited.

This home has the sweetest corner plot garden you could imagine. Private and secluded, in part thanks to the hornbeam tree, there are vines, blossoms, jasmine, lilac and fig, pear and olive trees. This garden is a wonderfully considered extension to the house and you-ll easily forget where you are.

Lyme Grove is in a conservation area, so what you get here is a heavy dose of London history that has been delicately modernised to offer a relaxed, contemporary and chilled home with touches of that Mediterranean lifestyle that we all crave in our outdoor space. Pick a fig, pour some freshly made lemonade and sit back in your own piece of city paradise.

detailedDescription: This bright and spacious three bedroom house with private parking is discretely tucked away on a peaceful residential close on the banks of the New River. Accommodation includes an extremely spacious 17ft reception room, separate kitchen, three well proportioned bedrooms and well kept private garden. There is a gate leading from the private garden to a very large communal garden which is bordered by the New River. The river leads around to the Woodberry Wetlands nature reserve which was opened by Sir David Attenborough in 2016, the reservoir is home to many water birds not found anywhere else in London including Kingfishers and Cetti Warblers. Adjacent to the nature reserve is the West Reservoir used by the locals for boating and other activities including open water swimming. There are wonderful walks to be had in the area around these two bodies of water. New River Way is a quiet residential close located in the corner of the Woodberry Park redevelopment area. The project has brought fantastic new amenities to the area including a Sainsbury's, cafes overlooking the water and independent delis and restaurants. Stoke Newington is nearby, with a great many well-loved independent boutiques, cafes, bars and restaurants. Two other fantastic green spaces in the area are Finsbury Park and Clissold Park. Transport links are excellent with Manor House underground and Stamford Hill overground station both within easy walking distance. There are many bus routes into various parts of central London less than 200m from the property.

detailedDescription:
****** viewings on saturdays only******

Visit 24/7 to make arrangements to view!

Purplebricks have the pleasure in being selected to exclusively market this outstanding two bedroom modern build second floor apartment.

Forming part of this stylish development in the heart of Shoreditch, this larger-than-average apartment boasts just below 890 square feet of accommodation. The property comes superbly appointed, with an array of modern high-spec fixtures and fittings blended with a sleek, contemporary finish throughout.

There is an exceptionally proportioned south-facing living area offering a bright, airy and uplifting feel - the perfect space for social occasions, entertaining guests or for simply relaxing in. Both bedrooms are a great size and the owners have recently upgraded the kitchen – to include fitted high-gloss fronted units and top of the range appliances.

Additional benefits include a secured entrance, lift access, a hallway storage cupboard, double glazed windows, gas heating and a long 977 year lease.

This property also comes with the advantage of having no onward chain.

Location

Situated within a stone’s throw of Columbia Road Flower Market, the apartment sits on the borders of the two fashionable districts of Shoreditch and Hoxton.

The vibrancy of both Broadway Market as well as Hoxton, with their eclectic array of cafés, restaurants, bars and boutique style shops lie within easy reach on foot.

For the convenience of commuters, Hoxton Overground Station is just moments from the front door. Liverpool Street Station, Shoreditch High Street as well as Old Street Tube Station are all also situated within walking distance of the property. Buses from nearby go directly into Oxford Street and Bank, whilst the Overground takes you to Canary Wharf and North London.

Just a few hundred meters to the north-east lies the greenery of Haggerston Park. Slightly further afield, but still comfortably accessible on-foot are both London Fields and the expansive open-spaces, weekend farmer’s market and inviting park-side pubs on offer at Victoria Park.

The apartment’s favourable location also means that you will have many of London's world famous cultural, culinary and social hotspots at your convenient disposal. Whether you're in the mood for the cosmopolitan diversity of Brick Lane and Columbia Road, or the bright lights and bustle of the City and West End, or maybe even some of the trendy hang-outs synonymous with the Shoreditch and Old Street areas, there really is something for everyone, and access to all of it could hardly be easier!

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

title: 4 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
One of only 2 Victorian Freehold townhouses on Haberdasher Street, this 5 storey home spanning over 2,115 sqft (approx) provides a unique, blank canvas opportunity for any incoming purchaser.

Retaining many all-important original features such as timber flooring, large light bearing sash windows, high ceilings and fireplaces - the house has been restored over time to provide versatile use between floors.

The ground floor leads to a large dual aspect kitchen/living space filled with light plus access to a private, south facing patio garden to the rear via full length, floor to ceiling sliding doors. Moving up through the house, the first floor is currently configured as a second living space and main bathroom (complete with clawfoot bathtub). The top two floors comprising three further bedrooms (built in storage throughout), WC and shower room with the top floor also having access to a small private terrace.

With self-contained access from the front of the house the lower ground floor can also be accessed from the ground floor. This floor has significant potential to be utilised as a further bedroom, studio, gym space or even a cinema room.

£827 per sqft (approx) in Shoreditch for a Freehold House presents a great opportunity.

Haberdasher Street is located between the much sought after Hoxton Square, Shoreditch and Islington, an area home to a vast array of bars, pubs, award winning restaurants, boutiques and amenities. Old Street Station is a short walk away as is the City with the area undergoing huge investment with the formation of Tech City around Old Street Roundabout.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

address: Blackburn House, Prodigal Square, Hackney Gardens, London E8
detailedDescription:
Surrounded by greenery, lies this two bedrooms apartment with balcony courtyard views, in recently completed development, Hackney Gardens.

The apartment offers extensive storage throughout and includes built-in Siemens appliances, underfloor heating, engineered oak flooring, LED lighting, video entry system and daytime concierge.

Hackney Gardens is a collection of 58 luxury apartments surrounded by landscaped pathways and gardens, in the grounds of an 18th Century Church, moments from Hackney Central Overground.

The apartments are split between two new buildings, Wyles House and Blackburn House, which are situated off Prodigal Square, a new, semi-public space at the heart of the development. Here a new community center, focused on arts-based projects has been created.

Situated next door and soon to be restored to its former glory by Es Devlin and John Pawson is St John-at-Hackney church. Dating back to 1792, it has a capacity of 2,000 so unsurprisingly, it doubles up as a concert venue for the likes of Ed Sheeran, Coldplay, Emeli Sandé, Elbow, Florence & The Machine and international DJs.

Hackney Gardens, offers an abundance of choice. Be it London Fields park and its open air Lido, Broadway Market, the East End institution, Hackney Empire or Dalston with its thriving nightlife. The local community is buzzing with its multicultural mix of creatives, entrepreneurs, city workers and parents.

For transportation, Hackney Central Overground is 2 minutes away as is the number 17 bus route which traverses across London. By train, Hackney Downs will transport you to Liverpool Street in under nine minutes. Alternatively, a two-mile cycle south takes you to the City.

* Photos in this listing are of the Show Home and are indicative only.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Steeped in history, this exceptional conversion occupies the ground floor of a late 1800’s building, tucked away on quiet Montague Road, E8. Boasting wonderful original character, mixed elegantly with a contemporary design, this charming home comes complete with a private patio terrace and direct access to mature, landscaped communal gardens, too.

Offering 820 sq. Ft. Of lateral space, the property comprises; generous master bedroom with bespoke, full-height wardrobes, an ample second double bedroom that offers leafy views across the communal gardens, and a neatly tiled modern bathroom suite, too. The custom-built kitchen is open-plan with the living space and is a real showstopper; the original arched windows frame the landscaped gardens perfectly and allow the light to flow through, and the 12’ high ceilings give a real feeling of space. Additional features include; communal bike racks, a residents’ WhatsApp group, secure gated entry, a long lease remaining (105 years) and ample storage throughout.

Montague Road is a quiet, tree lined residential street in E8, just a short walk from some of Hackney’s best independent shops, bars, coffee shops and restaurants, too (Casa Fofo being one of the owners’ favourites). Connections into the City swift and simple, with Hackney Downs, Dalston Junction and Dalston Kingsland Stations (Overground) within easy reach, and the numerous bus links that run along Amhurst Road, Dalston Lane and Pembury Road are all readily available. Leafy Hackney Downs and London Fields are close by, and there is an excellent choice of outstanding schools nearby, too.

detailedDescription: A beautifully presented two double bedroom flat, converted from lower level of an imposing period building, benefitting from its own private entrance, sole use of a patio garden as well as access to communal gardens, moments from Newington Green. Accommodation is bright and generously proportioned comprising; two double bedrooms, ample storage, galley kitchen, bathroom suite and a spacious reception room which provides access to the private patio garden, in turn leading to the vast, manicured communal gardens. The property is conveniently located on Mildmay Park, a quite elegant tree lined street running North to Newington Green with the bustle of Kingsland Road in Dalston or short walk or cycle ride to Clissold swimming pool or Clissold Park (with tennis courts, skate board park and large specialist kids playground). This is a rare opportunity to buy a superb town house on the edge of one of the coolest/trendiest parts of town and the amenities of M&S foodhall, a large Sainsbury's supermarket, Tesco Express and Ridley Road street market on the doorstep. Transport is equally impressive with three bus stops within short walking distance providing fast and convenient bus services to Islington, the City, Central London and the West End. Moreover the North London line at Dalston Kingsland provides direct east west travel between Richmond and Stratford and connection to the Victoria Line at Highbury and Islington whereas the East London Line at Dalston Junction provides direct travel to the south and east including New Cross, Crystal Palace, West Croydon and Clapham Junction and connections to Canary Wharf either by Jubilee Line (Canada Water) or DLR (Shadwell) .

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A double fronted semi-detached Victorian Villa located by London Fields. Built in 1880 by Sir Thomas Middleton, totalling close to 3,000 sq ft across four floors and offering an impressive rear garden. The rooms throughout are grand with high ceilings and period features to include fireplaces, wooden flooring, cornicing, sash windows with shutters and stained glass. The raised ground floor exemplifies this perfectly with a beautiful double reception space and separate open plan kitchen/diner. There is a family bathroom and terrace to the rear. The terrace provides direct access to the south facing rear garden nearing 70ft, laid to lawn, and showcasing various fruit trees. The unobstructed rear view provides ample natural light throughout the property and there is side access. The upper floors house five double bedrooms with two bathrooms and ample eaves storage. The lower ground floor is currently used as self-contained two-bedroom flat while the property remains on one freehold title. The space here is of course interchangeable and remains connected to the house, it also provides dual access to the rear garden. There is off street parking to the front and space for two cars comfortably. The property is for sale chain free.

Situation
London Fields is one of London’s most desirable green open spaces and is moments from your front door. Hackney has drawn comparisons to New York’s East Village for its gentrification over the last decade. Offering grand period homes ideal for family living close to amenities and transport. Local attractions include Broadway Market, Hackney Empire and Columbia Road Flower Market. Transport links can be found at Dalston junction and London Fields.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning two bedroom duplex measuring 807 sq ft with personal private entrance is part of Hackney Gardens - a private-gated luxury and unique development nestled in the shadow of the renown St Johns at Hackney and the medieval tower of St Augustine's.

Creativity, arts and culture abound at a brand new development, Hackney Gardens, enviably located in the tranquil gardens of an ancient churchyard, in London’s trendy E8 postcode. The 58 one, two and three-bedroom luxury apartments bask in the grandeur of the adjacent St John at Hackney – an 18th Century, Grade II Listed church, which is as popular for its Sunday services as for its star-studded gigs, which have featured Coldplay, Bloc Party and Ed Sheeran in recent years.

A stone’s throw from the lifeblood of activity that thunders through Hackney Central. Hackney Gardens is a gated community nestled within landscaped communal gardens, inspired by the rich greenery of Hackney’s numerous parks, there is an abundance of private outdoor space in which to relax and unwind.

Internally, each apartment benefits from spacious open-play layouts, high specification kitchens and bathrooms, and under-floor heating. Vast windows drench the interior spaces in natural light, while a large terrace or balcony comes with every apartment. Onsite facilities include bike storage – ideal for maximising use of the multiple cycle paths and cycle superhighways that connect Hackney with Liverpool Street, Stoke Newington and Tottenham, as well as a dedicated concierge.

As one of London’s original artisanal hubs, Hackney is a melting pot of cultures and cuisines. Foodies are spoilt for choice with cult eateries including Lardo just ten minutes from the Hackney Gardens, and Broadway Market, which is lined with a smorgasbord of restaurants and bars, and home to a plethora of busy Saturday stalls that sell organic produce and experiment with the latest food trends a short distance away.
As London’s greenest borough, Hackney enjoys 815 acres of green space. Victoria Park, with its boating lake and Pavilion Café, plays hosts to Lovebox and Field Day, while London Fields has a thriving live music scene, but is also home to a wildflower meadow for those seeking sanctuary.

Moments from Hackney Central, which offers links to Oxford Street in 20 minutes, Shoreditch in 17 minutes, and Canary Wharf 27 minutes, Hackney Gardens is perfectly located for those who work across the capital. Meanwhile, trains from Hackney Downs offer direct links to Liverpool Street in eight minutes. For international travellers, City Airport is 35 minutes via the Overground, while Stansted is accessible in just over half an hour by car.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Wyles House, Prodigal Square, Hackney Gardens, London E8
detailedDescription:
Surrounded by greenery, lies this two bedroom, duplex apartment with large wraparound terrace in recently completed development, Hackney Gardens.

Its, considered, layout maximizes the space, creating the illusion of a house. The apartment offers extensive storage throughout and includes built-in Siemens appliances, underfloor heating, engineered oak flooring, LED lighting, video entry system and daytime concierge.

Hackney Gardens is a collection of 58 luxury apartments surrounded by landscaped pathways and gardens, in the grounds of an 18th Century Church, moments from Hackney Central Overground.

The apartments are split between two new buildings, Wyles House and Blackburn House, which are situated off Prodigal Square, a new, semi-public space at the heart of the development. Here a new community center, focused on arts-based projects has been created.

Situated next door and soon to be restored to its former glory by Es Devlin and John Pawson is St John-at-Hackney church. Dating back to 1792, it has a capacity of 2,000 so unsurprisingly, it doubles up as a concert venue for the likes of Ed Sheeran, Coldplay, Emeli Sandé, Elbow, Florence & The Machine and international DJs.

Hackney Gardens, offers an abundance of choice. Be it London Fields park and its open air Lido, Broadway Market, the East End institution, Hackney Empire or Dalston with its thriving nightlife. The local community is buzzing with its multicultural mix of creatives, entrepreneurs, city workers and parents.

For transportation, Hackney Central Overground is 2 minutes away as is the number 17 bus route which traverses across London. By train, Hackney Downs will transport you to Liverpool Street in under nine minutes. Alternatively, a two-mile cycle south takes you to the City.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Hkr brings 66 fantastic urban residences to Hoxton. Raised on Hackney Road, hkr is situated close to both the heart of Hoxton and Shoreditch, two of London’s most trendy and popular locations.

Being in a Zone One location, the scheme sits within easy reach of Shoreditch High Street and Hoxton Overground stations, as well as Old Street, and Liverpool Street stations taking you into the City and beyond.

The building itself is exceptional, designed by Hawkins Brown Architects, it features toned weathering steel frames spanning the façade. The metal repairs itself, constantly evolving - painted by the rain, bleached by the sun and sculpted by the wind.

A courtyard terrace at first-floor level provides a place of relaxation and also links the two service cores of the development. The fifth floor landscaped garden terrace is a further place to relax. Landscaped by Hawkins Brown the terrace will provide external seating, children’s play equipment and access to wifi. The fully-equipped private residents’ gym is also located within the fifth floor landscaped garden terrace. Enclosed, but still affording commanding views over the City and Docklands, there are further outside areas for yoga or fitness classes.

Higher still, the tenth-floor sky terrace is at the pinnacle of hkr taking in panoramic views of the City and Canary Wharf.

Enquire now to arrange your appointment.

The property is located along Brownswood Road allowing for easy access to the green spaces of Finsbury Park, Clissold Park and Woodberry Wetland nature reserve. A variety of shops, cafes and eateries are located on Blackstock Road along with a selection of bus routes.

title: 4 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
*** This property is EWS1 compliant. A certificate can be provided upon request.

A stunning, two double bedroom, warehouse conversion situated on the first floor of this iconic former Royle Print Works development between Old Street and Angel.

With over 700 square feet of internal space, the property is presented in good condition throughout and is offered to the market on a chain free basis. Full of natural light from the large windows, the east facing reception room and open plan kitchen including a breakfast bar, make a fantastic entertaining space. Two double bedrooms, with the master benefitting from built in wardrobes, and a separate master bathroom which serves both bedrooms complete the property. The property also includes a secure private car parking space and large communal canal side area for the residents.

Along with the building’s trademark solid concrete ceilings, this impressive five-storey, brick building was converted in 1997 and the communal areas maintain the original terrazzo flooring, large terrazzo stairs and a passenger lift to all floors. There is also a porter and the residents have use of secure underground bike storage.

Royle Building, situated on Wenlock Road, is a stone’s throw away from Regents Canal offering beautiful walks right the way through East London then back into the City. The property is also perfectly located close to Upper Street, for those keen shoppers and restaurant goers and Shoreditch Park for the outdoor enthusiasts. There are a number of transport links nearby providing easy access to the City including the buses from both New North Road and Essex Road, the tube from Angel and Old Street (Northern Line), Essex Road Rail Station taking you straight into Moorgate (First Capital Connect) and Hoxton overground Station.

detailedDescription:
Stunning two bedroom flat located on the second floor within a low rise purpose built block moments from both Newington Green and Dalston.

As you enter the flat there is ample space for shoes and jackets and perfectly leads to both the kitchen, reception room and private balcony.

The large south facing reception room is one of the main draws to the property offering plenty of space for a dinning table too making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

Off the reception room leads to both good size double bedrooms and the well propotioned family bathroom.

The sepoerate kitchen is ideal for families and those sharing alike make the property very versatile depnding on your personal requirements.

The private balcony offers plenty of space for a table outside to take advantage of the good weather.

The property is in excellent condition throughout.

Location;

Newington Green has an array of everyday amenities alongside boutique shops and award-winning bars and restaurants.

Church Street and Stoke Newington High Street, leading to Dalston, are both within walking distance from either side of Queen Margarets Grove and offer a great contrast of two very different vibes.

Clissold Park is also a short walk away, with tennis courts, swimming pools, and has several events throughout the year.

Transport;

Newington Green has excellent bus links to the City, King's Cross, Euston, the West End and beyond.

Canonbury and Dalston Kingsland Overground Station are less than a 10-minute walk away providing access to Highbury & Islington Station (Victoria Line), to Canary Wharf via Canada Water (Jubilee Line) and direct to Shoreditch High Street too.

Ideal for first-time buyers and those looking to upsize.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

Just off Church Street and right by award-winning Clissold Park, this perfect purpose-built apartment comprises; two generous double bedrooms with beautiful views across Lordship Road, a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances and ample cupboard space, and a sleek and neatly-tiled bathroom. There is a spacious reception room, too, with original parquet flooring and direct access out to the west-facing terrace - a perfect sun-trap on sunny afternoons. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This wonderfully individual maisonette lies behind a wooden-framed glazed shop front on Mortimer Road, a stone’s throw from De Beauvoir Square. It has been the subject of a beautiful and inventive renovation by the current owners.

Setting the Scene

At the front of the building, set behind ornate iron railings, is a small courtyard garden with space for a bench on which to sit and enjoy the morning sunshine. Behind this lies a charming maisonette filled with natural materials, considered touches and a calm, inviting atmosphere.

The Grand Tour

The house opens to a raised living area which is bathed in light from the east-facing floor-to-ceiling windows. These have been lined with custom-made linen, inspired by Japanese Shoji Screens, to provide privacy without losing any natural light. White-painted wooden slats run the length of the ceiling and down to clad the kitchen wall. On one side of the central oven is a stone worktop and on the other, a stone double sink. Glass bricks from the original shop have been revealed and restored, laid into the floor of the dining area to allow light to penetrate the accommodation below. To the right of the kitchen are two glazed stable doors which lead onto a gated alleyway.

Downstairs, the master bedroom is illuminated by light from the shop front windows which dip beneath the raised floor of the upper level. Fitted cupboards, with bespoke cast-iron doorknobs, line one side of the room. The second double bedroom is currently used as a dressing room/study and is lit from above by the glass-brick section of the ceiling and a high ribbon window. Parquet flooring runs throughout the sleeping accommodation. At the end of the corridor is a bathroom with decorative tiles on the floor and an elegant unlacquered brass splash-back that lines the perimeter of the bath. Hand-painted Delft tiles, commissioned by the owners, sit above the sink. The room echoes the aesthetic of the kitchen with white-painted cladding along the walls and bath.

Out and About

Mortimer Road is situated within the eponymous conservation area and is a short walk from London Fields and Broadway Market, with its weekly organic farmers’ market, gastropubs, restaurants and shops. There are a number of excellent pubs and restaurants in the area, notably the De Beauvoir Arms, and the popular De Beauvoir Deli is close by. The Towpath Café on Regent’s Canal is a short walk away. N1 Garden Centre is around the corner and Columbia Road, known for its flower market on Sundays and its independent shops and cafes, is within easy reach to the south. Both Shoreditch and Spitalfields are close by.

Haggerston Station and London Fields Station (both London Overground) provide convenient access to the City, the West End and Canary Wharf. Dalston Junction has been proposed as a station on the new Crossrail II route.

Further Reading

London Fields by Martin Amis

Hackney by Night by Hoxton Mini Press

detailedDescription:
This 850 sq ft three bedroom apartment located in the popular Fashion Place development, just a 5 minute walk from Hackney Central Station The apartment is highly specified with an open-plan reception and fully integrated kitchen leading to a private balcony

Transport

Fashion Place is situated 5 minutes walk from overground services at Hackney Central and 11 minutes walk from mainline rail at London Fields direct into Liverpool Street.

Travel Times

Overground Rail
Average journey times from Hackney Central include:

12 minutes to Stratford
13 minutes to Hoxton
16 minutes to Shoreditch High Street
18 minutes to Whitechapel

Mainline Rail
Average journey times from London Fields include:

2 minutes to Hackney Downs
4 minutes to Bethnal Green
9 minutes to London Liverpool Street

Underground
Average tube connections from Liverpool Street include:

1 minute to Bank
1 minute to Moorgate
8 minutes to Tottenham Court Road
8 minutes to Kings Cross St. Pancras
13 minutes to Covent Garden

Local Area

Designed in London and fashioned exclusively for Chatham Place - a collection of apartments located moments from the new multi million pound Hackney Fashion Hub - an unprecedented regeneration landmark set to transform the immediate vicinity into a world class fashion destination that will elevate the heart of east London to West End status.

Hackney Boasts 1300 listed buildings and 29 conservation areas amongst its historic credentials and industrial heritage.

A town with its own village, its own parkland and its own unique lifestyle driven by a frenzy of multi-cultural influences and diversities. Soak it up, it's all there waiting to happen.

Victoria Park and its hidden gem, The Village, lie a stone's throw from Fashion Place, providing residents with a rural retreat alive with quirky stores, boutiques, galleries and alfresco eateries.

Stray a little further and you're on Regent's Canal, then it's Brick Lane, Spitalfields and Shoreditch proper - 'silicon roundabout' now home to over 3000 high tech establishments including Dopplr, Last FM, Google and Microsoft.

No need to dive out of the shower and start the daily grind into the City from Fashion Place - 20 minutes door to door and you're in the heart of financial London with the tube and forthcoming Crossrail dissecting the metropolis from Liverpool Street. That's city life in style.

Boasting almost 800 sq Ft of living space the lower ground floor offers a master bedroom, good sized double and bathroom tiled from floor to ceiling. The ground floor consists of a large reception room with a separate kitchen leading into the garden.

Allen Road is located on a highly sought after residential road in Stoke Newington. Transport links include a plethora of bus routes, with Canonbury, Stoke Newington and Highbury & Islington being your local train stations.

With its mix of leafy parklands, vibrant social scene, and array of independent businesses, Stoke Newington has become an increasingly popular place to live in North London. At the neighborhood’s epicenter, the High Street is dotted with numerous bars, pubs, restaurants and cafés. You’ll simply be spoilt for choice with places to visit, whatever the hour. Sample flavors from around the world, from traditional British pub grub to Italian fine fare. Or unwind with your favourite cocktail.

The property is ideal for professionals or an investor looking to rent a show-piece property within a glorious corner building.

Please note necessary remedial works have recently been carried out in the lower ground floor and further guarantees and information can be provided upon request.

The apartment is offered chain free with a share of freehold.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Well-positioned freehold house situated in a prime central Dalston location.

This family home is semi-detached, positioned across three levels and boasts a private South-facing garden. The ground level offers an open-plan reception area complete with space for dining and kitchen, WC and excellent storage space available throughout. Upstairs offers flexible accommodation with a well-lit living space which has a bright and airy feel to it, three well-proportioned double bedrooms and a stylish family bathroom. There is also the option to utilise the living area as a fourth bedroom.

Crosby Walk is enviably located in Central Dalston moments from the plethora of bars, restaurants and amenities that both Kingsland Road and Church Street have to offer. The open green spaces of London Fields are a short walk from the property along with the ever-famous Broadway Market which is the perfect location for a weekend meal. Both Dalston Junction and Dalston Overground Station are moments from the property and offer swift access into both Shoreditch and Islington along with numerous bus routes into The City and West End.

Offered chain free.

detailedDescription:
Join us for the Property Launch on Tuesday 29th June 2021 - call now to secure your viewing slot!

This gorgeous conversion is spread across the top floors of a handsome and well-maintained mid-terraced Victorian home on leafy Kyverdale Road. Benefitting from excellent proportions throughout, this spacious apartment oozes style and is light & bright throughout the day.

At just over 841 sq. Ft., this perfect first home boasts; two generous double bedrooms with ample space for wardrobes and green views across the rear gardens. There is a superb, bespoke eat-in kitchen, too, with large sash windows that allow the morning sun to flow through. The charming reception room creates a beautiful space to dine and entertain, and comes complete with the original bay window, which captures the afternoon and evening sun perfectly. There is a stylish bathroom suite, and a well-appointed separate WC, too. Additional benefits include sole access to a large loft, which offers ripe potential to convert, subject to necessary consents.

Kyverdale Road is a popular residential street in N16, close to leafy Stoke Newington Common and award-winning Springfield Park, where you can pick up the River Lea tow path down to Here East and Hackney Wick. Vibrant Stokey High Street and eclectic Church Street are both within a short walk, too. Connections into the City are super speedy, with Stoke Newington Station just around the corner, and both Jubilee and Northwold Road primary schools are close by, which are a popular choice amongst local residents.

Clissold Crescent is ideally located on a picturesque street with easy access to the shops, bars and restaurants of Stoke Newington Church Street while the green open spaces of Clissold Park are also close by.

address: The Penthouse, Principal Tower, Principal Place, Worship Street, London EC2A
detailedDescription:
Principal Tower enjoys a prestigious location overlooking the heart of the City of London, the financial capital of the world, and Shoreditch, the trend-setting capital of the world. The Tower benefits from five major transport hubs within walking distance, making it convenient to access all corners of the capital with ease and speed. London City Airport is an additional asset, being less than 30 minutes away.

By day, the apartments are flooded with natural light, providing an ambiance that is both energising and life-enhancing. By night, residents will enjoy a privileged view of the lights and romance of the world's most famous capital city.

Principal tower will face onto a newly created landscaped piazza, with trees and green spaces. Residents also benefit from amenities that include a lap pool, spa, a state-of-the art gym, cinema, 24-hour concierge and residents' lounge. There are subterranean bicycle storage facilities available and opportunities to acquire parking spaces.

5 minute walk to Liverpool Street station.
8 minute walk to Bank tube station.

To book a viewing please contact Kalmars.

detailedDescription:
Refreshingly original four bedroom modern house set within an exceptional architect-designed gated development moments from Church Street and Clissold Park.
Just one of four, this impressive red-brick three storey residence offers beautiful interiors and generous living and entertaining space, arranged around a calm and secluded cobbled courtyard.
The first sight on entering on the ground floor is the beautiful internal courtyard garden which acts as a light-well illuminating the entrance space and adjacent rooms. Both double bedrooms on this level access the courtyard, one featuring a wonderfully decadent ensuite bathroom with open shower and part-glazed roof. A wet-room/guest cloakroom is also present on this floor.
Moving up to the first floor, the staircase emerges between a stunning south-facing living room with floor to ceiling picture window, and a smart contemporary kitchen with integrated appliances. Sliding doors open to a superb decked terrace which overlooks the development. The top floor boasts a large double bedroom, shower room and spacious principal bedroom with huge picture window, skylight and built-in wardrobes.
The property further benefits from a workshop with double doors, situated outside the building to the left of the front door.
Leafy Clissold Park, and Church Street's eclectic array of eateries, independent shops, pubs and coffee bars are located just a few steps away. There are excellent transport links to The City and West End with numerous good bus routes, and trains from Stoke Newington Station (Overground), Canonbury Station (Overground) and Manor House ( Piccadilly Line).

A principal bedroom with en-suite shower room, two further bedrooms and a bathroom. Close to vibrant Chatsworth and Lower Clapton Roads, a host of transport links close by, include Homerton and Hackney Central Overground Stations offering swift City access. No forward chain.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This 1888 property has been renovated to the highest standard to suit the way we choose to live in the 21st Century whilst incorporating the architectural style and design so desired in a period property.
The villa incorporates a self-contained two double bedroom apartment on the lower floor with an additional five double bedrooms on the upper two floors.

The impressive high ceilings of the entrance hall lead through Crittal doors to the 27' ornate panelled drawing room to the right with a magnificent antique stone fire surround, wood burning stove and fully equipped antique mirrored bar with honed natural stone worktop, copper sink & Sub Zero fridge drawers for entertaining. The Crittall doors to the left of the entrance hall lead to a beautiful 27' kitchen. The kitchen and carpentry is bespoke designed and include electric aga, Wolf gas hob & electric oven & Sub Zero fridge, Quooker, InSinkErator and Barber Wilsons taps. A reclaimed butcher's block is the centrepiece, and one of many unique touches that exemplify the character of the property. To the back of the house there is a guest Cloakroom / WC off the entrance hall and a crittall door leading outside to the rear garden. On the first floor is the stunning master suite with reclaimed French shutters leading through to an under floor heated bathroom, with a huge reclaimed cast iron roll top bath and separate 'wet area' shower using natural stone and oak throughout. There are two spacious double bedrooms situated on the first floor sharing a well appointed bathroom.The second floor has two further large bedrooms, one of which has been cleverly designed as a children's room with bespoke carpentry built-in bunk beds. These two bedrooms share a large family bathroom with twin sinks. The lower ground floor of the property has a seperate entrance and is set out as an independent 2 bedroom apartment with an open plan period panelled living room with wood burning stove linked to a well appointed kitchen with Wolf gas hob and Smeg appliances. The bifold patio doors lead straight to the delightful outside patio area and rear garden.

The garden is filled with lush raised bed planting and mature roses and the lawn and plants benefit from an automated underground watering system. A small garden gate leads to a footpath to the single car garage to the rear of the property.

There is additional parking on the front driveway for 4 vehicles.

The property carefully incorporates concealed state of the art technology and is wired throughout with Cat6 to a media distribution hub (future-proofed), ultra-fast Broadband with 300mbps up and download with up to 1 gbps available, Central station connected dual comms alarm system, three Nest CCTV cameras and bpt Opale house video phone system. Monitor Audio ceiling speakers, and sophisticated TV surround ensure exceptional sound quality throughout the property. Rako controls enable the lighting to be controlled from a smartphone or tablet and Nest Thermostats control the underfloor heating system. The attention to detail is felt throughout the property.

The house is one of only six similar houses and believed to date back to 1880, it is located on the western cusp of E9, which means that both Broadway Market and London Fields are easily accessible to the west, and the village community of 'Victoria Village' with its boutique eateries and independent shops including the renowned Ginger Pig butchers and Victoria Park Farmers Market is within close proximity to the east. Transport links are available from Bethnal Green (0.8m) and Mile End (1m) underground stations, with Cambridge Heath Road (0.7mi) offering overground trains direct to Liverpool Street. There are a number of bus and cycle routes easily found in the immediate neighbourhood.

address: Smithies Court, 41 Pellerin Road, London N16
detailedDescription:
This spacious two bedroom penthouse apartment with City views is located on the top floor of Smithies Court, a highly desirable gated development at the end of a quiet residential cul-de-sac in Dalston.

The main living room is open-plan with large glazed sliding doors which open onto a full-length balcony and an L-shaped kitchen area with fully integrated appliances. The room has an open aspect, with views towards Stoke Newington over rows of two storey Victorian terraces.

Both double bedrooms overlook the landscaped rear communal courtyard and have far-reaching views to the City from large south-facing double glazed doors with Juliet balconies. The master bedroom has an en suite shower room with walk-in shower and bespoke built-in wardrobes. The second bathroom, which has a bath and shower, is located off the central hallway which also houses the washer/dryer within a built-in storage area.

This dual aspect apartment has great natural light throughout and the high spec contemporary fixtures and fitting are in excellent condition. Smithies Court has a video and fob entry system and secure covered cycle storage. The apartment benefits from relatively low service charges and a long lease.

This part of Dalston has undergone huge regeneration in recent years. Adjacent Stoke Newington High Street is bustling with a great variety of independent shops, cafes and restaurants, whilst nearby central Dalston is an east end nightlife hotspot. Central Dalston has two Overground stations; Dalston Kingsland (a six-minute walk) and Dalston Junction (a ten minute walk).

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This beautiful two-bedroom apartment on Richmond Road has recently undergone a sensitive refurbishment. Contemporary materials have been introduced across two generous storeys to capitalise on the natural light and volume of the apartment, arranged in a configuration that seeks to break the boundaries between indoors and out. Glazed doors to the rear conservatory and front main bedroom draw light across the whole plan, while the overall sense of peace and seclusion is emphasised by a small garden with a seating area at the front and a walled garden at the rear.

The Tour

The maisonette occupies a wonderful position on Richmond Road, minutes from London Fields and Broadway Market. It presents a typically Victorian façade to the street, with white-painted brickwork and a charming bay window defining the front elevation.

An entrance hallway shared with the upstairs apartment leads to the front door, which opens into the heart of the apartment: A large open-plan living and dining room. This has high ceilings and is wonderfully bright care of a large bay window which allows plenty of natural light in. Herringbone oak parquet runs underfoot and a sculptural concrete hearth serves as a reminder of the sensitive contemporary interventions. Adjoining the dining room at the rear of the plan is a charming conservatory, currently used as a home office and accessed via glazed doors with small stained glass panels. Steps lead down to the garden via a second set of glazed doors.

A small set of stairs leads down to the contemporary, white kitchen, which has been entirely modernised by the current owners. Sleek Corian worktops with integrated appliances and minimalist units sit alongside blue Moroccan tiles, which bring a dash of colour to the space. Glazed doors lead out to the garden. A large bathroom occupies the remainder of the plan in this section of the apartment; a generous space with white tiles and a full-size bath.

The lower ground floor is occupied by two sizeable double bedrooms, both with bespoke fitted shutters. The larger of the two can be found at the rear of the plan; this has a large walk-in wardrobe/dressing room, as well as stylish wood panelling and a lightwell to the garden. The second bedroom has an en suite shower room and built-in wardrobes, and enjoys access to the seating area at the front of the house via glazed doors. This space gets the early light and is perfectly positioned for a morning coffee.

Outdoor Space

The maisonette has a beautiful sunken seating area in the front garden, utilising some of the original brickwork that formed the house’s coal shoot to create a circular bench, which is bathed in sunlight throughout the morning. To the rear, there is a private garden with raised beds and beautiful white-brick walls, adorned with climbing jasmine, a bottlebrush tree and a mature fig tree.

The Area

Richmond Road is perfectly positioned for the best of London Fields, Wilton Way, Mare Street and Broadway Market. London Fields’ heated lido and tennis courts are a minute’s walk from the front door. There are many fantastic restaurants locally, notably Pophams Bakery, Lardo, Little Duck | The Picklery, Pidgin, and Violet Cakes on Wilton Way. Weekly markets take place at Victoria Park, with Broadway Market also a short walk along the Regent’s Canal Path. E5 Bakehouse, on the edge of London Fields, is excellent for freshly baked artisan bread, and nearby Netil Market is a thriving hub of restaurants, breweries and coffee roasters.

Hackney Central runs direct services to Stratford and Highbury & Islington on the London Overground, and London Fields offers direct trains to Liverpool Street. Bethnal Green Underground Station, easily accessible by bus, has excellent links to central London via the Central Line.

Tenure: Leasehold with Share of Freehold
Lease Length: Approx. 94 years remaining
Council Tax Band: D

detailedDescription:
Join us for the Property Launch on Saturday 29th May. Enquire on the link or call us on to reserve a viewing slot!

At 855 sq ft, this striking two-bedroom garden flat occupies the ground floor of a handsome mid-terraced home on Farleigh Road. Offering unique features throughout, this share of freehold home has featured in various magazines including Vogue & Harpers Bazaar, and comes complete with a large award-winning garden - the perfect sun-trap all year round.

Upon entering the ground floor you are immediately welcomed by a striking hallway, featuring; an exposed brick wall with polished concrete floor, clever storage spaces, a beautiful floor-to-ceiling glass door, and a calming lighting display. The master bedroom benefits from the original bay window along with fitted Plantation Shutters, cast iron radiators, and bespoke fitted wardrobes. The polished concrete floor and exposed brick wall continues through to the reception - which is a real showstopper - featuring; a fantastic entertaining space (complete with wood-burner!) flowing through to the kitchen-diner, which details; Fired Earth slate tiles, reclaimed woodwork kitchen units and a sleek glass roof across the side-extension. The bathroom showcases fantastic attention to detail, with marble tiling, a stunning walk-in shower, striking black fixtures & fittings, and a bespoke concrete-effect sink.

The generous rear garden is designed by the award-winning garden designer Ula Maria, accessed via bi-folding doors from either the dining area or second bedroom - another great-sized double room. The garden features bespoke outdoor lighting, mature trees and thoughtfully designed flower beds. The garden was recently featured in Gardens Illustrated, and has also been featured heavily in numerous press articles on Ula's work.

Farleigh Road is a popular tree-lined residential street in N16, perfectly positioned a stone’s throw away from leafy Hackney Downs Park and eclectic Stokey High Street. There is a thriving sense of community here, too, with the annual summer street party. Vibrant Dalston and Church Street are close by, and there is easy access to speedy transport links around the City and Central London. Connections into the City and Docklands couldn't be easier, with Rectory Road, Dalston Junction & Dalston Kingsland all within a 10 minute walk. The property is also within the catchment for the outstanding Shacklewell Primary School.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Incredibly spacious converted Victorian school, this property measures approximately 1,100sq ft which equates to a modern 3 bedroom house and is located on the top floor of the building which is packed full of original features including sash windows and exposed brickwork.

You enter the property via a grand hallway with wonderfully high ceilings and open-plan living space. A staircase leads up to the mezzanine level with an open plan kitchen, further reception room and adaptable open plan living areas. A unique glass atrium along with the original large sash windows ensures the property is flooded with natural light. Throughout the apartment, there is wooden flooring and additional benefits include secure gated allocated off-street parking, no onward chain and share of freehold with approximately 990 years on the lease, and no ground rent charges.

Currently configured as a one-bedroom open plan split level apartment but easily reconfigured to suit multiple living arrangements due to the apartment's excessive square footage. High-speed broadband and ample natural light make this property ideal for working from home.

The property is truly situated in an excellent position and just moments from the range of shops and amenities within Victoria Park Village and Victoria Park.

Both the 277,425 and 388 bus routes run adjacent to the property with Canary Wharf and the city only moments away. The closest underground station is Mile End (Central Line) is only 1.5 miles away.

The property also has the added benefit of being within the Lauriston School (Ofsted rating good) catchment area.

Investors would expect to recieve around £25000 - £27000 pa rental income on a standard AST, short let's would be more.
