address: Downs Park Road, Hackney, London E8
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

Top 3 things you love about your home
• Victorian design and features - light high rooms
• Flexible space - Room for all
• Garden (south facing)

Three things we love about the area.
• Parks - Hackney Downs, London Fields (with Lido) Queen Elizabeth and wetlands
• Sense of living in a real place with a mix of business and residents Son attended local schools in Dalston and Stoke Newington (Mossbourne Academy on street)
• Close to both Hackney and Dalston - shopping and transport links Easy access to central London
Q&A

• Why are you selling? After 40 years and several generations the house is now too big
• What's the area like? We want to continue living in the area excellent access and facilities
• What is parking like? Street Parking in Zone S of the parking system operated by lb Hackney There are Elec charging points further up road
• How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? Quiet at night and busiest times relate to schools drop offs / collections
• i'm currently working from home; how does that work in this property? There has been at least one of us working from home in the house since 2000 there is ample room to separate work and life.
• What's the internet like? We use a Three 5G system which is ok Open Reach have fibre cables as far as the posts in the street.
• What's the boiler like? Gas and recently installed
• Are we able to do any work/extensions? Subject to planning there maybe options.

The property is wonderfully located within easy access of Hackney Downs and Hackney Central stations as well as regular bus routes, all providing excellent links into the City and West End, and to the surrounding area. There are a wealth of fashionable shops, bars, cafes and restaurants within a short distance, with Dalston and Stoke Newington also close-by, perfectly balanced with the beautiful open spaces of Hackney Downs and Hackney Marshes within easy reach. The area is also well served by an excellent choice of outstanding primary and secondary schools.

detailedDescription:
An imposing Victorian family home built in the late 1800s and totalling over 3,500 sq ft across five floors including shoffice. The property boasts additional width and this is exemplified by the three arched windows on the upper floors. Period features have been retained and restored throughout while kitchens and bathrooms have been renovated. The raised ground floor offers a front reception space with original flooring, sash bay window, marble fire place and coving. Doors separate this from the back reception room overlooking the rear garden. The lower ground floor boasts dual access and there is a bedroom, foot print of the floor above, vault storage, bathroom, Italian marble kitchen and an extended dining area. This leads you to the rear garden partly patio and partly laid to lawn complete with a shoffice to the rear. Here there is off street parking for one car. The upper floors feature more period detail as evident in the reception space on the ground floor and multiple bedrooms with two bathrooms. While much of the property is laid out as bedrooms the space is interchangeable and the floor plate means a wealth of entertaining space and bedroom space is on offer. The view from the front of the property is of St Mark’s church and the windows on Sandringham Road mirror the windows of the church. The view is near unobstructed and the church is set back meaning the property is flooded with natural light, no doubt helped by the orientation. There is ample eaves storage too.

Situation
Located local to both Shacklewell Primary School and Mossbourne Community Academy which have been awarded outstanding by Ofsted. Green space locally includes London Fields and Lido as well as Hackney Downs and Victoria Park. Broadway Market and Mare Street provide ample amenities and some outstanding restaurants including Mare Street Market. Transport links can be found at Dalston Kingsland, Dalston Junction, Hackney Downs and Hackney Central stations.

detailedDescription:
A rare warehouse conversion with two bedrooms with 964 sq ft of living space laterally arranged over the second floor. This urban space offers contemporary features such as exposed brickwork (living area and bedroom) and enjoys floods of natural light throughout the day. The impressive 30’4 ft long open-plan reception room/kitchen is the central hub of this property which is arranged around a stylish rough concrete work surface, big sliding doors out to a Juliette balcony are located at the far end of the room. There is a 14’11 x 14’5 en-suite master bedroom with a further double bedroom measuring 14’5 x 9’10 and also family bathroom. Storage cupboards can be found in the hallway and the lease has just been extended to 999 years.

Situation
Glebe Road is a tiny and easy to miss street that runs parallel to Kingsland Road, it is mainly populated by converted industrial buildings and offers the warehouse living that many seek in Hackney and Shoreditch. There are numerous cool bars and eateries on your doorstep with Old Street, London Fields and Dalston and their limitless nightlife options just moments away. Haggerston (Overground) is the closest rail link with numerous bus links running on Kingsland Rd to take you in to The City.

detailedDescription:
This one bedroom apartment (536 sq ft) in the highly anticipated Long & Waterson completed development, is an excellent opportunity to be nestled within the key intersection of Hackney Road and Old Street in Shoreditch.

Long & Waterson is a boutique collection of ready to move into luxury lofts, apartments and penthouses in Shoreditch.

This apartment consists of open plan reception room with a stunning fitted kitchen, one double bedroom with a contemporary bathroom. The design within the development is effortlessly cool, quintessentially urban with exposed original brickwork in a number of apartments in the building. The interior details of each apartment have been carefully chosen by an international team of world-class designers to reflect the individuality of each home. Large warehouse-style windows flood spacious living areas with light, while detailed brickwork walls, bespoke Italian kitchens and oak engineered timber floors bring quality and character to your home.

The landscape takes shape on four levels, including ground, sunken garden, podium deck and upper sun deck. Located in Shoreditch, where plants cling to brick façades, artists paint bold geometric patterns on blank walls and people’s dress sense embraces the weird, the wonderful and the unconventional. In the back room, timber fences and bamboo create a secret garden, while also providing a barrier to adjacent beautifully landscaped private gardens.

London's Overground rail runs along the west side of the site with links from Hoxton (0.2 miles) followed by Haggerston (0.5 miles) . It is completely urban, yet due to the network of routes surrounding it, the location is surprisingly calm and quiet, providing a place of tranquillity in this inner city development.

Disclaimer - The photography used is of a similar apartment and not of this particular unit.

detailedDescription:
Located on the second floor of the Waterson Building, this 1 bedroom apartment features high quality oak engineered hardwood timber flooring throughout, a bespoke Italian kitchen by Poliform Varenna, Waterworks family bathroom, and integrated comfort cooling. The newly built Waterson Building takes cues from its architectural surroundings, with large windows and an industrial chic feel which, combined with the carefully considered interior, reflects the urban feel synonymous with Shoreditch.

Set back from the bustling intersection of Old Street and Shoreditch High Street, in a peaceful enclave, Long & Waterson is a gated development that has been designed to capture the unique aesthetic of Shoreditch. Drawing on the heritage of the site, which was originally a collection of artisan workshops, the development offers an unrivaled range of homes and on-site facilities.

Long & Waterson offers residents a quiet sanctuary in the heart of Shoreditch, with beautifully landscaped gardens, a High Line-inspired sundeck and podium and a luscious living wallscape by Alexandra Steed urban. The development is serviced by a 24-hour concierge and luxurious waiting area. In addition, a residents Library provides quiet work and meeting space. The private residents gym benefits from state-of-the-art equipment and floor-to-ceiling windows which bathe the space in light and provide views across the landscaped sunken garden. A bookable spa treatment room, wet and dry saunas and intimate residents' cinema offer space to relax and unwind.

Izaki Group Investments is a global real estate development company, with over 60 years' experience, who specialize in design-led developments that create considered communities by delivering best-in-class specification and residents' amenities.

N.B - All photography is of the show apartments at Long & Waterson Apartments.

detailedDescription:
A bright, three double bedrooms, two-bathroom, freehold house set on one of Highbury's most desirable roads. Standing close to 1,100 sqft, the property is presented in good condition throughout and offered to the market on a chain free basis. After entering through your own front door, the ground floor consists of a good-sized kitchen with ample worktop and storage space, a well-proportioned reception leading out to a south-west facing private patio and downstairs wc. The first floor occupies two double bedrooms, the master at present being used as an additional living room by the current occupiers and two bathrooms to the rear. The third bedroom can be found on the half landing and presents superb views over the neighbourhood.
Plimsoll Road is a tree-lined street in the Blackstock triangle which is renowned for its neighbourly feel. Furthermore, the property falls within the catchment area of a number of local schools rated "Outstanding" by Ofsted including the very popular Gillespie and Ambler Schools. The property is perfectly situated for an array of local amenities including independent shops, restaurants and coffee shops as well as being in easy reach of three local parks and Gillespie nature reserve. Upper Street is only a short distance away and transport links are some of the best around with Arsenal station providing the Piccadilly line and Finsbury Park offering overground services (including the Thameslink network serving the City and Gatwick Airport) and underground services on the Victoria line. Drayton park further provides direct links to Moorgate whilst numerous bus routes offer effortless transport to the City and West End.

A stunning, private, sunny garden leads out from the master bedroom and kitchen and its two patio areas each complete with inbuilt seating makes it the perfect space to relax or entertain.

Ambler Road is set in the popular 'Blackstock Triangle' known for its village atmosphere and tree lined streets. detailedDescription:
An exceptional penthouse apartment in Hoxton.

Location

Coronet Street is a small, cobbled turning of mostly warehouse style buildings, linking Old Street, Hoxton Square and Pitfield Street.

Exceptionally well placed for the enjoyment of London's most vibrant and booming creative hubs. There are a wealth of bars, restaurants and boutique retailers in the surrounding locale. The area is also bordered by The City, Spitalfields and Clerkenwell with Bloomsbury and Covent Garden only a short distance away

Located approximately 450 yards from Old Street Station and approximately 730 yards from both Shoreditch high Street Station and Hoxton Station (source: ).

Description

An exceptional penthouse apartment in the heart of Hoxton.

This incredible one bedroom apartment has been completely overhauled by Coffey architects. The ingenious design puts the kitchen 'island' as the centre of the apartment with a glass screen separating the bedroom area. With the flick of a switch the glass can be turned translucent or opaque.

Natural light is plentiful with a number of windows on either side of the main living area. To the rear, a private roof terrace leads directly from the living room.

detailedDescription:
Set in one of Hackney's most sought-after developments is this second floor one-bedroom apartment. The property measures 1,798 square feet and boasts an incredibly high specification and contemporary finish throughout. Comprising high ceilings and extra-large doorways, open-plan kitchen/reception, large bedroom with walk-in dressing room and striking master bathroom with separate shower/sauna room and a separate WC, plus large laundry cupboard. The property also offers a huge amount of storage throughout, private secure parking and a 24-hour concierge service.
Arthaus is a highly creative mixed-use development in the heart of Hackney and just a stone's throw from the open spaces of London Fields. The award-winning developers and international architects have created a mix of superbly designed apartments and working studios within the imposing framework of a former East End art gallery. Benefits of the development include 24-hour concierge, communal roof terrace, secure bicycle storage, yoga studios with a physio/massage service, CCTV and a fantastic lobby playing host to local exhibitions.

Occupying ground floor units are a number of excellent eateries including Lardo, an incredibly atmospheric, world class Italian restaurant, one of London’s coolest burger restaurants Patty & Bun, and Pophams Bakery with the most fantastic coffee. Several transport links service the property. Offered chain free.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £1,000,000 to £1,050,000

This house was converted from a factory in the ‘loft style’ by the award-winning Julian Cowie Architects, and retains its original 1890 bay window.

It has all the benefits of a terraced house, including its own front door, while offering all of the benefits of the Monsell Court development.

There is a reason why these properties rarely come to market: The last one was sold over ten years ago.

The ingenious design maximises the space and light throughout the house, with 3m ceilings on the ground floor and a vaulted living area above, giving a huge space to entertain.

The mezzanine gallery at the top of the house could be used as a third bedroom, but is currently set up as a library and study for two people, making it the ideal place to work from home.

There is a private garden in the south-facing courtyard at the back of a house, and a Juliette balcony which looks out over the palm trees.

Monsell Road is a tree-lined street in Highbury West that connects to the ‘Blackstock Village’, with its traditional butcher, greengrocer, bookshop and vintner, along with cafés and restaurants including Fink’s, Beam and Top Cuvée.

Gillespie School is around the corner. Clissold Park, Gillespie Park, Finsbury Park and Highbury Fields are all nearby, and the whole of London is within easy reach on the Victoria and Piccadilly lines.

Ideal for young families, those looking for something unusual and professionals too.

An early viewing is highly recommend.

Geffrye Place is a bespoke development of just eight apartments set within the historic Kingsland Road conservation area. Which encompasses the renovation of the former Marquis of Lansdown public house and a new four storey building adjacent, in the heart of Hoxton.

This apartment is situated in the new building of the development, to the quieter rear with views across the museum grounds. The view is maximised from a large open plan kitchen/living/dining space with access out onto the large, covered balcony. The apartment has two double bedrooms with built in wardrobes with the master having an en suite shower room.

The apartments benefit from elegant interiors, timber oak flooring, underfloor heating and stunning bespoke joinery work by Faulkus Joinery of Shoreditch. Kitchens feature Siemens appliances, bespoke base and wall cabinets and Hi-Macs worktops.

Geffrye Place is ideally located for all of Hoxton's amenities, central Shoreditch, Columbia Road and Spitalfields are all nearby. It is an area rich with independent boutiques, shops and restaurants and is very well connected, the overground is adjacent, the tube is a short walk, Kingsland road is an artery for the extensive bus network and Hoxton and the surrounding area is fast becoming the cycling capital of London.

There are a number of parks in the locale, the museum park being the closest but Shoreditch Park, Haggerston Park and London Fields are all nearby.

Rayners are delighted to offer for sale this attractive one bedroom flat on the first floor of a modern, well maintained block. The property boasts a stunning riverside location.

Accommodation comprises a wide entrance hallway with inbuilt storage cupboard, leading into the bright reception room, flooded with natural light from dual double glazed windows, and offering ample space for relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with space for free-standing furniture, and a modern bathroom with white three piece suite.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Rectory Road, Hackney Downs, Dalston Junction, Dalston Kingsland and Stoke Newington stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Nearby Stoke Newington and Kingsland Roads offer an array of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, all within just a short distance from the property, with nearby Hackney Downs Park and lovely Clissold Park providing beautiful open spaces. Stoke Newington is also close-by offering a further array of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants.

detailedDescription:
Appointed Sole Agents tba Property have to offer for sale, the largest penthouse loft apartment spanning circa 3,182 sqft in The Factory, an original Victorian warehouse building converted in 1997 by The Manhattan Loft Corporation.

Configured over two floors, this dual aspect 3rd & 4th (top) floor apartment comprises of two large double bedrooms, an open-plan kitchen/living space, a main bathroom and an additional shower room. The large private roof terrace on the upper floor benefits from artificial grass, two access points and an irrigation system.

This former Victorian textiles building is a classic example of industrial to residential conversions near Shoreditch and having been sold as shell and core space, all the loft apartments within are individually different. The building also benefits from lift access, onsite porter and a private/secure underground carpark - 2 designated spaces are included.

This area is becoming known as the much sought after Shepherdess Walk Quarter and is a part of East London between Shoreditch and Islington that contains some of the largest apartments this history rich district of London has to offer. With numerous restaurants, coffee houses and amenities nearby it’s an area that’s a short walk from all the action without the hustle and bustle.

Share of Freehold with a 999 year lease

detailedDescription:
Victorian conversion | spacious 650 square foot garden flat | private front and rear gardens | beautiful condition throughout | facing clapton pond | refurbished recently | private entrance | kerb appeal | chain free ...

Beautifully located on a quiet one way street facing Clapton Pond, this stunning, one bedroom apartment will appeal to individuals and couples looking for an immaculately presented, luxurious apartment with private front and rear gardens and masses of kerb appeal. With lovely flooring, a crisp white modern fitted kitchen, bright tiled bathroom with jacuzzi bath, double glazed sash windows and in great decorative condition, this apartment offers light filled, spacious rooms with the benefit of being ready to move straight in to.

Comprising a private front door and front garden, well sized living room with plenty of space for a reception area, dining and children's toys, modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances ( installed in 2019 ), a spacious hallway with masses of space for storage, vast bedroom and a stylish bathroom. The apartment is completed with a private, rear courtyard garden with a seating area and space for entertaining guests. You can also access the garden of this property via a side entrance.

Further benefits include a long lease, additional storage space, double glazed sash windows, gas central heating via a combi boiler, permit parking and is available to buy chain free.

The property is set back from Lower Clapton Road with Clapton Pond in between. It is a quiet, one way street with a row of Victorian Terraced properties all facing the gorgeous park/ pond and is a desirable location in Hackney for a variety of buyers due to being within a 0.4 mile walk to Clapton Station, Chatsworth Road and Millfields Park.

Lower Clapton Road has every amenity required on your doorstep from the Palm Deli for organic fruit and vegetables to various wine bars, restaurants and stores whilst Chatsworth Road, with its trendy and well renown Sundays market, also offers a variety of independent and large chain stores, pubs, restaurants, bars, coffee shops and other local business'.

Guide price £400,000 - £430,000...

detailedDescription: Spacious three bedroom Victorian terraced house located in a quiet backwater moments from Chatsworth Road and excellent transport links. This superb chain-free property would benefit from some updating, offering a fantastic opportunity for buyers to create their dream family home. Well-proportioned accommodation comprises on the ground floor, a large front reception room with bay window; rear reception with door out to the side-yard; and generous kitchen-diner with bay window and door to a secluded west-facing garden (27' approx). On the split-level first floor there are three double bedrooms and a modern bathroom. Chatsworth Road's eclectic array of eateries, independent shops, pubs and coffee bars are nearby, as are numerous good bus routes and trains from Homerton Station (Overground).

address: Gransden Avenue, London Fields, London E8
detailedDescription:
Chptr London Fields, is an exciting and unique boutique collection of 21 one, two and three bedroom apartments tucked away at the east side of London Fields. The development is gated, and the light and spacious high-spec apartments are grouped around a landscaped central courtyard and all have private terraces or balconies.

All apartments have underfloor heating, engineered wood flooring and 'feature' concrete walls. The kitchen has Bosch integrated appliances, 'J' pull style cabinets and stone worktops & spashbacks. There are high quality, fixtures and fittings, with black/brushed bronze ironmongery throughout. This two bedroom apartment has an Easterly aspect with the terrace getting the morning sun.

This increasingly sought-after neighborhood offers the best of city living in the creative heart of Hackney. Artists, brewers, makers and bakers sit alongside pioneering new workspaces and developments. An intoxicating mix of the old and new reflects the area’s industrial heritage, with converted warehouses, loft style new build apartments and a wide range of artisan shops, bars and restaurants in and around the nearby railway arches.

Everything you need is on your doorstep, from a wide range of local shops, to nearby green space and excellent transport connections. The popular Broadway Market is a short walk away, offering everything from a local fishmonger, butcher and baker to eclectic vintage, books and clothing stores in addition to numerous coffee shops, bars and restaurants. Also nearby are the high street stores of central Hackney and the designer outlet at Hackney Walk.

Hackney has the most green space of any inner London borough and is the cycling capital of the UK. At 31 Gransden you are surrounded by opportunities for a walk or ride in the park, from London Fields (a mere 2 minutes’ walk) and the Regents’ canal towpath, to Haggerston Park, Victoria Park and the extensive Olympic Park. The area is surrounded by a cycle route network and criss-crossed by dedicated cycle routes.

Public transport links are excellent, with easy access to three Overground lines via nearby London Fields, Hackney Central and Dalston Junction or Haggerston, and Bethnal Green Underground station just a mile away.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Warehouse style apartment! This exceptionally bright 829 sqft 2-bed, 2-bath apartment with full height crittall-style windows and a balcony forms part of Eagle Wharf Road - a stylish collection of thirty-six - 1,2 and 3 bedroom warehouse style apartments on Eagle Wharf Road, situated in the heart of Hoxton.

Eagle Wharf Road offers modern, easy living in one of London's most vibrant neighbourhoods. The surrounding streets and canals are packed with galleries and museums, pubs and eccentric cocktail joints, Michelin-star restaurants and food markets, Victorian music halls and experimental art spaces. There's no place quite like it. Inspired by the area's rich industrial and artisanal past, Eagle Wharf Road celebrates Hoxton's age-old authenticity and raw energy with this stylish collection of 36 warehouse style apartments.

Located just off New North Road, these homes have excellent transport links, with Angel and Old Street tube stations a short walk away. Combining quality and craft, these bright and spacious homes are at the heart of the city's most creative neighbourhood. Each apartment features living rooms with integrated Sonos ceiling speakers, dimmable lighting, spacious balconies and full height double doors.. Fitted kitchens have a Silestone worktop and splash-back and Nobilia cabinetry.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: An immaculate two bedroom apartment, located on the first floor of an impressive, end of terrace Victorian house, benefitting from a private and beautifully presented section of the rear garden. Accommodation is generously proportioned and well-arranged comprising; a spacious entrance hallway leading to the large principal bedroom, second bedroom, oversized family bathroom and a striking, open plan kitchen/reception space that is flooded in natural light, and benefits from cleverly designed, bespoke kitchen and storage units, whilst enjoying tranquil views over the rear gardens. Adolphus Road is a wide tree lined residential turning, nestled neatly between Seven Sisters Road and Green Lanes, providing superb access to the transport hub at Finsbury Park station, with national rail trains and two Underground lines (Victoria & Piccadilly). The property is also well located for access to the greenery of Finsbury Park and Clissold Park, the indoor climbing centre on Green Lanes, with the sailing club at the reservoir and the Woodberry Wetlands nature and wildlife reserve.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Guide Price £625,000 to £650,000

Stunning three bedroom maisonette split over the second and third floors within a small low rise purpose built block.

The reception room is one of the main draws to the property being flooded with natural light over looking the award winning garden in Arlington Square.

There is ample space making it ideal to both relax and entertain in.

The separate kitchen is perfect for young families, with plenty of work surfaces including a dishwasher.

Also on the second floor there is a separate WC and two large storage cupboards for your everyday items.

On the third floor, the large master bedroom is located again over looking the square and with built in wardrobes.

In addition to this there is a further good size double bedroom, third bedroom and recently renovated family bathroom.

The property is in good condition throughout.

Location;

Arbon Court is opposite one of the most highly sought after squares in Islington making it a great and peaceful place to live.

Arbon Court is in the catchment area of an Ofsted rated outstanding primary school and there are several good local nurseries.

Also, neighbouring Islington and De Beauvoir Town make it a vibrant place to live with an array of award-winning bars and restaurants.

Upper Street has an array of boutique shops and independent coffee shops.

For entertainment, the Angel Central has a cinema and the 02 Academy, The Everyman Screen on the Green and Almeida Theatre offer more intimate nights out.

Regents Canal and Shoreditch Park are both within five minutes and make for a great walk and have various activities all year round.

Transport;

Angel Underground Station on the Northern Line is within walking distance and is a quick route to other Central London locations, The West End and beyond.

Essex Road National Road station goes both in the direction towards Highbury and Islington or Old Street giving an alternative route to several important transport hubs in London.

Ideal for those looking to upsize and families alike.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

Description

Mega Estates are happy to offer this unique, modern two bedroom apartment situated on the second floor in a new development located in the heart of Kingsland, Dalston.
The apartment boasts a good size open plan kitchen and lounge that also has the feature of a juliet balcony overlooking Kingsland high street.
Leading from the kitchen and lounge is access to the two double bedrooms from the hallway which are both in splendid condition as well as both rooms being carpeted and has double glazed windows. The bathroom is of a three piece feature that also has a railing heater and shower facility that has a very modern look.
One of the greatest feature the property offers is a shared rooftop outside space decked out with park benches and artificial grass overlooking east and central London.
The property has spotlights and double glazed throughout. Location wise, you could not ask for more as the apartment is a stone away from all of the amenities that's needed as well as very easy access to central London.

A rare three bedroom townhouse set mews development in De Beauvoir.

Location

Warburton Close is a quiet modern mews set off the top end of Culford Road, very close to Balls Pond Road and within 200m of Dalston Junction. Local shops, bars and restaurants are all within an easy distance.

Description

A well proportioned 3 bedroom townhouse set in Warburton Close. Boasting of 1300 sq ft of living space this property has a large garage, double bedroom with an en suite and access to a large garden on the ground floor. On the second floor the property has a large reception room with a balcony and a spiral staircase leading to the ground floor, and a separate eat in kitchen. The top floor has a further 2 double bedrooms one with an en suite and an additional family bathroom.

detailedDescription: A truly outstanding 2 double bedroom ground floor warehouse apartment extending to in excess of 1,000sq ft and with its own private patio garden set within this gated passage only moments from the convenience of Dalston Junction station. This former commercial building comprises just 4 flats. Accommodation comprises a hugely impressive and extremely volumous 25ft X 20ft reception/ dining room with a wall of floor to ceiling built-in cupboards providing ample storage and exposed floor boards. The kitchen is open to the reception making it ideal for entertaining. Accessed off the reception room are 2 good size double bedrooms, along with the main family bathroom and a separate shower room. The private patio garden is accessed via the main bedroom and once again is ideal for entertaining. Nimrod Passage is a small gated passage accessed off Tottenham Road providing peace and tranquillity in an otherwise buzzy & vibrant location only moments from the convenience of Dalston Junction station (London Overground). The Regents Canal provides some wonderful walks along towards both Angel & London Fields, whilst a plethora of shops, bars and restaurants can be found locally. For those wishing to travel by bus, Kingsland Road and Southgate Road provide a number of good routes, with the delights of trendy Hoxton and Shoreditch just a short journey away as are London Fields and Broadway Market.

title: 3 bed semi-detached house for sale

detailedDescription:
Fifty storeys high and designed by renowned architects Foster and Partners, Principal Tower is an architectural landmark of merit on London's iconic skyline, desirably situated between the City and fashionable Shoreditch. Commensurate with a development of this prestige and importance, there is a 24 hour concierge service, the opportunity to acquire subterranean secure parking, lap pool, state of the art gym, spa, cinema, and residents' lounge.

Overlooking the City, this svelte new building is the epitome of understated excellence. By day natural light floods through the floor to ceiling windows whilst at night the light and romance of the world's most famous city is a privilege for residents to behold. With two palette options of either champagne or caviar available for the kitchens and bathrooms, the apartments exude style and modern elegance.

This magnificent development offers a magnificent selection of one, two and three bedroom apartments and penthouses of varying sizes.

Located on Principal Place, home to the 600,000 square feet Amazon UK headquarters and 28,000 square feet of retail space, the half-acre piazza offers a plethora of restaurant, cafes, bars, shops, and is host to numerous cultural events. Of note, London City Airport is approximately 30 minutes away and the area is further closely served by Farringdon London Underground and Liverpool Street national rail stations.

Principal Tower complies with a 10 year build warranty by NHBC.
features: ['Apartment', '2 Beds', '1 Reception', '2 Bathrooms', 'Porter', 'Lift']

detailedDescription:
Filled with character and flooded with natural light, this beautiful conversion features a spacious open plan kitchen/reception room and two well proportioned double bedrooms.

Spread over the first floor of a mid-terraced Victorian house, this ideal starter home comprises; a generous open plan kitchen/reception room with two sash windows and wooden flooring, offering the perfect space to dine and entertain. There are two ample double bedrooms; both overlooking the rear gardens. There is a well-finished bathroom suite too. Additional benefits include; a long lease and a chain free sale.

Manse Road is well positioned for quick trips into the City and Central London, with multiple bus routes running along the High Street, Rectory Road and Evering Road all within easy reach. Rectory Road station is close by, offering direct links into London Liverpool Street and onto the Victoria line (at Seven Sisters). The eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along Stokey High Street and Church Street are just a short walk away, and there is also an excellent choice of outstanding local schools, too. Hackney Recreation Ground is just next door (offering a great picnic spot in the warmer months), as is St Pauls Church which hosts the farmers market on Saturdays.

detailedDescription:

Call now to book your place to view our new show home and reserve your dream home.

Located in the heart of Clapton Common is the perfect place to call home. Surrounded by open green space and overlooking leafy Clapton Common, with a diverse tapestry of shops and excellent transport links on your door step!

Plot 92 is a 2 bedroom 2nd floor apartment featuring open plan living, modern kitchen with integrated appliances, private balcony the width of your kitchen/living/diner with floor to ceiling windows allowing maximum light into your home and to make the most of those views! Plenty of storage space in the cupboards off of the hallway, Master bedroom with fitted wardrobe. Amtico flooring and carpet fitted throughout with underfloor heating.

This home is available with London Help to Buy for first time buyers meaning you only need a 5% deposit and get a interest free (for the first 5 years) government loan of up to 40% meaning you only need a 55% mortgage.

The property benefits from a desirable location, situated moments from Chatsworth Road, with its eclectic mix of shops, restaurants and bars very close by.

Further benefitting from excellent transport links with Homerton Overground Station within easy reach, and a number of bus services nearby offering easy access into The City and the West End.

detailedDescription:
*Priced for quick sale - Cash buyers only*
A well proportioned two bedroom apartment with underground parking set on the second floor of this sought-after eco-friendly riverside development close to Chatsworth Road.

Comprising of two double bedrooms, a contemporary bathroom and an open plan kitchen/reception leading out to a full-width private balcony the overlooks a lovely water feature. Paradise Park is a gated development with a video-entry system and secure bicycle spaces that was built approximately 12 years ago to a high specification. All the apartments boast contemporary kitchens with integrated appliances, a designer bathroom, high quality oak engineered flooring and carpets to bedrooms.

Set just moments from popular Chatsworth Road with its vast array of shops, bars and restaurants. The River Lea canal is on your doorstep whilst the open green spaces of Millfields recreation and Lea Valley nature reserve and park, a haven for those that enjoy outdoor activities including an ice rink, canoe and horse riding centre, is just moments away. Local buses routes take you to Hackney Central and beyond. Nearby Clapton Station offers swift and direct links to Liverpool Street Station in approximately 12 minutes.

Offered with no onward chain.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Please note: Affordable Housing. This property is eligible only to buyers who currently work or reside in Hackney, do not own a property, and have an annual income of less than £90,000 per annum.

About the property
Light-filled one-bedroom apartment on the ground floor of a contemporary block of flats in the centre of Hackney Downs. With high specification throughout, this cared for, beautifully presented flat comprises of a sociable open plan kitchen and living room, with floor-to-ceiling windows that open out to a private Juliet balcony. The kitchen boasts sleek design, efficient storage spaces and high-end appliances. The flat further comprises of a bright double bedroom, with a generous wardrobe and plenty of room for a workspace, and a high-end modern bathroom.

About Marcon Place
The apartment is part of a quiet, well-designed contemporary block of flats, boasting access to a well-kept communal garden and outdoor seating, secure bike storage and a video entry system. Just moments from both Hackney Downs and Hackney Central overground stations, there is swift, direct access to Liverpool Street and the City, and the West End and central London. The open green spaces of Hackney Downs and London Fields are minutes away, and the shops, bars, cafes and amenities of Broadway Market, Mare Street, the Hackney Picture House, Chatsworth Road and the wider Hackney area all in walking distance.

About Pocket Living
Pocket creates affordable homes for the ‘city-makers': The people who work in the capital and contribute to its vitality. Run by award-winning architects who believe that great design should be affordable for everyone, they also engage with the housing problems young people face in the 21st century. You can become a Pocket homeowner if you do not currently own a property, you live or work in Hackney and you earn less than £90k.

EPC rating: B

Multiple outstanding schools are located within a half-mile radius, excellent for your children's educational needs.

There's plenty of recreational greenery on your doorstep with Finsbury Park, Clissold Park & Gillespie Park closeby, along with Blackstock Road just a short walk away, hosting a vibrant social scene full of restaurants, coffee shops, bars and other amenities.

address: Walrond House, Matthias Road, Hackney, London N16
detailedDescription: A beautifully bright and extremely well presented 2 double bedroom apartment set on the 4th floor of this new development conveniently located for access to both the cafes of Newington Green and Dalston Kingsland. The property benefits from a wonderful south facing terrace which is accessed via the beautiful triple aspect open-plan kitchen/ dining/ reception room affording superb views across London. Accommodation comprises master bedroom with built-in wardrobes and en-suite shower room, double second bedroom, main family bathroom, ample built-in storage in the entrance hall and the truly fabulous open-plan kitchen/ dining/ reception room. It should be noted that the principal rooms all benefit from a southerly aspect. The property is conveniently located on Mathias Road running from Newington Green down towards the bustle of Kingsland Road in Dalston or short walk or cycle ride to Clissold swimming pool or Clissold Park (with tennis courts, skate board park and large specialist kids playground). This is a rare opportunity to buy a superb town house on the edge of one of the coolest/trendiest parts of town and the amenities of M&S foodhall, a large Sainsbury's supermarket, Tesco Express and Ridley Road street market on the doorstep. Transport is equally impressive with three bus stops within short walking distance providing fast and convenient bus services to Islington, the City, Central London and the West End. Moreover the North London line at Dalston Kingsland provides direct east west travel between Richmond and Stratford and connection to the Victoria Line at Highbury and Islington whereas the East London Line at Dalston Junction provides direct travel to the south and east including New Cross, Crystal Palace, West Croydon and Clapham Junction and connections to Canary Wharf either by Jubilee Line (Canada Water) or DLR (Shadwell).

detailedDescription:
Stamp duty holiday extension - Continue your search for the perfect property with JLL and benefit from the same incredible stamp duty savings previously offered by the government, up to £15,000.

The Makers is a residential development of 175 new homes, including studios, two and three-bedroom apartments and family duplexes. Tucked away from City Road, between the vibrancy and dynamism of the Shoreditch area and the financial district of the City of London, the location provides a quiet retreat within the capital. Residents will benefit from a generous provision of private communal facilities including a screening room, two landscaped garden terraces, a gym, a treatment room and three lounges, perfect for ad-hoc meetings.

A breathtaking double-height entrance lobby hosts a 24/7 concierge, providing peace of mind, secure mail and delivery services, and access to bookable facilities. With interior design by Woods Bagot, the material palette takes inspiration from the 1920s – a stunning feature wall, terrazzo flooring, bespoke lighting, custom furniture, brass details and smoked oak chevron floors set the tone for what is to follow.

The apartments have been designed for modern living, making the most of the architectural merits of the building. Smoked oak front doors with unlacquered brass door handles open into the spacious apartments. Those in the tower part of the building feature floor-to-ceiling picture windows to maximise magnificent views of the city, while south-facing windows in the Nile Street podium apartments bathe them in natural light. The majority of the Nile Street apartments have open balconies accessed directly from the living areas, while the top floor family duplexes have large private landscaped roof gardens offering an enviable inside-outside connection that is rare in the heart
of the city.

The interior finish is achieved through a combination of high quality materials and distinctive design details. Generous open-plan living rooms make clever use of the space, while the material palette shows it off at its best. Features include engineered oak plank flooring and two-tone kitchen cabinets that blend seamlessly into the living area, with contrasting composite stone worktops, integrated appliances by Siemens and Bosch, and contemporary black fittings. The tower apartments will also have comfort cooling in the living area and master bedrooms to ensure the perfect ambient temperature all year round.

Regsiter your interest today

***guide price £425,000 - £450,000***
Portico are delighted to offer for sale this modern two bedroom property arranged on the second floor of this small purpose built development in Hackney Central. Presented in good order throughout the property would suit the first time buyer looking for a smart home ready to move in.

The excellent accommodation comprises good size reception room with private balcony, separate modern kitchen breakfast room, two double bedrooms and family bathroom.

The development further benefits from a secure fob entry system, two separate locations for bicycle storage as well as a communal courtyard, perfect for the warmer months.

With an abundance of amenities close by including the restaurants, bars and independent boutiques the property is ideally located near the green open spaces of Hackney Downs and enviably close to vibrant Mare Street, Dalston and London Fields and Victoria Park Village with transport links including Hackney Downs and Dalston Junction Overground station offering swift City and West End access.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Stunning two bedroom period maisonette split over the top two floors and over 791 square feet.

The dual aspect open plan reception room is one of the main draws to the property.

The high ceilings and large windows further add to the enjoyment of living within the property.

The flow between the kitchen and reception room works perfectly with ample space for a large dining table making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

The kitchen is predominately integrated with all your everyday mod cons and further benefits from a breakfast bar.

On the top floor there are two good size double bedrooms both offering plenty of space for a chest of draws and wardrobes, or even space for a desk too.

The bathroom feels light and airy, and is well proportioned for the size of the property and has a full size bath.

In the hallway there are two large storage cupboards for your more sizeable everyday items.

The property is in excellent condition throughout.

Location;

Milton Grove is a one-way road, making it a nice quiet spot, and is set back from the main road whilst still having good connections.

The flat is a thirty-second walk away from a locals' favourite pub, Luminary Bakery, and neighbourhood shops.

Clissold Park is a 5-minute walk away, with tennis courts, playgrounds and green space - with several events held there throughout the year.

Newington Green has an array of everyday amenities alongside boutique shops and award-winning bars and restaurants, as well as a strong community feel.

Church Street, with an array of local shops and restaurants, and and Stoke Newington High Street, leading to Dalston, are both within walking distance either side of Albion Road and offer a great contrast of two very different vibes.

Newington Green has excellent bus links to the City, King's Cross, Euston, the West End and beyond.

Canonbury Overground Station is a 10-minute walk away and provides access to Highbury & Islington Station (Victoria Line), to Canary Wharf via Canada Water (Jubilee Line) and direct to Shoreditch High Street too.

Ideal for first-time buyers, new families or a pied-à-terre.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Well-configured three bedroom mews house in the heart of De Beauvoir.

Location

Situated in N1, the heart of De Beauvoir, you have the open spaces of London Fields and Broadway Market just around the corner, with its boutique shops, bars and restaurants on your doorstep, as well as all of the amenities found on Kingsland High Street. Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground stations are under 0.4 miles away, providing quick and easy transport links to the City and West End.

Description

This exceptional Freehold property is situated in a quiet secluded gated mews, in a popular part of De Beauvoir. Presented in excellent condition and arranged over approx. 1092 sq ft, this property is arranged over two levels of well-proportioned accommodation and would make a perfect family home. Comprising an open plan reception/Kitchen area, a patio space to the rear, kitchen with built-in appliances, three bedrooms, two bathrooms, a separate WC and useful built-in storage. The property is well arranged and well-configured offering plenty of space and light throughout. Secure parking is also available.

detailedDescription:
This spacious and attractive four bedroom terraced house is located on a quiet residential street in the pretty Shacklewell conservation area; a small oasis of calm just a couple of minutes from the bustle of vibrant Dalston with its eclectic mix of quirky shops, bars, and restaurants.

The house offers a perfect mix of Victorian charm updated with modern, high spec kitchen and bathrooms, trendy radiators and wooden floors. There is a dual aspect living room which overlooks the south facing private garden.
Location


The area has fantastic transport links with Dalston Kingsland, Dalston Junction and Rectory Road Stations just a short walk away together with A10 with its many bus routes. Canary Wharf, The City and the West End are just a 30-minute journey. The open spaces of Hackney Downs, London Fields and the Lee Valley nature reserve are all close by as are several excellent schools.
Dalston was recently described by French “Vogue” as the trendiest place in the world and house prices have boomed, making it perfect both for those eager to enjoy the fantastic lifestyle on offer and those looking for an investment.

Ideal for first-time buyers or investors alike, this lovely home has been beautifully renovated by the current owners and benefits from two good-sized double bedrooms with built-in wardrobes, a modern bathroom, a spacious fitted kitchen and a bright and large reception room.

Additional benefits include new flooring throughout, a newly tiled bathroom and a new kitchen.

Externally, you can enjoy a lovely large communal garden with an additional private storage shed.
Location

Oakfield Lodge is enviably located in the vibrant area of Clapton and 10 minutes’ walk from Stoke Newington Church Street. Well connected being 5 minutes’ walk from both Rectory Road and Clapton London Overground stations, both provide access to London Liverpool Street in 15 minutes. Rectory Road station connects with the Victoria Line, via Seven Sisters, with Oxford Circus accessible in 20 minutes. The City is also easily accessible by bike via the London cycle network.
The area benefits from an abundance of green open spaces with Hackney Downs, Clissold Park, Millfields Park, Walthamstow Marshes and Victoria Park all within walking distance.

detailedDescription:
Set on this sought-after road near Finsbury Park is this superb two-bedroom conversion arranged over the top floor of an imposing Victorian House. This bright and spacious 2-bedroom apartment is well decorated with period features throughout. The property would be a offers a peaceful and social space while benefiting from a huge amount of natural light in all the rooms. On entering the property, you are welcomed into a wonderfully generous living area, with a larger than average eat in kitchen, offering the perfect entertaining space. There is a well-proportioned master bedroom, and further second bedroom, perfect as a guest room or study. The bathroom has a contemporary feel while the property also benefits from a large attic space and access to a beautiful roof terrace off the communal landing (currently undemised).
Princess Crescent is perfectly located for the amenities of the prestigious Highbury Barn and Blackstock Road. The green open spaces of Clissold Park (0.5m), Finsbury Park (0.3m) and the bars and restaurants of the vibrant Stoke Newington Church St are also close by. Other notable points of interests that are on your doorstep include the West Reservoir (0.4m), Gillespie Park, (0.7m), Parkland walk (0.7m), Highbury Fields (1.1m), Abney Park (1.2m) and Newington Green (1.2m).
Transport Links are well serviced with Arsenal (Piccadilly Line) and Finsbury Park (Victoria Line) tube stations both a short distance away. There are also great bus links running near to the property taking you into the City and the West End.

Transport links can be found at Homerton and Hackney Wick Overground stations together with regular buses. The flat is also well placed to take advantage of some of East London's best green spaces, including Hackney Marshes, The Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park and Victoria Park.

This spacious family home enjoys a fantastic setting adjacent to the green open spaces of Mabley Green and offers a super degree of potential and flexibility. The property benefits from excellent off-street parking located to the rear and has a good sized private garden.

The accommodation, arranged over three storeys, comprises: Good sized reception room, fitted kitchen, downstairs shower room, three double bedrooms, home office/fourth bedroom, and family bathroom.

A generous fifth floor apartment the heart of the Shoreditch Triangle.

Location

Bateman's Row runs between Shoreditch high Street and Curtain road, in the centre of the area often referred to as the 'Shoreditch triangle'.

There is a wonderful range of restaurants and nightlife in the area and close proximity into the City makes it a popular location for professionals

Description

A generous two bedroom, two bathroom apartment on the fifth floor of a popular development. Located in the heart of the Shoreditch Triangle the property offers an abundance of natural light throughout. Upon entry there is a generous double width hallway that leads to a sleek reception room. Both bedrooms are well-proportioned, with the main bedroom benefiting from a large en-suite, remote controlled air conditioning, and fitted double-depth wardrobes. There is a modern eat in kitchen that has been fitted with high specification integrated appliances, including a built-in wine cooler. The property also has a generous guest shower room. Further benefits include secure off street parking, plenty of storage throughout and easy access to all the local amenities that Shoreditch has to offer.

detailedDescription:
An impressive 3 bedroom apartment spanning circa 930 square foot, and boasting a private balcony with great natural light and charming roof top views of the surrounding area from the 4th floor. Offered in excellent decorative order and set to the rear of this smart development; the property enjoys all the benefits of being in the heart of Dalston, whilst also being located on the quiet side of the building.

2 Boleyn Road forms part of Dalston Curve and was constructed in 2016 and consists of 57 apartments moments from Dalston Kingsland & Dalston Junction stations. This high specification apartment features open plan entertaining space with Amtico flooring, metal framed double glazed windows throughout, an integrated Nobilia kitchen with Siemens and Zanussi appliances, Porcelanosa tiling to bathrooms and Stelrad radiators with thermostatic controls. Comprising entrance hall with a generous storage cupboard, open plan living and kitchen space with ample room for dining and a private balcony, main bedroom with built in wardrobes and an en-suite shower room, a main bathroom and two additional bedrooms (three in total) with floor to ceiling windows allowing for an abundance of natural light.

2 Boleyn Road has secure cycle storage and a residents communal roof terrace with a sunny west facing aspect.
The area boats endless cafés, bars and general amenities including The Dusty Knuckle Bakery, The Duke Wellington, The Victoria, Newcomer Wines, The Dalston Eastern Curve Garden, Little Duck The Picklery, The Rio Cinema, Dalston Superstore, Voodo Rays and Allpress Dalston to name just a few!
Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction overground stations are approximately 0.1 miles away, and there are a number of excellent bus routes along Kingsland Road. Dalston itself affords easy access into neighbouring Islington, Canonbury, Stoke Newington, Haggerston and Hackney Central, as well as the open green spaces of Hackney Downs and London Fields.

detailedDescription:
A stunning 3 bedroom apartment with spectacular uninterrupted views of the West Reservoir and city skyline, a 24 hour concierge service and within a short walk of a zone 2 underground station served by the Piccadilly line. Set in a development with 42 acres of open water and 15 acres of landscaped parkland

Situated on the 6th floor, this spacious property benefits from two balconies which offer views of the East and West Reservoirs and the City of London skyline as well as having a dual aspect living room with floor to ceiling windows which allows a large amount of natural light into the property, ensuring it is well light throughout the day. The living area is very spacious, and the kitchen is fully integrated to a high specification. The property features a seperate utilities cupboard with washer/dryer and storage.

The three double bedrooms also have floor to ceiling windows with the master bedroom benefits from an en-suite bathroom and dressing area. There is also a private south facing balcony from the master bedroom. The property has a large amount of storage space throughout the flat.

This flat is situated in the Woodberry Down development which has a Sainsbury's local, a Co-Op, a café and bar, an Italian restaurant and Gastro pub within the development. Both Finsbury Park and Stoke Newington are within a mile of the property which offer a wider choice of bars and restaurants. Manor House Underground Station is located 0.3 miles from the property which is served by the Piccadilly line. This property also comes with allocated parking space in a secure underground car park.

Riverside Apartments benefits from a long lease of 988 years remaining.

Early viewing is recommended.

detailedDescription:
Cash buyers only. Situated on the sixteenth floor of this purpose built building comes this bright, beautifully presented, two double bedroom apartment with private balcony offering stunning views over Hackney Marshes and the Olympic Park, also benefiting from allocated on site parking.
The property also offers concierge, communal gymnasium, laundry room and has just undergone a £2M+ external renovation. The property offers light, bright and airy accommodation with stunning views throughout. Boasting its own balcony space just off the big reception room with large windows to take full advantage of the views, a separate kitchen, two double bedroom and bathroom with separate toilet. Other benefits also include a 24hr concierge making the development very secure. If you're a fitness enthusiast then you will not be disappointed as residents have access to the on site gym. The property can be found a stone's throw from trendy Chatsworth Road opening up its ever growing array of trendy cafes, bars and restaurants and it's within easy reach of the A12 offering good transport links into London for motorists, as well as good bus links into many parts of the City from just outside of the property. It's also situated within a mile of the Olympic Village and Westfield Shopping Centre.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
This Victorian end of terrace family home is immaculately presented after a complete refurbishment and totals over 2,500 sq ft over four floors. Period features have been retained, enhanced, and blended brilliantly with unique interior design. The kerb appeal to the exterior of the property is faultless after this too underwent complete renovation including new double glazed sash windows. The ground floor reception and reading area benefits from ornate cornicing, fire place, high ceilings and Strathearm engineered oak flooring which continues throughout. The kitchen has a poured concrete floor, is finished with custom stainless steel, and boasts appliances to include a Wolf range cooker and Amana French door steel fridge. This leads to a landscaped rear garden facing west which is decked and laid to lawn. The WC is also on this floor complete with Tom Dixon lighting and the entire floor, as well us bathrooms upstairs, have under floor heating. Conveniently the lower ground floor has been completely fitted as an independent utility area. The upper floors, via the original staircase and past the beautiful stained glass window, contain four bedrooms and two bathrooms complete with principal suite, walk in wardrobe and en-suite. Bathrooms have been finished using Perrin and Rowe accessories and Fired Earth tiling. The property is for sale chain free.

Situation
Digby Crescent is a residential period tree lined street accessed via Queens Drive and is perfectly situated between the green open spaces of Clissold and Finsbury Park.

title: 1 bed property for sale

detailedDescription:
Named after Andy Warhol's notorious New York loft studio - The Factory converted in 1999 by The Manhattan Loft Corporation...

Set on the second floor of this former 19th century print-works, this superb bright airy space, a little over 1500 sq ft, is a fine example of lateral loft living.

Featuring a stunning open-plan reception, with a fully fitted kitchen, complete with integrated appliances. One large double bedroom, with en-suite bathroom and great study to work from home or an un-official second bedroom. The space has exposed brickwork, solid wood floors throughout, industrial crittal windows and the added benefit of secure garage car parking.

Straddling the borders of Shoreditch, Clerkenwell and Islington, this superbly located building is perfectly connected for live, work and play and only a few minutes walk to Old Street station.

Quote from Space Station director and former resident.

"You can only truly appreciate what a great building this is, when you've lived in The Factory. Apart from it being one of best warehouse conversions, what's really unique is the close knit community, who care about the building and lookout for each other, which only adds to the special atmosphere"
title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Riverside Apartments, Goodchild Road, London N4
detailedDescription:
Stunning modern Three-bedroom Penthouse apartment in award-winning waterside development by Berkeley Group.

Riverside Apartments is a beautifully designed residential development within the Woodberry Down development and is positioned by the famous reservoirs of Woodberry Wetlands, offering breathtaking views across the water and London.

This highly sought after home with floor to ceiling double glazed windows and underfloor heating throughout, offers far-stretching views, and excellent natural light. Spacious in size, over a lateral floor plan, the layout of the home offers perfect separation from the living space and sleeping area.

The living room and open-plan kitchen is finished with premium standard engineered wooden floors consisting of a large high-specification kitchen, with built-in appliances. Open plan to a generously sized living room area, which leads on to your large private balcony with panoramic views across the reservoirs and City.

To the front of the apartment, the sleeping area benefits from 3 large double bedrooms, with a high graded tile flooring en-suite bathroom and dressing area to the primary bedroom and fantastic storage space throughout.

As a resident of Riverside Apartments, you have exclusive access to:

A Private Residents Gym

Secure Underground Parking Space

Secure Cycle Storage

24-Hour Concierge Service

Located at Woodberry Down development, spanning over 67 acres of open water and landscaped parkland, you are part of superb community which is extremely well-connected. By foot, you can enjoy a riverside walk within the unique waterside community surrounded by nature. The reservoirs offer a variety of activities which are very popular with families and individuals of all ages. These can include; Sailing Club, Climbing Centre, Castle Gardens, Nature Reserve. Not to forget a variety of regular events held, which include the Hidden River Festival and Outdoor Cinema to name a couple.

Residents benefit from a lovely community, with many shops, restaurants, and amenities on your doorstep; including a Sainsburys and local independent supermarket, organic coffee shops, restaurants, beauty salon and dry cleaners. Many of the local businesses and independent, and family run, reflecting on the community you will be part of.

Families can benefit from outstanding primary and secondary schools within the area.

Moments away from Manor House Tube Station, giving you fast links to Kings Cross, Covent Garden, and Leicester Square on the Piccadilly Line. A little further and you have Haringey Green overground.

address: Belgrade Road, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
*Physical Viewings Being Accepted* *Virtual Tour Available*
An exquisite architecturally designed three storey freehold house set in Stoke Newington and on the cusp of Dalston.

An abundance of natural light floods this incredible property, consisting of a charming double reception with a gas fire that leads to an oversized kitchen/entertaining space that incorporates a glass ceiling box, which flows to a private south facing garden through bifold doors, occupies the ground floor, along with an inviting hallway and separate W/C. The first floor consists of three double bedrooms, and a contemporary shower room. Stairs then lead to a stunning newly constructed substantial top floor master bedroom with fitted wardrobes, Velux window, skylight, and an abundance of eaves storage. A sleek classic bathroom then concludes the upper floor. A basement which is used as a utility area and storage then completes the property.
Features include, marble bathroom tiles, original fireplaces surround, double glazed sash windows, high ceilings, original cornicing, original ceiling rose, bespoke kitchen, ceramic kitchen sink, underfloor heating with polished concrete floors and bespoke wooden panelled wall in kitchen/entertaining space, original window shutters, bespoke window shutters, original wooden floors, and high ceilings.
Belgrade Road is perfectly located for excellent transport links which include Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations, as well as various bus routes allowing for swift and direct access to the City and West End, all of which are within a short walk. As well as the green open spaces of Hackney Downs Park and Clissold Park, a plethora of eateries, shops and amenities are available within a stone throw away.

3D Virtual Tour - This property has a fully immersive walk through.
Butler & Stag is delighted to offer Virtual Viewings to all our residential clients. This innovative 3D property technology allows prospective buyers or tenants to immerse themselves with a virtual walk through of each of our properties 24 hours a day, 7 days a week, whilst in the comfort of their home, work or wherever they may be.
Like what you see? Please contact us for more information and to arrange a physical viewing.

detailedDescription:
This wonderful one-bed loft apartment is located on the fourth floor of this former chocolate factory with high-ceilings and large south-facing windows. The kitchen and reception is 25’ allowing for plenty of space for dining and lounge seating. The bedroom is also roomy with recessed wardrobe space and equally large window which attract a lot of natural light. There is wood flooring throughout with original steel beams and exposed red brickwork on south-facing walls.

The Chocolate Studios are located on Shepherdess Walk which in equidistant to Angel, Shoreditch, Hoxton as well as Old Street or what is becoming known as ‘East London Tech City’. Old Street station is only 6 mins walk where Angel is a further 9 mins walk in the opposite direction where The City is within easy walking distance. Bus routes are plentiful, southbound towards Moorgate (14 minutes) and northerly towards Kings Cross and St Pancras (10 mins) offering local national and international destinations.

This popular area has many attractions within walking distance including Upper Street, Exmouth Market and Whitecross Market offering a daily vibrant street food scene. The internationally renowned Barbican Centre, Saddlers Wells and The Almeida Theatre are also close by where a variety of restaurants, bars, cafés and boutiques can be found in nearby Islington High Street, Upper Street, N1 and Shoreditch. The Regents Canal is also very near providing a very popular pedestrian and cycling route towards Angel and Kings Cross as well as Broadway Market and Victoria Park to the East.

address: Residence Tower, Woodberry Grove, London N4
detailedDescription:
*Click the link for a Virtual Tour!*

Looking for a pristine balcony apartment with a west and north-facing dual aspect – set in a unique waterside development with access to a residents' gym, on-site retail outlets, and the entirety of the Woodberry Wetlands Nature Reserve and reservoirs on your doorstep?

This bright and sunny 2-bed on the 2nd floor of the eye-catching Residence Tower comes with underfloor heating and overhead spotlights, wooden flooring and floor-to-ceiling windows throughout – and a private, west-facing balcony with views out towards the West Reservoir.

As you step through onto the wooden floor of your new entrance hall, you'll find a generous storage area tucked away on your left, neatly hidden behind a double set of closing doors.

To your right, you'll find the first of two immaculate, modern bathrooms, complete with a recessed vanity mirror over a square basin, a heated towel rail, and a frameless glass screen shower over a white bath – all of it finished beautifully with dark wooden panelling against large-format, soft-coloured tiling on the walls.

Around the corner to your right, you'll come to the apartment's two north-facing bedrooms, each with their own views over the courtyard below through their floor-to-ceiling windows. The larger master bedroom also comes with a triple set of integrated, sliding-door wardrobes, as well as its own private en-suite bathroom – with similar specifications to the family bathroom (with an extra-wide rain-style, walk-in shower enclosure in place of the bath).

Across from the apartment's sleeping areas, you'll find a bright and sunny open-plan living, dining, and kitchen area. And the first thing you'll notice is the abundance of natural light from the floor-to-ceiling, wrap-around corner windows that lead to your own private, wooden-decked balcony.

It's the perfect sunny spot to admire the views of the gardens and courtyard below, with a west-facing aspect that's carefully positioned to capture the best of the afternoon light and the evening sunsets in the open skies over the nearby West Reservoir.

Back in the living room, you'll find a fully equipped kitchen area, with feature-lit cabinetry over a soft-coloured worktop with a gloss-effect splashback, a touch-control hob over an integrated oven, and an additional countertop and cabinets in a separate unit off to the side.

Beyond the walls of your pristine new home, you couldn't ask for a better location:

You'll be just a 7-minute walk away from Manor House Tube Station, giving you fast links to King's Cross (in 8 minutes), or Covent Garden and Oxford Circus (in 16 minutes) – as well as a 7-minute walk from the vast open spaces of Finsbury Park, with over a hundred acres of natural beauty to explore.

You'll also be just moments from the Woodberry Wetlands, an urban oasis covering 17 acres of nature reserve (including two expansive reservoirs just a 2-minute walk from your home) – as well as the historic New River waterway for charming waterside walking routes.

This immaculate balcony 2-bed on the 2nd floor of a highly coveted waterside development comes with a west and north-facing dual aspect, a range of on-site facilities and amenities, and west-facing views from its own private, wooden-decked balcony.

And that means a property like this won't be around for long.

So if you're looking for a beautifully presented new home with wrap-around natural light – just minutes from the Tube, and surrounded by natural beauty – give us a call and we'll show you everything life at Residence Tower has to offer.

  • Bus routes nearby: Route 318 from Grovelands Road and Route 67,76,149,349,476 & N73 from Egerton Road. Clapton Common bus stop is also nearby served by Route 253,254, N253.


The property comprises:


  • Entrance: Hallway with private entrance.
  • Living Room: Spacious lounge open plan to kitchen with double height atrium. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Kitchen: Gloss white base and wall units with dark grey worktop and stainless steel splash back. Integrated fridge freezer, oven, hob and extractor fan. Utility room with white washer/dryer and pantry shelf. Engineered oak flooring.
  • Bedroom One: Double Bedroom with walk-in closet and door to balcony. Wool twist carpet
  • Bedroom Two: Double Bedroom. Wool twist carpet.
  • Bathroom Upstairs: White suite comprising panelled bath with shower over, WC and hand washbasin and large mirror over. Full height tiling. Heated towel rail. Tiled flooring.

What happens after I register my interest?

After registering your interest for a Peabody home, you will receive an email confirmation from us. The email will confirm what you need to do next to secure a property viewing which includes completing a financial assessment with a mortgage advisor and completing the Shared Ownership Application Form.

If you don’t receive this email within an hour of your registration, please check your spam or junk folders and set your spam filter to allow incoming emails from Peabody. If you still haven’t received the email after checking here, please contact and our team will be able to help you.

Love London Property are proud to present this large modern 4 bedroom, 3 bathroom semi-detached house to the market.

This large semi detached house was built in 2012 and comes with a private garden and off street parking.

On the ground floor you will find a large hallway which leads onto the lounge and separate kitchen, with access to the garden access via the kitchen.

You will also find a large bathroom on the ground floor.

The first floor offers two large bedrooms and second bathroom with two further large bathrooms and a third bathroom on the second floor.

Evering Road is on a quiet tree lined street that runs between Stoke Newington and Clapton, and is well placed for quick trips into the City and Central London with access to two over ground stations, Clapton and Rectory Road (Overground) - only a short walk away - offering direct links into London Liverpool Street and Seven Sisters (Victoria line). Hackney Downs and Stoke Newington Church Street Road are also within easy reach, offering an eclectic blend of independent shops, bars and restaurants.. There are also a number of local bus routes that connect to The City and West end operating from either end of the street.

This house would be perfect for a family or any investors looking to buy in this postcode.

detailedDescription:
This purpose-built one bedroom apartment is the perfect Hoxton pied-a-terre.

Bracklyn Court is set in landscaped communal gardens, opposite Shoreditch Park and a ten-minute cycle to the City. Ingenious use of space in this ground floor apartment provides a separate kitchen/dining area in addition to the main reception room, and a WC in addition to the bathroom. The apartment has been well-maintained and has contemporary décor throughout.

The apartment is dual east-west aspect, with a private front entrance leading to an entrance hall with storage cupboard and WC, fully equipped kitchen with dining area, and reception room with views to the rear gardens. The bedroom also has views over the gardens and a fully tiled en suite shower room.

Shoreditch Park is a popular green space, and the surrounding area is benefitting from large scale improvements such as the rebuilding of the pool and sports courts at the Britannia Leisure Centre, and numerous new build developments which are bringing new shops and amenities to this thriving neighbourhood.

detailedDescription:
Warehouse style apartment! This exceptionally bright 829 sqft 2-bed, 2-bath apartment with full height crittall-style windows and a balcony forms part of Eagle Wharf Road - a stylish collection of thirty-six - 1,2 and 3 bedroom warehouse style apartments on Eagle Wharf Road, situated in the heart of Hoxton.
Eagle Wharf Road offers modern, easy living in one of London's most vibrant neighbourhoods. The surrounding streets and canals are packed with galleries and museums, pubs and eccentric cocktail joints, Michelin-star restaurants and food markets, Victorian music halls and experimental art spaces. There's no place quite like it.

Eagle Wharf Road offers modern, easy living in one of London's most vibrant neighbourhoods. The surrounding streets and canals are packed with galleries and museums, pubs and eccentric cocktail joints, Michelin-star restaurants and food markets, Victorian music halls and experimental art spaces. There's no place quite like it.
Inspired by the area's rich industrial and artisanal past, Eagle Wharf Road celebrates Hoxton's age-old authenticity and raw energy with this stylish collection of 36 warehouse style apartments.

Located just off New North Road, these homes have excellent transport links, with Angel and Old Street tube stations a short walk away.
Combining quality and craft, these bright and spacious homes are at the heart of the city's most creative neighbourhood.
Each apartment features living rooms with integrated Sonos ceiling speakers, dimmable lighting, spacious balconies and full height double doors.. Fitted kitchens have a Silestone worktop and splash-back and Nobilia cabinetry.
