address: Mortimer Road, De Beauvoir, Hackney, London N1
detailedDescription: An absolutely charming 3/4 bedroom early Victorian end of terrace house set on this delightful no-through traffic road located right in the heart of De Beauvoir, moments from the greenery and open space of De Beauvoir Square. Set back from the road behind a beautifully kept gated front garden the house has a very welcoming homely feel, awash with much of the original charm & character. Accommodation comprises 2 very well proportioned double bedrooms, along with a further single bedroom/ study and the main family bathroom on the top (1st) floor. The raised ground floor is home to a wonderful dual aspect through reception room complete with many of the original features including 2 wonderful fireplaces, working shutters and ornate ceiling cornice. Also on this level is a guest WC. On the lower ground floor can be found a very good size double bedroom and utility room both positioned to the front of the house with a charming family kitchen/ dining room to the rear with doors out to the wonderful private rear garden. The garden wraps around the side of the house with a gate providing the side access. Of notable benefit is the storage space that exists within the attic. The house occupies a prominent position on this delightful no-through road just South of the greenery of De Beauvoir Square and around the corner form the delights of the locally renowned De Beauvoir deli. The Regents Canal provides some wonderful walks along towards both Angel & London Fields. The closest station is Haggerston forming part of the London Overground network, whilst a plethora of shops, bars and restaurants can be found locally. For those wishing to travel by bus, Kingsland Road and Southgate Road provide a number of good routes, with the delights of vibrant, trendy Hoxton and Shoreditch just a short journey away as are London Fields and Broadway Market.

Woodberry Down is on the banks of the West and East Reservoirs, overlooking more than 42 acres of open water. There is a grocery store, supermarket, gastropub, and cafes on site and a large retail park nearby.

Stoke Newington is within a mile offering a large choice of bars and restaurants. There is a trio of beautiful parks too, which include Clissold Park, Finsbury Park and the new Spring Park.

detailedDescription: An impressive one bedroom apartment situated on the top floor of a secure purpose built block, benefitting from a terrace and jaw dropping views of the London skyline, situated moments from Finsbury Park. The uninterrupted views of the London skyline are enjoyed from each space, which must be seen to be truly appreciated, offering peace and tranquillity whilst being located directly opposite Finsbury Park. Seven Sisters Road is superbly located only moments from Finsbury Park station (Victoria & Piccadilly Underground Lines, London Overground, Thameslink and Great Northern City Line), a transport hub offering direct trains to the West End, the Square Mile, Heathrow Airport and Brighton. London's best connected stations at Kings Cross & St Pancras International can be reached 2 stops from Finsbury Park, providing access to mainland Europe. The supermarkets of Waitrose, M&S, Tesco, Lidl & Sainsburys provide superb local convenience shopping, with vibrant restaurants, bars, gastropubs, theatres, gyms, cinemas and boutique shops found at Upper Street, Stoke Newington and Stroud Green. address: St. Paul Street, Islington, London N1
detailedDescription: A beautifully designed, contemporary 2 double bedroom, 2 bathroom house with accommodation arranged over the raised & lower ground floors and benefitting from a cleverly designed internal patio along with a further private patio accessed via the second bedroom. The house has been beautifully designed to maximise the use of light & space, with a painstaking attention to detail and quality of finish, affording well proportioned lateral accommodation which is unusual for the area. Accommodation comprises bright vast dual aspect through kitchen/ dining/ reception room with a charming internal patio complete with green wall, guest WC and plant room on the raised ground floor. A wide feature spiral staircase leads down to the lower ground floor which is home to 2 good size double bedrooms, the master with a lavish en-suite bathroom complete with freestanding bath and beautifully fitted walk-in wardrobe. The second double bedroom also benefits from a beautifully fitted walk-in wardrobe and access out to a private patio. Also on the lower ground floor can be found the main family shower room. St Paul Street sits on a quiet no through road within the Arlington conservation area, moments from the greenery of Arlington Square itself. Despite its quiet situation, the trendy bars, restaurants, galleries and boutique shops of Upper Street, Hoxton, Shoreditch, London Fields & Old Street are all easily accessible. Within a stone's throw of the house there are many good eateries, cafes and pubs; Pophams Bakery, The Rosemary Branch and minutes along the canal is the Towpath Cafe. The Regents Canal also provides a beautiful calming escape from the city and a lovely walk to Broadgate Market and Victoria Park. Within walking distance are Angel station (Northern Line) and Highbury & Islington (National Rail & Victoria Line) which both provide a wealth of transport links to get around London. International travel is made easy from Kings Cross St Pancras. A plethora of transportation links encompassing many bus routes to the City and West End can also be found at New North Road and Essex Road, with Essex Road station providing National Rail trains to Moorgate.

detailedDescription:
This bright two-bedroom apartment is part of the picturesque Gibson Gardens estate in Stoke Newington and has been wonderfully reconfigured to a design by Emil Eve Architects.

The Building

Gibson Gardens is a gated estate of Victorian mansion blocks built in 1880 by the Metropolitan Association for Improving the Dwellings of the Industrious Classes (maidic). The development originally comprised three brick blocks of four-storey flats and a row of “cottages”, which housed the elderly relations of those living in the blocks. Each building still bears its original name; The Long Block, The Gatehouse Block, The Railway Block and The Cottages.

The residents of Gibson Gardens benefit from beautiful outdoor spaces within the estate, linked by car-free cobbled streets. Vegetable gardens, a pizza oven and seating areas have been set up in these areas and give the estate a wonderful sense of community.

The Tour

Approached along a gated, cobbled street, the third-floor apartment is accessed via a communal staircase. Entrance is to a central hall, with living accommodation to the right and bedrooms to the left. The living space overlooks the communal square through large sash windows that receive the morning light. Bespoke Ash shelving has been incorporated, providing excellent storage space and a sensitive tonal contrast to the simple white kitchen. This has Corian worktops and a splashback of the same material.

New tiling, cork and carpet delineate the hallway, bedroom and bathroom spaces and playful touches of colour have been introduced throughout. The bedrooms are positioned on the left-hand side of the plan, each with its own sash window.

The bathroom, found at the end of the hall, has a double-ended bath with a large-headed shower, and underfloor heating. There is also a large loft, reached via a retractable ladder, which provides useful storage space.

The Area

Gibson Gardens is very well positioned in central Stoke Newington, a vibrant area packed with cafes, restaurants, pubs, bars and shops. The apartment is right by the entrance of Abney Park – a wild and woodland space – and minutes from Stoke Newington Church Street and the green expanse of Clissold Park.

Stoke Newington station is just around the corner and runs London Overground services to Liverpool Street in around 10 minutes or Seven Sisters in around four minutes, for connections to the Underground. A number of buses run into central London and the neighbouring Dalston area.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 89 years
Service Charge: Approx. £1,700 per annum
Ground Rent: Approx. £50 per annum
Council Tax Band: B

detailedDescription:
A Beautiful, Bright & Spacious 3 Bed 2 Bath apartment set within this sought after Canal-side development.

The accommodation is contemporary throughout and boasts a wonderful open plan reception/dining area with wooden flooring, modern kitchen with integrated Bosch appliances. The living space and master bedroom offers access out to a balcony spanning the length of the apartment. There are two double bedrooms and a smaller double bedroom, master bedroom with en-suite bathroom with power shower, a main family size bathroom with bath and shower and a separate utility/storage area.

Reliance Wharf is considered to be one of the most sought after developments along the Regents Canal. Located less than a five minute walk from Haggerston Overground Station offering routes to Highbury and Islington and Canary Wharf, it's surrounded by some of East London's best independent waterside cafes, shops, bars, galleries and creative work spaces.

And directly above a new coffee shop/cafe and creative co-working space.

Also within a short walking distance of Broadway Market, London Fields, Columbia Flower Market, Victoria Park and Angel.

The apartment is less than a five minute walk from Haggerston Overground Station offering routes to Highbury and Islington and Canary Wharf and there is a tfl "Boris Bike" station directly next to the development.

Close proximity to the City, Hoxton, Shoreditch and Islington and easy access to the Olympic Park, make Reliance Wharf a location which offers the best of both worlds, where waterside cafes, shops, bars and offices sit alongside converted warehouses and relics of London's industrial past to create a cool and relaxed atmosphere for living amidst the buzz of London's most exciting places to work and play.

Travel/commute via Haggerston Station - London Overground below (cycling time is very similar)

2 minutes to Hoxton
2 minutes to Dalston Junction

10 minutes to Highbury & Islington
18 minutes to Liverpool Street
20 minutes to Canary Wharf
21 minutes to Stratford
26 minutes to Oxford Street
28 minutes to Leicester Square
32 minutes to London City Airport
35 minutes to Baker Street

detailedDescription:
Stunning three/four bedroom Victorian terraced property with delightful courtyard garden. Boasting a wealth of period charm and appeal, the property offers accommodation arranged over four floors, sympathetically enhanced and upgraded to create elegant and high quality living space throughout. Features include an impressive double length reception, well equipped kitchen, luxury bathroom, stylish en-suite and private balcony to the master bedroom, bonus lower ground office/further bedroom with adjoining utility/WC, high ceilings, central heating, quality floor coverings, and bespoke inbuilt storage.

Accommodation comprises entrance hall with stairs to lower ground floor and rising to the first floor, leading into the bright and spacious dual aspect double length through reception room with attractive bay window, feature fireplace and bespoke inbuilt storage and shelving. To the rear of the property, the beautiful dual aspect kitchen is flooded with natural light from orangery style skylight window and double doors opening onto the private courtyard garden. The kitchen comprises solid wood units, granite work surfaces incorporating inset double sink, dishwasher, Mercury range cooker with induction hob and electric oven, and a large fridge/freezer. To the first floor, there are two well proportioned double bedrooms, plus a luxury family bathroom with white suite and elegant tiling. To the second floor, there is an inviting master bedroom with two sets of brushed aluminium double doors opening onto a charming private balcony, plus a modern en-suite shower room with quality suite and tiled walls.

The lower ground level of the property offers a bonus additional office/reception/further bedroom with double doors to the rear, plus useful adjoining utility room with WC and access to considerable under-house storage.

Location

The property is enviably located in a much sought after residential road, within easy access of Rectory Road, Stoke Newington and Dalston stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes. Stoke Newington offers a variety of shops and amenities, with Stoke Newington Church Street providing a wonderful array of fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants. The area is well served by excellent local schools and beautiful open spaces including Clissold Park, Abney Park and nearby Hackney Downs Park.

detailedDescription:
Stunning brand-new Two-Bedroom and Two-Bathroom apartment with your own private balcony in the highly desired area of Woodberry Downs, N4.

This high-specification home is based on the fourth floor of the latest released Willowbrook House development.

The apartment offers a great sized, open-plan reception kitchen area, which opens directly on your large private balcony with London landscape and reservoir views and the unique waterside community surrounded by nature.

The primary double bedroom is fitted with with bespoke fitted corner wardrobes, and both bedrooms benefit from en-suite bathrooms and dual-aspect floor to ceiling windows.

As a resident of Willowbrook House, you have exclusive access to:

- A Private Residents Swimming Pool
- A Private Residents Gym
- Secure Underground Parking (optional)
- Secure Cycle Storage
- And a nearby Concierge Service.

Moments away from Manor House Tube Station, giving you fast links to Kings Cross, Covent Garden, and Leicester Square on the Piccadilly Line. A little further and you have Haringey Green overground.

Woodberry Downs is close to the open spaces of Finsbury Park, with over a hundred acres of natural beauty to explore. Not to mention Woodberry Wetlands being on your doorstep, offering lovely waterside walking routes.

Stoke Newington is a short walk as are the pleasant green spaces of Clissold Park, Gillespie Nature Reserve and Finsbury Park. It is served by unparalleled access to Zone Two Victoria/Piccadilly lines, Overground and National Rail, along with easy access to regular local bus routes.

detailedDescription:
A very well located one double bedroom apartment, set on the first floor of a well-maintained low-rise purpose-built building. The apartment offers a west facing reception room and a double bedroom, the kitchen and bathroom need a little attention which is reflected in the price. The property has an internal living area of just under 500 sq ft and is being sold with a lease in excess of 100 years.

Situated on the corner of Springdale Road and Green Lanes, on the immediate boarders of Stoke Newington, Highbury and Islington. It’s just moments from Clissold Park and the many bars, restaurants and coffee houses in Stoke Newington Church Street and Highbury Barn. Transport links are good with a wide variety of bus routes into the City and West End and also Canonbury Station (Overground), Highbury and Islington station (Victoria Line & Overground) are within walking distance.

agency_name: Knight Frank - City & East New Homes
address: B-02-01 Hkr, Hackney Road, London E2
detailedDescription:
This modern new home is located on the 2nd floor of hkr on Hackney Road and offers a view over the Courtyard & Hackney Road. This spacious apartment provides 730 sq ft of internal space and a 59 sq ft private balcony.

Imagined by Hawkins Brown Architects, hkr brings 66 stylish new apartments to Hoxton with a beautifully landscaped communal garden. Interiors have been designed by Honky Interior Designers and have bespoke wall features, soft furnishing and lighting. The rust-toned exterior of hkr informs the red/brown hues inside, building a relationship between outside and in. A cooler palette lent by stone and rustic wood complements these bold tones to give balance to the interiors.

Residents benefit from a screening room, concierge, a fully-equipped private residents' gym, landscaped viewing terraces, a courtyard, a Podium garden, a parcel and cycle store and a local car club membership for three years, which is provided with each home.

Hkr witnesses a different side of London from every standpoint. To the south and to the west, the towering glass structures of the City bite into Shoreditch. To the East, the modern goliaths of Canary Wharf rise up from the Thames and, to the North, Hackney's green treetops seem to go on endlessly.

*Please note that the CGIs used are for illustrative purposes only.

Owing to our commitment to keeping both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we also have many virtual viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

The property benefits from a prominent location on Hackney Road and is a 3-minute walk to Hoxton Overground station, a 14-minute walk to Old Street station (from here, Bank station is 4 minutes away) and the local amenities of Columbia Road Shops & Flower Market.

When Crossrail opens, it will provide journey times from Liverpool Street of 6 minutes to Canary Wharf, 7 minutes to Bond Street and 40 minutes to Heathrow Airport.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
Enjoy picturesque views across leafy North London from your rooftop apartment in the heart of popular Stroud Green. Your charming one bedroom abode also benefits from swathes of natural light across each room, through double glazed windows that provide such attractive views.

Cleverly concealed storage is tucked away in almost every corner of your home, not least in the hallway entrance. Ascending a few small steps, you’re greeted by wall-to-wall south facing windows in the reception room.

Clean white walls permeate each room, adding to the feeling of space and light throughout. A home office alcove can be found in the living room with kitchen to your right.

Your kitchen features nifty space saving solutions, from the wall-mounted utensil hooks and floating shelf to the statement decorative worktop installed above the washing machine. A walk-in shower calls for you in the bathroom, placed beside a mirrored wall cabinet, frosted window and charcoal-effect slab floor tiling.

Finally the double bedroom boasts two built in cupboards, a velux window and views over the rooftops to the rear.

Situated a mere 0.5 miles from Finsbury Park Station and surrounded by a glorious array of amenities, you’re seriously spoilt for choice with both transport and food/drink options. Lockdown allowing, you can look forward to exhibitions at Furtherfield Gallery and even a spot of ten-pin bowling or karaoke at Rowans Tenpin Bowl, all within 0.4 miles of your humble abode.

title: 3 bed terraced house for sale

detailedDescription:
A surprisingly lateral Victorian family home located in Newington Green and totalling nearly 2,700 sq ft across just four floors. The property has been renovated sympathetically throughout. The raised ground floor is home to the L shaped kitchen, dining and reception space with high ceilings, oak flooring, ornate cornicing and ceiling rose, marble fireplaces and newly fitted double glazed sash windows with wooden shutters. The kitchen is bespoke with fitted appliances and Lacanche range cooker. There is a WC and boot room to complete this floor. The first floor boasts two double bedrooms with equally impressive features to include wooden flooring, sash windows and intricate coving. The top floor completes the main house bedroom set up with impressive principal bedroom showcasing vaulted ceilings, window seat and en-suite bathroom with cast iron bath and ceramic tiling. There is a single bedroom on this floor too. The lower ground floor is currently used as a separate unit due to the dual access and has a galley kitchen, bathroom, reception room and double bedroom leading to the east facing rear garden reaching over 60 ft. The garden can also be accessed from the raised ground. It is mature, boats a 22 ft width, and has a summer house at the back which was built using reclaimed windows from the original house. There is off street parking at the front of the property and the sale is chain free.

Situation
Newington Green is an ideal location positioned between Highbury, Stoke Newington, Hackney and Islington. Lizzie’s on the Green is a local coffee favourite along with the award winning Alma public house for something stronger. Access across town is effortless with ample bus routes including the 73 which goes to Kings Cross, Euston and Victoria. The green open space of Clissold Park is just over a mile away.

Located at the head of the Kingsland Basin is this one double bedroom apartment with stunning City and water views.

Location

Gosse Court is located on Downham Road which is well placed between Hackney, Dalston and Islington; frequent bus services run on Kingsland Road and Balls Pond Road, offering fast and efficient routes into the City, West End and Islington. Haggerston Overground station is under 0.2 miles away giving easy access into the City or Canary Wharf and there are many pubs, coffee shops and restaurants to discover.

Description

cash buyers only - Arranged over approximately 596sqft (including winter garden) and is located on the fifth floor and offers spectacular views of the Kingsland basin and part of the London skyline. Accommodation comprises an open plan main reception/kitchen area which is great for entertaining friends and family with access to a southerly facing winter garden. The rest of the accommodation is made up of a double bedroom and main bathroom. There is the additional benefit of a southerly facing balcony which can be accessed via the winter garden as well as the main bedroom. Residents of Gosse Court can also make use of a communal roof terrace and secure cycle store.

detailedDescription:
A well arranged three double bedroom flat with separate kitchen, part of a purpose built development located very close to Newington Green and Dalston Kingsland. This flat is typical of the ex local authority style builds, offer good space and functionality in a well arranged layout.

Comprising a spacious reception, separate kitchen, bathroom with shower over the bath and a separate W.C and a private balcony overlooking the communal gardens below. The bedrooms are of similar size, making this property a great purchase for those that may want to consider purchasing as a rental investment. This flat would make a great option for buyers who are looking to refurbish to their own taste.

The property is located minutes from Newington Green and its array of boutique-style shops and restaurants. There are nearby transport links from Canonbury or Dalston Kingsland Overground stations, within a few minutes walk., as well as a number of bus routes that connect to The City and West End.
Buy to let investors

Upon a full refurbishment to a high standard, this property should expect to achieve a monthly rental income of approximately £2,100

The flat itself is quiet, being at the end of the row and away from the street, and has really well proportioned rooms.

The property is spread over approximately 800 square feet and features a ground floor open plan reception room equipped with built in projector and surround sound system, breakfast bar and a modern fitted kitchen with integrated appliances.

The ground floor has a contemporary fitted family bathroom with bath plus shower attachment and 1 double bedroom.

The hallway features a video entry phone system, storage and stairs with glass banisters leading down to the lower ground floor which has access to a utility area, 2 further bedrooms and 2nd bathroom with shower cubical.

detailedDescription:
Stunning 3 Bedroom Penthouse Apartment on Wharf Road.

Location

Wharf Road is situated just off City Road in close proximity to the fabulous selection of shops, bars and restaurants of Upper Street and within easy reach of the City. Central London and the West End is within easy reach from Angel Underground Station (0.4 miles) and Old Street Underground Station (0.5 miles).

Description

This stunning sub-penthouse apartment is set within the highly sought after Merchant Building, a bespoke canal side development of premium apartments just moments from Islington and Shoreditch. Set on the 8th floor of this modern gated development this three bedroom apartment is beautifully presented. The property offers a generous open-plan living space with double aspect and floor to ceiling windows, sleek modern kitchen with integrated appliances, large balconies with canal views, a large master bedroom suite with built in wardrobes, high quality en-suite shower room and access to a second private balcony, two further double bedrooms (one with fitted wardrobes), a family bathroom and a separate large utility room and services cupboard. There is substantial built-in storage throughout and a built-in air filtration system, remote smart control system for heating and lighting.

The property also comes with secure underground parking accessed via lifts, concierge service and separate communal roof terrace with stunning 360 degree views of central London.

Square Footage: 1197 sq ft

The living area has ample space for a large dining table and sofa and chairs.

The kitchen area is fitted with a range of contemporary wooden high and low-level units, providing plenty of storage space, integrated stainless oven, hob, and extractor fan. There is a washing machine dishwasher and fridge freezer fitted into this area.

The property boasts two double bedrooms, a modern bathroom, an ensuite shower room, and a storage cupboard in the hallway. Both bedrooms are well proportioned and the larger room features two southeastern facing windows and extensive stylish built-in wardrobes, as well as a modern en suite which is fitted with a shower cubicle pedestal, wash hand basin, and WC with spotlights to ceiling tiled floor, and tiled splashback.

The second bedroom is also a generous double and benefits from plenty of space for wardrobes and shelving.

address: Principal Lofts, Chelmer Road, London E9
detailedDescription:
This bright two-bedroom apartment forms part of Principal Lofts, a late-Victorian school conversion located between Lower Clapton and Homerton. It has been sensitively redesigned by the current owners with a view to maximising the light and volume of the sizeable space. A cleverly conceived layout, which includes two mezzanine levels, capitalises on the apartment’s high ceilings and large Victorian schoolhouse windows to fantastic effect.

The Tour

Principal Lofts sits within its own communal grounds, surrounded by a high perimeter wall with electric entry gates. Entry to the apartment is gained is on the first floor of the building. The current owners have created storage space underneath the stairs and to one side of the entrance hall; to the other side is a brand new bathroom with deep-green walls.

The recent modern intervention sits comfortably alongside the older, original aspects of the building, such as the exposed brick walls. The main living spaces open up beneath double-height ceilings, with engineered oak floorboards running underfoot and a large original sash window on the western aspect that bathes the plan in natural light. The dining area occupies the middle of this space – an excellent area for entertaining, thanks to its impressive double-height ceilings. To one side, there is a brand new contemporary kitchen and breakfast bar with marble worktops.

A curved wall runs along one aspect of the open-plan room, providing access to the main bedroom and the guest bedroom. Both of these generously sized rooms have Victorian sash windows with secondary glazing, and the main bedroom also has built-in wardrobes.

Perhaps the most ingenious feature of the apartment is the two mezzanine levels which sit on either side of the first-floor dining room. The smaller mezzanine is accessed via a ladder to one side of the kitchen and is home to a flexible space that the current owners use alternately as a study and a snug. Opposite is a much larger mezzanine level, accessed via a staircase. This space contains a full-sized living area, and has steel wire balustrades that allow natural light to flow down into the open-plan spaces below.

Outdoor Space

The grounds of Principal Lofts are gated and the buildings surrounded by communal gardens with well-maintained sections of lawn, planted with mature trees and home to secure bike storage units.

The apartment comes with an allocated private parking space.

The Area

The building is excellently located just off Chatsworth Road, an increasingly popular developing area of east London. As well as a sophisticated collection of shops, cafes and pubs, the street gives way on Sunday to a weekly weekend market with a tantalising mix of food stalls. The green spaces of the Olympic Park, Victoria Park and Hackney Downs are all a short walk away.

Homerton is the nearest station, running London Overground services to Highbury & Islington (Victoria Line) in one direction, and Stratford (Jubilee Line) in the other. There is a car park with allocated parking.

Tenure: Leasehold
Lease Length: Approx. 104 years remaining
Service Charge: Approx. £1,809 per annum (includes buildings insurance, management charges, repairs to shared areas and the outside of the building, cleaning services, storage unit and bike store, maintenance of the communal garden and a provision for the sinking fund)
Ground Rent: Approx. £300 per annum
Parking: The apartment comes with an allocated private parking space.
Council Tax Band: E

The apartment also benefits from under-floor heating throughout and has beautiful floor to ceiling windows to allow as much natural light as possible into the apartment giving it a bright and open feel. There is a 24 hour concierge service on-site as well as resident's only gym, swimming pool and spa facilities. There is also underground cycle storage.

Woodberry Down is ideally located 0.3 miles from Manor House tube on the Piccadilly line offering excellent links into Central London, the City and Greater London.

AAZA Estate Agents presents this impressive three bedroom Penthouse at Principal Tower, designed by Foster + Partners, offers the opportunity to own an architectural masterpiece equivalent to a priceless piece of art that will give constant pleasure and lasting value.

The Tower benefits from five major transport hubs within walking distance, making it convenient to access all capital corners with ease and speed. Central London is readily accessible by tube, and the new Crossrail line will also stop at Liverpool Street, with the London City Airport just 30 minutes away.
Each apartment is flooded with natural light. Residents can also enjoy amenities that include an edgeless infinity pool, spa, sauna, state-of-the-art gym overlooking the piazza, a cinema and residents lounge. Residents also have access to a 24-hour concierge service akin to the likes of five-star hotels. The service level will remain consistently updated and refined to ensure every current and future need is met.
Principal Tower faces a landscaped piazza with trees and green spaces and boasts a wide range of food and retail facilities.

detailedDescription:
Unique opportunity to acquire a beautiful flat within the Victoria Chambers with history dating back to around 1870.

The building itself is very imposing and articulately stunning.

The semi open plan reception room is one of the main draws to the property being flooded with natural light.

The archway connecting the two rooms works perfectly allowing space for a dinning table and sofas making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

The kitchen offers ample work surface and cupboards for adding to the enjoyment of living in the property.

The bedroom is a great size and has lovely views over Mark Street Gardens.

The bathroom is well proportioned for the size of the property.

The flat offers an opportunity for a the future owners to refurbish to their own style and requirements.

Location;

Neighboring four highly desirable districts of London that include Islington, Shoreditch, Clerkenwell, and the City offers something for everyone.

Victoria Chambers is adjacent to Mark Street Gardens which is a great space to unwind.

Also within the ever-growing Tech City / Tech Roundabout located around Old Street City.

Old Street, 5 minutes away, Moorgate, 8 minutes, Barbican, 9 minutes, tube stations on the Northern, Circle, Hammersmith & City and Metropolitan lines.

Within 10 minutes walking distance in the mainline Terminus of Liverpool Street with access to Stratford, Stanstead Airport, Cambridge, Essex, Suffolk, Norfolk, and Harwich Harbour

Farringdon has access to Gatwick Airport and Luton Airport on the Brighton - Bedford Line, within a 15-minute walk.

Shoreditch and Hoxton are across the Old Street roundabout to all the trendy cafes and galleries.

The local areas have an abundance of other amenities for day to day life, with award-winning bars and restaurants.

Ideal for those looking to move into Zone 1, Pied-à-Terre and investors​ alike.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

address: Geffrye Place, 32 Cremer Street, London E2
detailedDescription:
A one bedroom duplex apartment with terrace, part of this former public house conversion adjacent to the Geffrye Museum in Hoxton.

Geffrye Place is a bespoke development of just eight apartments set within the historic Kingsland Road conservation area. Which encompasses the renovation of the former Marquis of Lansdown public house and a new four storey building adjacent, in the heart of Hoxton.

This apartment is situated on the two top floors in the converted public house section of the development, it retains elements of the Grade II listed building such as the wonderful, vaulted ceilings. The terrace is on the upper floor with access from the main living space, with the bedroom and bathroom on the lower floor.

The apartments benefit from elegant interiors, timber oak flooring, underfloor heating and stunning bespoke joinery work by Faulkus Joinery of Shoreditch. Kitchens feature Siemens appliances, bespoke base and wall cabinets and Hi-Macs worktops.

Geffrye Place is ideally located for all of Hoxton's amenities, central Shoreditch, Columbia Road and Spitalfields are all nearby. It is an area rich with independent boutiques, shops and restaurants and is very well connected, the overground is adjacent, the tube is a short walk, Kingsland road is an artery for the extensive bus network and Hoxton and the surrounding area is fast becoming the cycling capital of London.

There are a number of parks in the locale, the museum park being the closest but Shoreditch Park, Haggerston Park and London Fields are all nearby.

* Some photos in this listing are of the show home and are included for reference only

address: John Campbell Road, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:
What do you love about your home:
1. I fell for the period features like the high ceilings and tall skirting in the living room, it screams out for a showy chandelier.
2. The bathroom is a little haven, and with the Bluetooth mirror pumping out tunes, it's my happy space.
3. The patio is a huge bonus and has been the perfect spot to relax.

What will you miss about the area:
1. Dalston and Stoke Newington offer vibrant, creative, and diverse communities and I have always felt at home here.
2. Everything you need is just on the doorstep, from M&S food to Hackney Downs park.
3. You can get food and cocktails from around the world, whichever direction you walk in.

Property Details:
Accommodation comprises entrance hall with high ceilings and coved cornicing (evident through much of the property), leading into the bright and spacious reception room with attractive front aspect shuttered bay window and ample space for relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a modern range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, induction hob with overhead extractor and electric oven, and further space for appliances. To the rear of the property, an inner hall with inbuilt storage provides access both through to the bathroom, and out to the tranquil patio garden - ideal for al fresco drinks and dining. The bathroom has been beautifully appointed to create an inviting space, with free-standing bath suite, and elegant tiling. A spacious double bedroom with quiet rear aspect and a range of inbuilt wardrobes completes the generous accommodation.

The property is conveniently located within easy access of Dalston Junction, Dalston Kingsland and Canonbury stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes providing excellent cross-London links. Nearby Kingsland High Road offers an array of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants, all within just a short distance from the property, with Clissold Park within easy reach providing beautiful open spaces. Stoke Newington is also closeby offering a further array of fashionable shops, bars and restaurants.

Viewings are highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Description

Contemporary one bedroom flat in the heart of Haggerston, next to Regent's Canal.

Located on the fifth floor, you enter into a wide hallway. To your right is an open plan reception that has a great outlook and a tonne of natural light, creating a lovely space to relax and entertain in.

The kitchen has fully-integrated appliances and plenty of preparation space.
Adjacent to the reception, is the family bathroom, with shower, w/c & wash basin.

At the far end of the apartment, a double bedroom with great proportions, has a similar outlook to the reception, overlooking the interior courtyard and surrounding urban area.

Storage is at a premium with a large wardrobe in the bedroom, and a decent hallway boiler cupboard.

Around 10 minutes walk from both Haggerston Park & London Fields, the former is famous for its City Farm, the latter popular for its heated lido. All your principle amenities are situated on Kingsland Road with a fabulous mix of restaurants, bars, bakeries and coffee shops less than 5 minutes walk. The Duke of York is your firm favourite local pub five minutes away, and By The Bridge Cafe is your local coffee shop just over the canal.

For transport, Haggerston station is a 3 minute walk and has a direct link into Shoreditch High Street & further South. Alternatively Old Street underground & rail is a 20 minute walk away or under 5 minutes by bus from Kingsland Road.

detailedDescription:
*below market price for sale!*

Principal tower, designed by world famous Foster and Partner, is the icon of luxury life in Central London. Living here is not only about living in a property, is about the future of dream life.

After the recovery of covid-19, which is not far in the future, imagine you open eyes in the morning, and after a cup of coffee, you go downstairs to swim and go for a sauna to reboot your brain. If you like, you can also go to the gym in the first floor to make your body strong and healthy. After that, go upstairs to have a wonderful breakfast and then walk to your office. As the location is just in the old financial center of London, you can take your time to go to the office. After you finish work in the evening, you can go to the private cinema in the first floor with a glass of wine to relax for the night. And then go upstairs to have a wonderful dream.

An Amazing and luxurious one bedroom apartment, situated on the 2nd floor of Principal Tower, Principal Place development just a stroll from the City. There is a spacious, dual aspect and open plan kitchen with built in units and appliances and living room with panoramic window providing plenty of natural light to the space, a good size bedroom with fitted wardrobe and modern and stylish bathroom suite featuring elegant interior.

Principal Tower includes an excellent selection of on-site amenities which include a 24-hour concierge service, residents’ lounge, state-of-the-art gymnasium, private cinema, spa, a lap pool, and access to bicycle storage. There are also opportunities to acquire parking spaces. A fine selection of cafés, bars, and restaurants will also be accessible within the development. Cultural events will take place throughout the year within Principle Place’s half-acre piazza.

The development is located a short distance from several transport links including Liverpool Street station, providing access to Underground and rail services for commutes to key destinations across the Capital. Shoreditch station and Brick lane “The most famous diverse market in the UK ” is just around the corner and the upcoming Crossrail link will serve Liverpool Street and add even more flexibility for commuting.

Haggerston Station is a short walk from the property and provides access into the City, Canary Wharf and the West End. Offered chain free.

address: Manse Road, Stoke Newington, London N16
detailedDescription:
** Offers in Excess of £700,000 **

Comments from the owner:
What do you love most about your home?
1. We absolutely love the layout of the flat - this was the main feature that made me want to buy the flat as soon as I saw it. It is so open and bright which makes it feel so spacious. The split-level of the bathroom adds a bit of character too.
2. The flat has some lovely features. We love the high ceilings which make it feel super airy, and also the traditional shutters found in both bedrooms.
3. Having a garden in London makes such a difference. We love our sunny and bright outside space which is a little haven, shielded from traffic noise by the surrounding houses. You'll enjoy many days chilling in the summerhouse or on the lawn.

What do you love most about the area?
1. We have some amazing neighbours on our street! Think diverse, friendly, fun and supportive. This has been so important during the last 12 months of covid - everyone was available to help each other out and one group of neighbours even set up a covid support group for the street, to help out anyone who needed some shopping or just a socially distanced chat!
2. Such an amazing choice places for a coffee, brunch, dinner and drinks are right on your doorstep. We especially love the café Drury N16 which does the best pancakes in Hackney!
3. The abundance of green spaces nearby. You are only a short walk away from Hackney Downs, Abney Park and Clissold Park; all great spaces to spend a summer afternoon. Don't miss spotting some fallow deer in Clissold Park!

Property Details:
Superbly located within a stunning Victorian terrace (c. 1860-1890) and boasting a wealth of original features including high ceilings, this beautiful property provides stunning light and spacious accommodation, sympathetically enhanced with stylish interiors throughout and stripped wood flooring. Accommodation comprises entrance via the ground floor with stairs rising to the first floor landing, leading into the impressive reception room, flooded with natural light from tall rear aspect sash window and door out onto the steps down to the garden. The separate kitchen, also with rear aspect, comprises a range of matching wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit, gas hob with overhead extractor and electric oven below, and further space for appliances. There are two well sized bedrooms, each with attractive shuttered front aspect sash windows, and with adjoining dressing room to the master. A family bathroom with white three piece suite and tiled walls completes the ample accommodation.

The property is conveniently located close to the heart of Stoke Newington, within easy access of Rectory Road and Stoke Newington stations, as well as numerous regular bus routes. Stoke Newington offers an array of shops and amenities, with Stoke Newington Church Street providing a wonderful array of fashionable bars, cafes and restaurants. The area is well served by excellent local schools and beautiful open spaces including Clissold Park, Abney Park and the Wetlands.

Viewings are strongly recommended.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic opportunity to purchase this spacious and impressive 5 bedroom, 2 bathroom Victorian terraced house in a popular location within ten minutes’ walk of Stoke Newington Church Street, Upper Clapton, Springfield Park (Green Flag), Abney Park Conservation Area, Hackney Marshes and the Lea Valley.

You enter the property through the stained-glass Victorian door to a long hallway with stripped pine flooring and original cornicing. This leads to the front living room with triple aspect bay windows, plantation shutters, high ceilings and original working fireplace with tiled surrounds and hearth. Bespoke folding pine doors open to the second sitting room, creating a large entertainment space. The second living room has its own entrance from the hallway and can be separated from the front living room to form a library/music room. The hallway leads past the downstairs loo and door to the cellar and on to the fully fitted open plan kitchen with large dining area. The kitchen has a chef's island, stainless steel hob and new AEG fitted oven. A stained glass door from the kitchen provides access to a utility area with plumbing for a washing machine. The utility room runs the length of the kitchen/diner and is perfect for storage. It has doors to the back sitting room and garden. The dining area has double doors out to a secluded west-facing patio garden with mature trees, perfect for alfresco dining.

The stairs leading from the hallway are original Victorian with wooden banisters, spindles and newel posts. On the first floor, there are 4 double bedrooms, a family bathroom with bath, shower and hand basin and a separate WC - both have stained-glass windows. All of the bedrooms have original sash windows. Three of the bedrooms have fitted alcove wardrobes. There is a brand new Vaillant boiler housed in a cupboard in the fifth bedroom. A pine staircase with overhead skylight leads to the second floor loft conversion where there is a further double bedroom with a seating area, alcove for relaxation space, underfloor heating and an ensuite shower room with walk-in shower. Double glass doors lead to a fantastic roof terrace with a reinforced glass wall and space to entertain or relax in the hammock. It also has a storage area for garden furniture. From here you can see the top of BT Tower and beautiful sunsets over the local church roof.

The house is in good condition with the front living room and kitchen dining area recently decorated with Farrow and Ball paint. Bedrooms 3,4 and 5 and the family bathroom have also been recently decorated in neutral white. We expect high interest in this property as it has the added benefit of being offered chain free making it a great option for any family looking to move to the area.

The house is located on tree-lined Durlston Road, a popular and highly sought after location close to all the local shops, restaurants, cafés and bars of Stoke Newington and Clapton. It is ten minutes' walk to Clapton Overground Station or Stoke Newington Station for easy access into the city. The 106 runs from the end of the road to Finsbury Park (Piccadilly, Victoria lines and overground). It is also a five-minute walk to a wide range of bus routes including the 73,149,67,76,393 and 253. It is also in the catchment for some of the best local schools in the area including Mossbourne Academy, Clapton Girls, Jubilee and Northwold Primary School.

If you lived here you could enjoy walking or cycling on the Lea Valley towpath leading from Waltham Abbey to Limehouse past the Olympic Park. The National Lottery Heritage Fund has invested £3.3 million in the local Springfield Park which features a new adventure playground and community events space. The park also has eight tennis courts, rowing, rugby and cricket clubs as well as allotments. The house is also in walking distance to Stoke Newington High Street with its local butchers, fishmongers and Farmer's Market. This road extends down to the nightlife of Dalston within twenty minutes' walk.

EPC rating: D

detailedDescription:
A beautiful six bedroom period terrace house, arranged over four floors and boasting close to 2500 sq.ft. Of accommodation. With a wooden floored double reception room with bay window, 17ft principle bedroom and a stunning oversized bathroom with free standing bath and a separate shower cubicle. Situated on a quiet residential road, the property further consists of a private garden, cellar (with plumbing for utilities) as well as new kitchen.

The choice of schools is superb with Northwold, Millfields and Clapton girls to name but a few.

The property is situated moments from a range of shops and amenities that can be found on Upper Clapton Road with Stoke Newington also within 0.6 miles. Offering excellent transport links with access to Clapton Station (0.2miles), Rectory Road station (0.3miles) & Stoke Newington station (0.6miles) all of which are superb for links around the city.

title: 3 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Bayford Mews is a small award-winning gated development of three dwellings which are located in the Mare Street Conservation Area. The property benefits from its own ground floor entrance with a ground floor double bedroom and bathroom in addition to two further double bedrooms and bathroom on the first floor. The open plan fully fitted kitchen and reception occupy the entire first floor with the private terrace at roof level accessed via sliding box roof lights. The flat is also exceptionally well located with London Fields on the doorstep; which offer a heated lido, cricket fields, tennis courts, table tennis, in addition, to open parkland to unwind at the end of the day. Under the arches, you'll find London Fields Brewery and connecting London Fields.

Owners Comments:

Top 3 things you love about your home
1. Its character & design - modern and quirky with all the mod cons, but also a really homely feel. Being spread over three floors with its own front door also makes it feel like a true mews house.
2. The glass feature walls and roof box mean it's always flooded with natural light, as well as feeling cosy and private.
3. Having our own outside space, looking out over the rooftops of East London.

Three things we love about the area.
1. All the streets around London Fields and Broadway Market full of independent shops, breweries, bakeries, a great butcher and fishmonger, loads of coffee shops/roasteries, delicious restaurants like Bright and Nest, and our favourite old pub The Dove, as well as various food markets on weekends
2. Transport links - London Fields overground station a few minutes walk away, loads of bus routes from Mare Street, vibrant Hackney Central 10 mins away, and then Bethnal Green on the Central line the other direction
3. Beautiful Victoria Park 10 mins walk away, all of the canal routes for cycling, and 15 mins by bike out to Hackney Marshes for more open green spaces
Q&A

1. Why are you selling? Bought as a shared purchase between siblings but now looking to move on to our next homes
2. What's the area like? Really vibrant and creative, full of independent shops and businesses as well as relaxing green spaces
3. What is parking like? Always loads of spaces just outside and the adjacent streets, easy to get a residents' permit and guest permits. We also have excellent wall-mounted bike locks installed in the Bayford Mews entrance way, behind the secure gate
4. How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? Not busy at all, no issues with noise
5. I'm currently working from home, how does that work in this property? We turned the downstairs bedroom into a home office for lockdown (with a sofa bed for when we're allowed guests again!), but also happily work in the living area, the 2nd bedroom and even on the roof when it's warm. There are also loads of co-working places (The Fisheries, Second Home, We Work to name a few) around here if you feel like a change of scene.
6. What's the internet like? Super fast fibre (our contract is with BT 70 mb)
7. What's the boiler like? Vaillaint combi boiler, less than 4 years old
8. Are we able to do any work/extensions? Haven't investigated, but as you own the freehold do have lots of flexibility
Ref: Isl

address: Wenlock Basin, Wharf Road, London N1
detailedDescription:
Property number 46590. Click the"Email Agent" button, submit the form and we'll text & email you within minutes, day or night.

Narrowboat - built 2007 - saloon & open plan galley; double cabin, bathroom (shower, WC washbasin). Solid fuel stove.

Braywick is a charming trad-stern narrowboat - fully operational if desired, with Isuzu diesel engine able to cruise the extensive canal system on the doorstep.

The marina at Wenlock Basin is privately owned and Braywick has a rental agreement to moor; It is a fully residential mooring recognised by the local authority and council tax is payable. There are various communal seating and BBQ areas on the marina, and a resident marina manager, refuse/recycling, pump-out, and secure bike storage .

Metered mains electricity is provided, as is water & waste pump-out. A BT landline is optional; Various wifi options available on site.

A no-subletting rule makes the marina a secure haven in the city; a no pets rule is in place to safeguard the many waterfowl & garden birds.

Angel Islington & Old Street underground stations are approximately 10 minutes walk away

If you're interested in this property please click the "Email Agent" button above

A truly stunning 2 bedroom apartment in the iconic Principal Tower, EC2.

Offered with no onward chain, this stunning 2 bedroom apartment is situated on the 20th floor and has breath-taking South Western views towards the City skyline. Access to the rest of the City, West End and Canary Wharf can all be achieved within 30 minutes.

The vibrancy and dynamism of Shoreditch, the countless restaurants, bars and private member’s clubs, and its proximity to Islington, Clerkenwell, Barbican and the City, make the area an exciting place to live.

detailedDescription:
A unique to the market 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom triplex with generous ceiling heights in excess of 9 foot, this flat is perfectly situated on the Dalston / Stoke Newington borders, moments from the green open spaces of Hackney Downs and Stoke Newington High Street, with its eclectic mix of shops, cafes and restaurants.

Spanning 1213 sqft this generously proportioned triplex comprises an open plan living / dining area with setback, fully integrated modern kitchen, 3 double bedrooms, 3 bathrooms (2 of which are en-suite) and separate w.c.
The apartment is neutrally decorated and boasts wood flooring throughout, large double glazed windows, tiled bathroom and shower rooms, ample storage and an east facing aspect.
240 Amhurst Road is a residential development steeped in history, previously a 1960’s restaurant/nightclub called The Regency, famous for entertaining guests including Princess Margaret, The Krays and Lord Boothby.

This flat is excellently located, sandwiched between bustling Dalston and popular Church Street, the heart of Stoke Newington, offering residents an array of independent cafes, restaurants and boutique shops.

Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations (0.6 miles and 0.8 miles respectively) offer easy access to Hoxton, Shoreditch and Highbury and Islington. Rectory Road Station is a short walk away (0.3 miles) taking commuters directly into Liverpool Street. There are also fantastic local bus routes, offering easy access to the City and West End.

Service Charges: Circa £1,250 per annum
Ground Rent: £250 Per Annum

title: 1 bed flat for sale

address: Banister House, Homerton High Street, London E9
detailedDescription:
Comments from the owner:

Top 3 things you love about your home
1. The location. It's cultured, fun, but also has miles of beautiful green space and it's so quick to get anywhere. It's a really peaceful flat, despite being so close to Homerton Hospital, as the ambulances don't use sirens outside and park on the other side of the estate. The community on the estate is really lovely, especially the immediate neighbours who came round when I moved in to bring me a cuppa before I had a kettle, and have taken signature for more packages than I can count. The allotments and communal green spaces with roses and lavender make the place feel homey.
2. This is an unusually large, bright flat for the area and it feels really spacious inside. I have a kingsize bed and it doesn't feel cramped in the bedroom, plus there is loads of storage all over the house. It's also south facing so you get nice light in the living room and kitchen all day.
3. The thing that attracted me most to the flat when I saw it was the unusual dining space in-between the kitchen and living room. It is a cozy little nook and so nice for small dinner parties, but also great to work in during the day as it feels so light and bright. There is potential to knock this area through to make one big open plan kitchen living room, or just a bigger kitchen, but I think it's a nice, unusual feature.

Three things we love about the area.
1. The flat is very central and right in the middle of lots of great places. I can cycle into Oxford Street in 35-40 minutes, and it's only 7 minutes walk to Homerton Overground, (from which it's a 7 minute train ride to Stratford International & 9 minute ride to Highbury and Islington) and it's close to Clapton and Hackney Central Stations too. The area is very well served by buses too. Parking is available at the apartment and you can get guest scratch cards from the council which are cheap and straightforward to use - and ensure you can always find a parking spot.
2. I love how social the location is. The flat is 2 minutes walk from Chatsworth Road, which has lots of lovely coffee shops, cafes, restaurants, and a 1920s style Art Deco cinema and cocktail bar called The Castle. The Adam and Eve & Eagle pubs do great food and lots of space for big group gatherings, and there are lots of very lovely restaurants including Krapow, Jim's Cafe and Silver Linings close by too. When I lived elsewhere, I would travel miles to get to these restaurants - they're that good. Hackney Wick and Dalston are both 10 minute cab rides away and have great nightlife and clubs, and you have the Moth Club for comedy, the Hackney Empire theatre, and the Picture House for film all in walking distance.
3. It's also very close to lots of green space and nice walks. Millfields, Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, Victoria Park or Hackney Marshes are all in walking distance. It's weird that you can have somewhere so central and in 10 minutes be somewhere that feels almost like the countryside (Walthamstow Marshes are a 10 minute cycle up the canal). I'm looking to buy my next house in the same area...
Q&A


Why are you selling? Because my partner and I are looking to buy a flat together with a second bedroom ;)

What's the area like? I love this area, I grew up here and I have lived all over but always come back because it's so full of life, greenery and culture.

What is parking like? Very good. I don't have a car but parking is available at the apartment and you can get guest scratch cards from the council which are cheap and straightforward to use - and ensure you can always find a parking spot.

How busy is the road, is it quiet at night? Very quiet - It's a really peaceful flat, despite being so close to Homerton Hospital, as the ambulances don't use sirens outside and park on the other side of the estate. The house is off-road so not much noise at all!

I'm currently working from home, how does that work in this property? It's nice to have a few possible areas to work - I like to work in the living room and the dining area but there is also place for a desk in the bedroom or a 2-person table in the kitchen.

What's the internet like? I have the highest speed internet on the market as I need it for work - v fast upload and download speeds and actually very inexpensive, only £26 a month.

What's the boiler like? I replaced the boiler and electric circuit board when I moved in 2 years ago to the most energy efficient and reliable ones available.

Are we able to do any work/extensions? You'd have to apply for planning permission from the council but other flats have done this with no issues. I was planning on knocking through the bathroom and toilet which you would have to get permission to do. You could also knock through the kitchen and dining area or even the kitchen, dining area and living room to make one big open plan space! Other flats with the same lay out in the block have done this. I got a quote to replace kitchen, toilet and bathroom and knock through the toilet and bathroom and it came to around £10k - so not a big cost to really make it your own.

Property Details:

Accommodation comprises a wide entrance hallway with side aspect window and storage/seat under, leading into the bright and spacious reception room with ample space for relaxing and dining. The separate kitchen comprises a range of matching white fronted wall and base units with work surfaces incorporating inset sink unit and further space for appliances. There is a spacious double bedroom with a useful inbuilt storage cupboard, and a modern bathroom with white bath suite and adjacent separate WC.

The property is superbly located just moments' from Homerton and Hackney Central stations, and within easy access of Stratford and Stratford International stations, all providing unrivalled cross-London and inter-city connections, as well as numerous regular bus routes linking the surrounding area. The property is also ideally located for an array of shops, bars, cafes and restaurants as well as the impressive Westfield Shopping centre, beautiful Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, Victoria Park and Hackney Marshes. The A12/M11 also offers easy access in and out of London.

Ref: Isl

detailedDescription:
Set within this grand period building is this bright and spacious, well-proportioned two bedroom apartment, arranged over two floors and featuring direct access to a private balcony and back garden.

Upon entering the property on the first floor, you are welcomed into a larger than average living space, with huge windows, high ceilings and an abundance of natural light. The spacious kitchen diner has ample room for a table with access to balcony and stairs down to garden. The generous master bedroom is also flooded with natural light. There is a further second double bedroom, perfect as a guest room or study. The property is in good condition throughout and benefits from being available on a chain-free basis.

This location is perfect, with great transport, local shops, restaurants and coffee shops. Within close distance of Highbury Fields, Clissold Park and Finsbury Park. Nearest transport is at Finsbury Park is only 5 mins wall. (Victoria, Piccadilly and National Rail Lines)

detailedDescription:
This well presented three bedroom town house is located in the heart of Victoria Park.

The bright and spacious accommodation is arranged over three floors and comprises a kitchen/diner and WC to the ground floor. To the first floor there is a living room and a double bedroom and the second floor offers two further double bedrooms and a family bathroom. The property also benefits from ample storage, an attic (which can be converted) and a private garden.

Morpeth Grove is ideally located only a 2 minute walk from the boutiques, delis, bars and restaurants of Victoria Park Village, and a mere 50m walk to Victoria Park itself. The area has excellent bus links to Highbury and Islington, Canary Wharf and The City, along Victoria Park and Lauriston Roads. Bethnal Green and Mile End tubes and Homerton overground are within easy reach, giving easy access to the West End, and beyond.

This property would be ideal for a family as there are also a good number of schools, both primary and secondary, nearby.

Viewings can be booked 24 hours a day and an internal viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:
Ideally situated in a quiet residential street close to Newington Green and Dalston Junction on the second floor of this modern and highly desirable development, is this stunning and beautifully finished bright and airy luxury 2 bed apartment.

Measuring an impressive of 824 sq ft and comprising of an open plan reception/ kitchen complete with integrated high spec appliances, a large balcony accessed through double sliding patio doors with far reaching views, two double bedrooms and two bathrooms, one en-suite.

The purpose built block benefits from fob entry and a communal courtyard with covered and secure bike storage.

Pellerin road is situated in one of the most thriving, trendy and vibrant locations undergoing massive regeneration in North East London. In Dalston the shops overflow with indie labels, vintage goods and restaurants which are noteworthy for their diversity and quality. With a vast selection of buzzing nightlife, charming cafes and much more, there is never a dull moment in this east end hotspot.

Located less than a 10 minute walk away from the excellent transport links that Dalston Kingsland Rail Station and Dalston Junction offer. These provide swift, fast and easy access into the West End, Canary Wharf and The City.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Two-bedroom purpose built flat located on the sixth floor and split over 670 Square Feet.

The large windows in every room flood the whole flat with natural light and give you a real sense of space.

The reception room is a great size and offers plenty of space for a dining table making it perfect to both relax and entertain.

The separate kitchen makes it ideal for families and shares alike.

Both bedrooms a good size doubles further adding to the enjoyment of living in the property.

The bathroom and WC are well proportioned and well laid out for again both families and shares.

In the hallway, there are two additional storage cupboards for everyday items.

Location;

The block is entered from Wenlock Street, a quiet no-through street close to the Regent’s Canal.

The building is excellently located next to Regent’s Canal towpath, leading towards Angel Islington in one direction and Victoria Park in the other.

Shepherdess Walk Park sits opposite the building’s entrance and it is conveniently placed for access to the City. The shops, bars, and restaurants of Islington Shoreditch, Hoxton, and Clerkenwell are within easy reach.

Significant redevelopment and investment continue to take place in the area of City Basin and Old Street’s ‘Silicon Roundabout’, attracting investment from tech companies and creative talent from around the world.

Transport;

Both Angel and Old Street tube stations are nearby, both on the Northern Line other quick routes to Central London, The West End and beyond.

Ideal for first-time buyers and those looking for a place in Zone 1.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

detailedDescription:

A well proportioned two bedroom apartment with underground parking set on the second floor of this sought-after eco-friendly riverside development close to Chatsworth Road.

Comprising of two double bedrooms, a contemporary bathroom and an open plan kitchen/reception leading out to a full-width private balcony the overlooks a lovely water feature. Paradise Park is a gated development with a video-entry system and secure bicycle spaces that was built approximately 12 years ago to a high specification. All the apartments boast contemporary kitchens with integrated appliances, a designer bathroom, high quality oak engineered flooring and carpets to bedrooms.

Set just moments from popular Chatsworth Road with its vast array of shops, bars and restaurants. The River Lea canal is on your doorstep whilst the open green spaces of Millfields recreation and Lea Valley nature reserve and park, a haven for those that enjoy outdoor activities including an ice rink, canoe and horse riding centre, is just moments away. Local buses routes take you to Hackney Central and beyond. Nearby Clapton Station offers swift and direct links to Liverpool Street Station in approximately 12 minutes.

Offered with no onward chain.

address: Gransden Avenue, London Fields, London E8
detailedDescription:
Chptr London Fields, is an exciting and unique boutique collection of 21 one, two and three bedroom apartments tucked away at the east side of London Fields. The development is gated, and the light and spacious high-spec apartments are grouped around a landscaped central courtyard and all have private terraces or balconies.

All apartments have underfloor heating, engineered wood flooring and 'feature' concrete walls. The kitchen has Bosch integrated appliances, 'J' pull style cabinets and stone worktops & spashbacks. There are high quality, fixtures and fittings, with black/brushed bronze ironmongery throughout. This two bedroom apartment has a n Easterly aspect with the terrace getting the morning Sun.

This increasingly sought-after neighborhood offers the best of city living in the creative heart of Hackney. Artists, brewers, makers and bakers sit alongside pioneering new workspaces and developments. An intoxicating mix of the old and new reflects the area’s industrial heritage, with converted warehouses, loft style new build apartments and a wide range of artisan shops, bars and restaurants in and around the nearby railway arches.

Everything you need is on your doorstep, from a wide range of local shops, to nearby green space and excellent transport connections. The popular Broadway Market is a short walk away, offering everything from a local fishmonger, butcher and baker to eclectic vintage, books and clothing stores in addition to numerous coffee shops, bars and restaurants. Also nearby are the high street stores of central Hackney and the designer outlet at Hackney Walk.

Hackney has the most green space of any inner London borough and is the cycling capital of the UK. At chptr you are surrounded by opportunities for a walk or ride in the park, from London Fields (a mere 2 minutes’ walk) and the Regents’ canal towpath, to Haggerston Park, Victoria Park and the extensive Olympic Park. The area is surrounded by a cycle route network and criss-crossed by dedicated cycle routes.

Public transport links are excellent, with easy access to three Overground lines via nearby London Fields, Hackney Central and Dalston Junction or Haggerston, and Bethnal Green Underground station just a mile away.

title: Studio for sale

detailedDescription:
This stunning home features generous proportions and retains a wealth of the original character throughout, flooded with natural light from its large sash windows. Set over the top two floors of a grand Victorian terrace, this wonderful three bedroom maisonette has been lovingly redesigned throughout by the current owners. Boasting incredible attention to detail and more style than you can shake a stick at, the property benefits from over 1,120 sq ft. This spacious apartment offers large reception room with high ceilings, original marble fireplace and exposed brick with glass doors open out to the kitchen complete with a breakfast bar and dining area.

The first floor houses a double bedroom, spectacular bathroom that has a wet room shower, bath, and a utility room with a washer & dryer. The second floor has two further double bedrooms, one of which is the main bedroom that includes built-in wardrobes along the entirety of the wall, providing an abundance of storage. Details to look out for are the gorgeous tiles in the kitchen and hallway, cast iron column radiators and cleverly built in storage.

Brooke Road is ideally positioned for short walks to the eclectic mix of independent shops, bars and restaurants along Stoke Newington High Street and Church Street. Links across the City are easy with the numerous bus routes that run along Stoke Newington Common and direct links into Central London couldn't be easier, with Rectory Road (Overground) being just around the corner (2-minute walk). Offered for sale chain free and with a long new lease.

agency_name: LRC - London Sales and Letting Agency
detailedDescription:
Spacious stunning 3 bedroom flat is located in the heart of Shoreditch with this fantastic new development. 2 mins walk from Hoxton over ground Station or 12 mins walk to Liverpool street.

This new development is perfectly located within one of London's most creatively dynamic and culturally vibrant boroughs, Shoreditch is the ultimate destination for modern city living. Within walking distance of the City, the area is also superbly connected to the rest of London and beyond.

Great transport links are another reason why living at Shoreditch is so convenient. Hoxton Station is on the doorstep, easily connecting you to major transport hubs. Liverpool Street is within walking distance and provides easy access to the new Crossrail line.

Shoreditch is within easy walking distance of a great range of distinctive restaurants and bars, from the premium Sushi Samba with its breathtaking views of the City, to the intimate and inventive Sager + Wilde and the speakeasy-style jazz bar Nightjar. From Michelin stars to rustic chic, there is something to excite every palette.

Shoreditch is within close proximity to an abundance of green spaces that provide a calming escape from the buzz and energy of the city. Regent’s Canal is a ten-minute walk with colourful cafés on its banks, and leads to historic Victoria Park, while Hackney City Farm brings the countryside into your life.

Please note images provided are intended for illustrative purposes only.

Great transport links are another reason why living at Shoreditch is so convenient. Hoxton Station is on the doorstep, easily connecting you to major transport hubs. Liverpool Street is within walking distance and provides easy access to the new Crossrail line.

Shoreditch is within easy walking distance of a great range of distinctive restaurants and bars, from the premium Sushi Samba with its breathtaking views of the City, to the intimate and inventive Sager + Wilde and the speakeasy-style jazz bar Nightjar. From Michelin stars to rustic chic, there is something to excite every palette.

Shoreditch is within close proximity to an abundance of green spaces that provide a calming escape from the buzz and energy of the city. Regent’s Canal is a ten-minute walk with colourful cafés on its banks, and leads to historic Victoria Park, while Hackney City Farm brings the countryside into your life.

Please note images provided are intended for illustrative purposes only.

detailedDescription:
An impressive one bedroom apartment presented in excellent order throughout, set on the third floor of this recent modern development on Cresset Road, minutes from Hackney Central, Homerton and London Fields stations.

The flat has a light, contemporary feel with its wooden flooring and simple white walls and is bathed in natural light from its full height windows, all of which open out onto Juliet balconies. Accommodation comprises a spacious living/dining space which incorporates the fully integrated open plan kitchen with quality Smeg appliances, a luxuriously appointed bathroom and a well proportioned bedroom.

This quiet yet central location means you are conveniently located by Well Street Market with independent shops, cafes and restaurants on your doorstep. The wide open spaces of Victoria Park and the pubs, independent shops and delis of Victoria Park Village are just a short stroll away, with London Fields and Broadway Market also nearby. It's also well placed for easy access into central London and also Westfield at Stratford with its vast array of shopping and eateries.

Full description:
The Express Estate Agency is proud to offer this Three Bedroom Ground & First Floor Maisonette – all interest and offers are invited.

Internal:
Entrance Hall - The front entrance door opens to the hall, with the staircase leading up to the first floor landing and doors to the kitchen, lounge and WC.
Kitchen - Fitted with a range of white wall and base units with laminate worktops over. Inset stainless steel sink basin with a drainer and mixer tap and an integrated electric oven with a countertop hob and overhead extractor hood. Space for appliances, a front aspect window and a storage cupboard.
Lounge - Offering generous space for furniture with rear aspect windows and a door to the garden.
WC - With a WC and a wash hand basin. Front aspect obscure window.

First Floor Landing - With doors to the bedrooms, the bathroom, and the storage cupboard.
Bedroom One - Double size room with a rear aspect window and a built-in storage cupboard.
Bedroom Two - Double size room with a front aspect window and a built-in storage cupboard.
Bedroom Three - Single size room with a rear aspect window and a built-in storage cupboard.
Bathroom - Comprising a WC, a vanity unit enclosed wash hand basin and a panelled bath with an overhead shower. Front aspect window.

External:
Sheltered entrance to the front. To the rear is a large garden with wooden fencing and a patio area.

Early viewing is highly recommended due to the property being realistically priced.
