address: Defoe Road, Stoke Newington, Hackney N16
detailedDescription:
**Guide Price: £1,500,000-£1,600,000**
Peacefully tucked behind popular Church Street, this unique award winning two bedroom detached freehold warehouse is referred to as a “hidden gem”. Restored in 2016 by Paper House Project archi-tects and with further extension and improvement works carried out by the current owner, it offers an expansive light-filled space with double height ceilings, polished concrete floors and large gridded steel windows embodying luxurious warehouse living.

The house comprises a vaulted entrance with large factory style windows running along the south-facing wall flooding the space with natural light. The exceptional light is complimented further by sky-lights throughout the versatile and voluminous open plan entertaining space.

The fully integrated kitchen with state of the art appliances sits flush and is carved into the rear double height wall, boasting a high specification finish, oak veneer cabinetry, Miele and Gaggenau appliances and further flush ample high level storage.

The current owner has improved upon the original floor plan and extended the entertaining space to create a semi-separate alcove leading directly to a private courtyard via telescopic sliding doors, creat-ing a seamless flow between the internal and external space. Sit inside with the feeling of being outside.

The main room is a truly versatile entertaining space with a fitted bespoke floating cast concrete wet bar/workspace along the north wall and an elegant projection panel fitted along the same wall. This cleverly designed workspace does not interfere with the projection from above allowing for simultaneous multifunction purpose. Acoustically treated floating fabric ceiling and walls, fully elec-tric blinds give you a full cinematic experience all within the comfort of your home.

The utility room/pantry offers a large storage area which again is a flexible space that could be easily converted back into a study if required.

The main bedroom situated on the 1st floor is accessed via a semi-open staircase is fitted with electric windows and blinds, built-in storage and contemporary timber floors, as well as a beautifully fitted en-suite bathroom featuring timber panelling and further storage.

The second, equally spacious bedroom is accessed via the ground floor entrance hall and benefits from ample built-in storage, fully electric blinds and floor to ceiling windows which open onto the private courtyard.

Hidden behind the perfectly finished walls and floors, the property boasts underfloor heating, concealed air conditioning units throughout the house, partial app controlled lighting and ample storage.

Dalton House is a fine example of contemporary warehouse living with high quality finishes in a modern and raw form, all housed within an attractive detached freehold building.

Accessed via a shared secure entry gate, The house is ideally located just south of the independent shops and restaurants of Stoke Newington Church Street and west of Stoke Newington High Street, with the surrounding green open spaces of Clissold Park, Abney Park and Stoke Newington Common all within easy reach. There are number of excellent primary and secondary schools in the area including the William Patten Primary School, graded outstanding by Ofsted, which is located just moments from the property. Nearby transport links include Stoke Newington and Rectory Road overground stations as well as wealth of local bus routes. The nearby A10 also provides easy access out of London.

Nb. Artwork courtesy of the artist:

Stunning one bedroom flat in excellent condition throughout perfectly located between Newington Green and Dalston.

The bedroom is a great size and the current owners have cleverly managed to optimise the space.

title: 1 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A period family home built in the mid-1800s and totalling near 2,100 sq ft. It has been owned by the same family for generations which is testament to the much loved location. The property boasts period features to include wooden flooring, sash windows with shutters and fireplaces. The favourable orientation floods the house with natural light while the high ceilings give an enviable sense of space. The property offers interchangeable space and an ideal template to create an idyllic family home. Accommodation currently comprises of five bedrooms, double reception, separate kitchen, two bathrooms and a near 50 ft rear garden. There is potential to extend the property via a mansard and rear extension subject to the usual consents. We expect high interest in this property which is available chain free.

Situation
Newington Green is an ideal location positioned between Highbury, Stoke Newington, Hackney and Islington. Lizzie’s on the Green is a local coffee favourite along with the award winning Alma public house for something stronger. Access across town is effortless with ample bus routes including the 73 which goes to Kings Cross, Euston and Victoria. The green open space of Clissold Park is just over a mile away.

detailedDescription:
A spectacular three-bedroom apartment on the 32nd floor with 1,463 sqft of internal space and South-West facing views over London. This home has been thoughtfully laid out, featuring a generously proportioned open plan living and dining area with a south-west facing balcony.

The kitchen is finished in a luxurious ‘Figured Sycamore’ timber veneer and fully integrated Miele appliances. The three large double bedrooms include integrated wardrobes, floor to ceiling windows and oak herringbone floors, that run throughout the apartment.

Principal Tower an iconic 50-storey residential development designed by the award-winning architects Foster and Partners. This stunning new addition is the epitome of understated elegance, crafted to respond to the uniqueness of its location both geographically and culturally. Principal Tower offers the opportunity to own an architectural piece of art, that will give constant pleasure and lasting value

Residents benefit from a 24-hour concierge and access to an edgeless infinity pool, spa, sauna, state-of-the-art gym, a cinema and residents lounge. All apartments include oak herringbone floors, central heating, comfort cooling, and floor-to-ceiling windows.

Principal Tower is situated in the creative hub of Shoreditch which benefits from renowned restaurants and an array of nightlife. By day, the apartments are flooded with natural light, providing an ambience that is both energising and life-enhancing. By night, residents will enjoy the city lights and romance of the world’s most famous capital.

Great transportation links include Liverpool Street Station, with access to National Rail, Central Line and District and Circle Lines (0.3 miles) and Shoreditch High Street Station which provides overground transportation links (0.3 miles).

Transport:

• London Liverpool Street – 3 Minutes

• Tottenham Court Road – 5 Minutes

detailedDescription:
A stylish, larger than average one bedroom apartment arranged over 550sq ft/50sqm located within a popular part of town. And benefiting from no onward chain.

This property set on the first floor of a modern canal side development would make for an excellent first time buy, investment or downsizer purchase. Comprising a well proportioned reception/diner taking you to an open plan kitchen with built in appliances, a large double bedroom with built in wardrobes, good size bathroom and hallway with storage. There is also access to an unofficial terrace from the reception room window. The property also benefits from a secure parking and bike storage on the ground floor.

Location

Timber Wharf enjoys a central location next to the Regent's Canal on Kingsland Road, making for very easy access into nearby Shoreditch, Liverpool Street, London Fields, Broadway Market, Dalston, as well as the ever popular Columbia Road and Brick Lane. It is well served by local stations including Hoxton and Haggerston (overground) and excellent bus routes with quick and easy access to the City, West End and Canary Wharf. The area also benefits from a wide range of bars, cafes and restaurants, and is a short stroll from the wide open spaces of Haggerston Park.

Square Footage: 560sq ft/51sqm

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
2,730 sq ft of lateral space in the rarely available Shepherdess Walk Buildings. A large 3 double bedroom modernised loft apartment on the third floor. Converted in the late 1990’s from an original Victorian Warehouse, this prominent building is known for the unique apartments located within.

Occupying a a prominent corner of the building, light streams in through the dual aspect original sash windows that run the entire length of both sides of the apartment. Measuring a vast 160 sqm the main living space is large enough to easily accommodate two dining areas, tv and sitting area. To one side is a modern, well proportioned kitchen complete with two walk-in pantries and a breakfast bar. The three bedrooms are located off a wide hallway; the master bedroom has a dressing room plus en-suite with twin sinks and each of the two other bedrooms have their own en-suite shower rooms. There is a guest WC, a utility room, built in wardrobes and plenty of storage space. There is also a second entrance providing access to Underwood Row.

The apartment was reconfigured circa 7 years ago by the award winning Architect Manuel Irsara of sirs. The combination of classic loft with modern fixtures & fittings blends seamlessly from the oak strip parquet to the original cast iron doors/pillars, to Lutron lighting, underfloor heating throughout and a fresh air filtration system.

Shepherdess Walk is close to Clerkenwell, Shoreditch & Islington with numerous transport connections nearby including Moorgate & Old Street tube stations plus an extensive bus network from City Road. You can walk along the canal to the Towpath Cafe or Broadway Market, or to the shops, cinema and theatre in Islington. Secure underground car parking spaces are available to rent on a long lease and/or purchase by separate negotiation.

Share of Freehold - 999 year lease from March 1996.

Residents benefit from a 24-hour concierge and access to an edgeless infinity pool, spa, sauna, state-of-the-art gym, a cinema and residents lounge. All apartments include oak herringbone floors, central heating, comfort cooling, and floor-to-ceiling windows.

Principal Tower is situated in the creative hub of Shoreditch which benefits from renowned restaurants and an array of nightlife. By day, the apartments are flooded with natural light, providing an ambience that is both energising and life-enhancing. By night, residents will enjoy the city lights and romance of the world’s most famous capital.

Great transportation links include Liverpool Street Station, with access to National Rail, Central Line and District and Circle Lines (0.3 miles) and Shoreditch High Street Station which provides overground transportation links (0.3 miles).

Transport:

• London Liverpool Street – 3 Minutes

• Tottenham Court Road – 5 Minutes

• Canary Wharf – 6 Minutes

• Bond Street – 7 Minutes

• London Bridge – 9 Minutes

• Heathrow T1 – 32 Minutes

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
This 850 sq ft three bedroom apartment located in the popular Fashion Place development, just a 5 minute walk from Hackney Central Station The apartment is highly specified with an open-plan reception and fully integrated kitchen leading to a private balcony

Transport

Fashion Place is situated 5 minutes walk from overground services at Hackney Central and 11 minutes walk from mainline rail at London Fields direct into Liverpool Street.

Travel Times

Overground Rail
Average journey times from Hackney Central include:

12 minutes to Stratford
13 minutes to Hoxton
16 minutes to Shoreditch High Street
18 minutes to Whitechapel

Mainline Rail
Average journey times from London Fields include:

2 minutes to Hackney Downs
4 minutes to Bethnal Green
9 minutes to London Liverpool Street

Underground
Average tube connections from Liverpool Street include:

1 minute to Bank
1 minute to Moorgate
8 minutes to Tottenham Court Road
8 minutes to Kings Cross St. Pancras
13 minutes to Covent Garden

Local Area

Designed in London and fashioned exclusively for Chatham Place - a collection of apartments located moments from the new multi million pound Hackney Fashion Hub - an unprecedented regeneration landmark set to transform the immediate vicinity into a world class fashion destination that will elevate the heart of east London to West End status.

Hackney Boasts 1300 listed buildings and 29 conservation areas amongst its historic credentials and industrial heritage.

A town with its own village, its own parkland and its own unique lifestyle driven by a frenzy of multi-cultural influences and diversities. Soak it up, it's all there waiting to happen.

Victoria Park and its hidden gem, The Village, lie a stone's throw from Fashion Place, providing residents with a rural retreat alive with quirky stores, boutiques, galleries and alfresco eateries.

Stray a little further and you're on Regent's Canal, then it's Brick Lane, Spitalfields and Shoreditch proper - 'silicon roundabout' now home to over 3000 high tech establishments including Dopplr, Last FM, Google and Microsoft.

No need to dive out of the shower and start the daily grind into the City from Fashion Place - 20 minutes door to door and you're in the heart of financial London with the tube and forthcoming Crossrail dissecting the metropolis from Liverpool Street. That's city life in style.

The property

Following the reception room you have a spacious double bedroom big enough to fit any furniture of your choice. The room benefits from fitted coat hangers and large windows.
The bathroom is equipped with a panel bathtub and hand-wash basin and you have a separate toilet and WC.
The kitchen is found at the rear end of the property and is fully equipped with a fridge/freezer, gas hob, oven and washing machine. With ample storage and worktop space, your culinary skills will surely be utilized. From the kitchen you have direct access to the large communal garden
The location

detailedDescription:
Description

For sale by conditional sale Guide Price £30,000+ Houseboat and Secure & Private Mooring in Wenlock Basin, Islington, the pair can be purchased together or separately.

The mooring has a Guide price of £30,000+

The House Boat has a Guide Price £45,000+

Please note the pair can either be purchased together or separately.

Built in 2005, Engine Vetus 3.09,25hp Diesel with techno drive gearbox. Foredeck with hatch to water tankard half glazed, wooden doors leading to living area. Solid fuel stove and TV cabinet, walk through fully fitted gallery, privacy door to cross over bathroom with half bath and shower.

Full description
The houseboat including secure and private mooring in prime spot on Wenlock Basin, Islington with spectacular views from the deck up and down the Regent's canal, with neighbouring bird life, from the coot's nest just off the bow, to the passing swans, cormorants and grey herons.

Wenlock Basin is gated and secure with private mooring situated close to Angel tube station, Upper Street, Islington Green and Old Street. Landscaped trees, bushes and plants run the entire length of its wooden jetty with good sized areas for socialising with benches and tables all along. A social area at the entrance to the mooring is especially large, situated under trees right next to the canal it is perfect for alfresco dinning and barbecues. Each mooring is provided with a separately metered shore power, from this your water, electricity and a telephone/Wi-Fi can be accessed.

Double bed, with hanging wardrobe and overhead storage

Bathroom

Privacy door to cross over the bathroom

Lounge

Open through layout, kitchen area and single seating area which doubles up as the second bedroom with a single bed. Walk through access to the outdoor viewing area.

detailedDescription:
Sitting quietly on a charming cobbled mews, a short walk from the heart of Dalston, this warehouse has been beautifully renovated into a three bedroom house. The commodious proportions of the Victorian industrial building have been embraced to create a series of contemporary living, sleeping and working spaces that are filled with light resulting an ethereal atmosphere. There is a private terrace and a balcony off the second floor from where you can soak up the peace and quiet within one of the most buzzing parts of London.

Atlas Mews is a secluded gated street, engendering a quiet sense of retreat in this much-loved corner of east London. Built circa 1905, the mews has a history of light industrial use, supposedly used as stables for police horses, and later home to small factories. Its buildings have been thoughtfully restored by resident artists and creatives since the 1980s, retaining and restoring the original character of the buildings and fostering a warm sense of community while doing so. The house is positioned for the best of east London, with the green spaces of Hackney Downs, London Fields and Clissold Park all close at by.

The interior plan is arranged over three levels, connected with a striking staircase. The ground floor is currently used as a separate studio apartment with a huge bedroom/living space, and adjacent kitchenette and bathroom.There is a wonderful courtyard off this floor that provides an effortless connection to the outside.

The first floor is simply arranged with an open-plan kitchen that runs along one length of the room and a vast living space. The decor is sensitive to the original building and the vast proportions create a sense of calm. Warm-hued original floorboards run underfoot and the white painted brickwork is nod to the industrial past. The wide windows, that face east, capture the morning light.

On the second floor there are two bedrooms, a shower room and a balcony. This level of the house is peaceful and perfect for relaxing and sleeping. There is also a mezzanine floor with a bedroom.

Atlas Mews has off-street parking spaces for residents. This home lies just off Dalston Lane and is a short walk from Dalston Junction and Hackney Central station, for services to Highbury & Islington, Shoreditch High Street and Canada Water on the East London Overground Line. Regular services run from Hackney Downs station to Liverpool Street.

detailedDescription:
Situated on the fourth floor of this private gated development within The Shoreditch Triangle is this fantastic two-bedroom two-bathroom apartment. detailedDescription:
A luxury (662 sq ft) two bedroom, two bathroom apartment located on the 2nd floor with balcony overlooking the garden and west reservoir (water views) in Residence Tower Woodberry Down N4.

This development offers benefit from a 24 hour concierge service, residents spa, gym and swimming pool. Manor House station on the Piccadilly line is a 6 minute walk from Woodberry Down.

North London’s Woodberry Down is a multi award winning regeneration scheme located in the London Borough of Hackney, only moments from Finsbury Park. Once complete it will feature over 5,500 new homes set in 64 across acres with 15 acres of parkland and an additional 42 acres of open water – the spectacular natural surroundings of two existing reservoirs (the Woodberry Wetlands Nature Reserve and a serene sailing lake).

Woodberry Down is conveniently located just 8 minutes walk to Manor House station (Piccadilly line) providing direct links to Kings Cross St Pancras (National Rail, Eurostar) in 20 minutes.

Leasehold: 999 years (from new)

Ground rent: GBP300 pa

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
A substantial, three-bedroom, three-bathroom, split level period conversion set across the second and third floor of this handsome Victorian building in N4. Standing at an impressive 1,171 sqft, the property has been cleverly extended by the current owners to make use of every square foot through whilst being presented in immaculate condition and décor including porcelain files, Farrow ad Ball wallpaper, Burlington toilet fixtures and remote-controlled blinds, not to mention the roof being replaced fully in 2021. After entering the first floor, the second floor offers a wonderfully bright, east facing open plan living room/kitchen featuring two larger windows facing the quiet road. The rear of the building on the second floor occupies two good sized bedrooms and two intelligently designed showerooms. Leading up to the third floor on the half landing is an accessible west facing private roof terrace benefitting from outdoor lights and a superb view across London and neighbouring gardens. The third (top floor) is home to the master bedroom, a beautifully finished en-suite bathroom, and an abundance of eaves storage.
The ever-popular Wilberforce Road allows for easy access to Finsbury Park and Arsenal stations as well as the green spaces of both Finsbury Park and Clissold Park. A variety of shops, cafes and eateries are located on Blackstock Road and nearby Highbury Park. Stoke Newington Church Street is also a short walk away through Clissold Park. The nearest public transport link is Finsbury Park Station (Victoria, Piccadilly and National Rail Lines) and Arsenal Underground Station (Piccadilly Line), whilst there are numerous bus routes taking you into Angel, the City and the West End.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully presented one bedroom period flat with private woodland style garden in a conservation area, located on the first floor and split over 570 Square Feet on a sought-after residential road in Stoke Newington.

As you enter the property the hallway offers space for shoes and jackets and naturally leads you to the reception room. The reception room with a large bay window floods the space with natural light and a calming view over the woodland garden and trees, which make up one of the main draws to the property.

Other period features such as the high ceilings, fire place and wooden floors all add further to the enjoyment of living in this property.

Down a few stairs is the separate kitchen, finished to a high standard, with ample space for a dinning table making it ideal to relax and entertain alike.

The master bedroom is a great size with ample space for large wardrobes and a chest of draws and like the rest of the property is very light.

The bathroom is well proportioned for a one bedroom flat and further benefits from a full length bath and is finished to a very high standard.

Access to the private section of the garden is via a side gate to the property and there is ample space to use to your own personal requirements.

The property also offers parking immediately outside.

Location;

Lordship Park is a tree-lined residential road very close Clissold Park and also the reservoir.

Stoke Newington High Street is just around the corner with an array of everyday amenities alongside award-winning bars and restaurants.

Church Street is also within walking distance for more boutique shops and independent coffee shops.

Transport;

Lordship Park is located between Stoke Newington Overground Stations with quick routes to Central London and is featured on bus routes giving easy access to get around.

Manor House Underground Station on the Piccadilly Line is also within walking distance or a short bus journey away.

Ideal for first time buyers or a Pied-à-Terre.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

address: Charles Hayward Building, Goldsmith Row, Hackney E2
detailedDescription:
A stunning three bedroom duplex apartment measuring over 1,200 sq. Ft. And with a south facing private terrace, set behind the striking original facade of the former Queen Elizabeth Children's Hospital.

Comprising a large open plan fully integrated kitchen/diner and living space, a guest w/c and utility room to the upper level. The lower level comprises of three double bedrooms and a contemporary bathroom. The master bedroom further benefits from a walking wardrobe area, an en-suite shower room and access to a private south facing garden. Forming part of the highly sought-after original building, the property is spread over the raised and lower ground floor and measures approximately 1,249 sq. Ft.

Finished to a high specification throughout, the property boasts Amtico flooring throughout, high ceilings (minimum 2.5m in the basement) and beautiful over-sized double-glazed windows allowing for a wealth of natural light.

Enjoying an ideal location just moments from the vibrant Columbia Road market and nestled within equal proximity to Broadway market, Shoreditch and the open green spaces of Victoria Park, Haggerston Park and London Fields. A number of transport links service the property including frequent buses on Hackney Road whilst Cambridge Heath (Overground), Hoxton (Overground) and Bethnal Green (Central Line) offer swift train links to the City, West End and beyond. Chain free

The building was first used as a hospital in 1870, with the creation of the buildings along Goldsmiths Row, and later Hackney Road at the beginning of the 20th century. A series of alterations and extensions continued from the 1930s through to the 1970s. The design by award-winning architects hta Design llp has been developed to complement its location by incorporating the original and historic facade, on Hackney Road, which has been retained and refurbished as a permanent reminder of the site's long and rich history.

detailedDescription:
This most immaculately presented two double bedroom, one bathroom modern apartment is enviably located in Hoxton Square. The property is set on the second floor with floor to ceiling windows which provide an incredible view of Hoxton Square and the Roman Catholic Church of St Monica's Priory.

Hoxton Square is at the centre of London’s most vibrant and creative hubs. Old Street, popularly known as Silicon Roundabout runs immediately to the west of the square and has become closely connected to the global digital industry. The square itself is well known to be one of East London’s most sociable locations.

Living in Hoxton Square means you're within a short walk of some of London’s liveliest and most eccentric shops and boutiques. It's one of the area's most desirable locations with a plethora of bars, shops and restaurants on your doorstep with central Shoreditch just moments away. Columbia Road with its famous flower market, Brick Lane and Spitalfields Market are also all close by. The Frog Hoxton restaurant in Hoxton Square by Adam Handling being a definite highlight. The former MasterChef finalist's innovative Modern British cooking served in a stylish, casual space is a must visit.

Transport links include Old Street (Northern Line and National Rail), Shoreditch (East London Line) and Liverpool Street (Central, Metropolitan, Hammersmith & City and Circle lines and National Rail) stations with the City just moments away.

detailedDescription:
A stunning three double bedroom, almost 1,200 square feet, apartment in arguably East London's trendiest residential developments. 2.7 metre high ceilings, two private balconies and a glass-bottomed heated rooftop swimming pool.

This vast, open plan loft style apartment sits on the fourth floor of the award-winning 'Warehaus' development, located in the beating heart of London Fields.

On entering the development, you're met with an impressive atrium running through the centre of the 30-flat scheme, it's roof being the glass bottom of the year-round heated swimming pool for resident's use. There is also a large communal roof terrace overlooking the City.

The apartment extends to almost 1200sqft, and is comprised of: Three double bedrooms, master with en-suite and a walk in wardrobe; a large family bathroom; hardwood flooring throughout with underfloor heating; a vast open plan kitchen/dining/reception room; and two private balconies. The development also benefits from a 24 hour concierge, who can help with everything from taking food deliveries to recommending the hottest new eating spots in the area.

Warehaus is located in sought-after London Fields, meaning amenities such as London Fields Park, Hackney Picture House, London Fields Lido, Broadway Market and the huge array of independent bars, Michelin star restaurants and cafes in the neighbourhood are all a short walk away. Victoria Park Village is also a short stroll away with its own variety of award winning bars and restaurants, as well as the immaculately kept park itself.

Transport links are exceptional, with nearby London Fields and Hackney Central Overground stations offering direct links to Liverpool Street (Central, Circle, Elizabeth (Crossrail from 2018), Hammersmith & City and Overground lines, as well as tfl and National Rail), and Stratford (Central, DLR and Overground lines as well as Nation Rail), respectively.

detailedDescription:
30% Shared Ownership ** Offered with no onward chain and a long lease is a stunning two bedroom purpose built flat, boasting circa 650sq ft of internal floor space. Set within a sought after development located in Woodberry Down, a moments walk to Manor House underground and Stamford Hill station. This unusually spacious apartment offers exceptional contemporary living space and is beautifully presented throughout.

Location

Stoke Newington and Finsbury Park are both within a mile and offer a large choice of bars and restaurants. For transport Manor House tube station is very close and Finsbury Park is also close for further tube and train options. Journey times from Manor House; Kings Cross, 10 minutes, Covent Garden, 15 minutes, Piccadilly Circus, 20 minutes.

Lease Information

122 years remaining on lease. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries via a solicitor.

Features

Comprising of a stunning large reception room that boasts large double glazed windows and patio doors that stretch from floor to ceiling and lead out to a private balcony that offers elevated views of the local area. The open plan kitchen diner is equipped with modern fitted cabinetry offering ample storage, solid wood work surfaces and high-end integrated appliances. Both bedroom are well proportioned offering space for wardrobes. The stylish family bathroom boasts ceramic tiled walls and floor, white bathroom suite with chrome fittings.

Stoke Newington and Finsbury Park are only short walks away with a wide variety of restaurants, pubs and cafes and the wide-open green spaces of Clissold Park and Finsbury Park. Local transport links include Manor House Station (Piccadilly line, Zones 2 & 3) Finsbury Park station (Piccadilly and Victoria lines, Zone 2, National Rail / Thameslink) and Stamford Hill overground station.

Shared Ownership

The rent is £931.24, and the service charge is £221.25 per month. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own inquiries via a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

Enfield Road is perfectly positioned on a quiet residential turning within striking distance of the numerous amenities Kingsland Road has to offer. Just minutes away is the Regents Canal, perfect for walking, running, cycling or enjoying the many bars and cafes along the towpath going east towards Victoria Park or west towards Angel, Islington. title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription: An opportunity to acquire a fabulous, 2 double bedroom, 2 bathroom flat, converted across the lower level of an imposing, Georgian, double fronted detached building, benefitting from sole use of an exceptional rear garden. Accommodation is well arranged comprising; a large, semi open plan kitchen/reception room that provides direct access to the vast, manicured rear garden. There are two double bedrooms, (one of which features an en-suite) as well as a family bathroom suite. Albion Road is exceptionally well placed for so much of what the area has to offer, with a plethora of cafes, restaurants and trendy bars found at Dalston and Kingsland Road to the East, Stoke Newington to the North and Newington Green only moments away, with the delightful greenery and leisure amenities of Clissold Park just a short stroll. Transport can be found at Dalston Kingsland, Dalston Junction, Canonbury Station (London Overground) and Stoke Newington station (trains to Liverpool Street), with a number of bus routes running on Green Lanes and Newington Green Road.

detailedDescription:
Available to view 7 days A week

Victorstone are delighted to market this spacious 4 double bedroom terraced house with massive extension potential (sstp) in the heart of Stoke Newington, N16.

Excellently located for the wealth of amenities Stoke Newington has to offer. Clissold Park and Abney Park cemetery are within 10 minutes’ walk and the locally renowned Church Street with its exciting mix of independent bars and shops just a short stroll away. Conveniently located for public transport, Stoke Newington and Rectory Road stations (London Overground) are nearby, as are the many major bus routes serving nearby Stoke Newington High Street (A10).

Formerly a butcher’s shop, the property was converted some years ago and as a result has the added benefit of an additional single storey building attached to the side of the original house (all held under 1 title).

Accessed via two separate entrances, the original residence comprises of a large reception room, separate sit-in kitchen (with direct access to the private courtyard garden), spacious family bathroom and three very well-proportioned double bedrooms.

The converted commercial space further includes another living space, bathroom, separate combi boiler and access to the private courtyard garden. This space could be used as an additional ensuite bedroom or reception room and could easily be integrated with the rest of the house. Due to the additional separate entrance, it may be possible to use or convert the space into a separate dwelling (sstp). It may also be possible to add and additional storey (sstp) as adjacent properties have done adding further development potential.

Having recently undergone light refurbishment and re-decorated with neutral décor the property presents in good condition with no obvious immediate works required and ready to move in.

Offered to market chain free and sold with vacant possession, early viewings are highly recommended.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
* virtual tour * - cash buyers only -

Fraser & Co are delighted to offer to the sales market this stunning two bedroom, two bathroom apartment within the prestigious development of Eagle Point.

This fantastic apartment is set on the 13th floor with East facing views from both bedrooms. Finished to the very highest standard with parquet wooden flooring throughout the living areas, this apartment offers the best of modern living whilst retaining the character of the Art-Deco building. Measuring approximately 908 sq. Ft. The open-plan living/kitchen area benefits from a separate built in storage cupboard, high end integrated appliances and exceptional furniture. Both double bedrooms benefit from built in storage with the master also comprising an en-suite bathroom. A separate, second bathroom is accessible from the hallway.

Eagle Point is both indulgent and sophisticated - from the 12-seater art-deco inspired screening room with facilities to the Spa that boasts not only the expected pool, sauna and steam room but also provides an experience shower and heater loungers. There is also a 24-hr concierge service as well as a residents’ gym.

Eagle Point could not be better placed in terms of transport - a short 5minute walk away finds you at Old Street station - providing both National Rail & Underground services.

The area provides much in the way of activities and amenities - from the boutique shops nearby in Old Street but also a host of restaurant and bars that provide a range of dining and entertaining experiences.

A stunning four bedroom period, freehold house benefitting from two separate roof terraces, a courtyard garden and characterful period features throughout.

The property comprises four double bedrooms, open-plan kitchen/reception room, master bathroom and additional shower room, courtyard garden, first floor roof terrace and a further roof terrace with panoramic views across London.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

address: Wyles House, Prodigal Square, Hackney Gardens, London E8
detailedDescription:
Surrounded by greenery, lies this two bedroom, duplex apartment with 2216 sq ft garden and terrace.

Its considered, layout maximizes the space, creating the illusion of a house. The apartment offers extensive storage throughout and includes built-in Siemens appliances, underfloor heating, engineered oak flooring, LED lighting, video entry system and daytime concierge.

Hackney Gardens is a collection of 58 luxury apartments surrounded by landscaped pathways and gardens, in the grounds of an 18th Century Church, moments from Hackney Central Overground.

The apartments are split between two new buildings, Wyles House and Blackburn House, which are situated off Prodigal Square, a new, semi-public space at the heart of the development. Here a new community center, focused on arts-based projects has been created.

Situated next door and soon to be restored to its former glory by Es Devlin and John Pawson is St John-at-Hackney church. Dating back to 1792, it has a capacity of 2,000 so unsurprisingly, it doubles up as a concert venue for the likes of Ed Sheeran, Coldplay, Emeli Sandé, Elbow, Florence & The Machine and international DJs.

Hackney Gardens, offers an abundance of choice. Be it London Fields park and its open air Lido, Broadway Market, the East End institution, Hackney Empire or Dalston with its thriving nightlife. The local community is buzzing with its multicultural mix of creatives, entrepreneurs, city workers and parents.

For transportation, Hackney Central Overground is 2 minutes away as is the number 17 bus route which traverses across London. By train, Hackney Downs will transport you to Liverpool Street in under nine minutes. Alternatively, a two-mile cycle south takes you to the City.

At just over 835sq. Ft., this beautiful maisonette boasts a stylish finish throughout and benefits from a secluded landscaped rear garden. Spread across the upper floor of a handsome Victorian building, this share of freehold home is perfectly suited to family life and is within close proximity to both London Fields and Victoria Park.

Offering space to grow into, the property comprises; a large main bedroom in the loft area, another double bedroom with fitted wardrobes and views overlooking the rear garden. There is a neatly tiled well-appointed family bathroom suite. There is a fabulous open-plan fitted kitchen/dining space (ideal for entertaining) with large windows allowing an abundance of natural light. The garden creates the perfect sun-trap in the warmer months. Additional benefits include share of freehold, wood-sash double glazing and plenty of storage throughout and a wonderful terrace overlooking the garden. detailedDescription:
Coming Early 2022

An exciting collection of one, two and three bedroom apartments, situated in a sought-after area of Hackney, surrounded by the green spaces of Millfields Park and Hackney Marshes.

A calm haven amongst the bustle of East London, with flats that are ideal for either shared ownership or first-time buyers.

About Arcadia View

Located in one of Hackney's most tranquil and green spaces, this development offers property owners plenty of recreational outdoor space, with Hackney Marshes, Millfields Park and River Lea Nature Reserve just a short stroll away. Clapton Station is a ten minute walk away, while multiple bus routes serve the local area from Upper Clapton Road.

Arcadia View comprises of 48 luxury properties, offering a range of one to three bedroom apartments, available through Shared Ownership so that first-time buyers can have a helping hand onto the property ladder.

Eligibility Criteria
To be able to own a home through Shared Ownership at Arcadia View, you'll need to meet the following criteria depending on your situation:

- Your overall household income is less than £90,000
- You are unable to purchase a suitable home to meet your housing needs on the open market
- You do not already own a home or you will have sold your current home before you purchase
- Priority will be give to those that work or live in the borough

What is Shared Ownership?

If you can't quite afford the mortgage on 100% of a home, Shared Ownership offers you the chance to buy a share of your home (between 35% and 75%) and pay rent on the remaining share. Later on, you could buy bigger shares when you can afford to.

About Southern Home Ownership

Southern Home Ownership, part of Southern Housing Group, offer a variety of different developments, ranging from traditional family homes in the countryside to vibrant city apartments. All our homes are offered on a shared ownership basis and provide exciting opportunities for first time buyers, in London and the South East.
Our Southern Home Ownership Team is committed to providing high-quality design and excellent customer service.

*Any photographs or computer generated images are indicative of the quality and style of the specification and may not represent the actual fittings and furnishings at the development.

address: Principal Tower, Worship Lane, Shoreditch EC2A
detailedDescription:
Dual aspect 18th floor aparmtent boasting over (778 Sq. Ft) plus (57 Sq. Ft) dual aspect north and west facing terrace.

Located next door to the Gherkin, Walkie-Talkie, Tower 42 and Cheesegrater the Principal Tower is set to be an icon of its own. Foster + Partners behind the design of the building reflecting the character of this Shoreditch & The City location. Principal Place plaza offers boutiques, cafés, bars and many eateries.

Five local, major transport hubs within walking distance, making it convenient to access all corners of the capital. London City Airport being under 30 minutes away. Principle Tower will be the first residential tower in London designed both inside and out by the world famous Foster + Partners.

Situated in the latest sought-after development; Principal Tower, this property will make for an amazing home or investment.

With an open-plan living space, super luxurious finishes, floor-to-ceiling glazing, built in wardrobes, ample amount of storage; the list of luxuries is just endless!
24hr five-star concierge
Reception & lounge/bar

Comfort cooling and underfloor heating
Stone kitchen worktops and bathroom suites
Landscaping and courtyards

Location:
Principal tower is set to join the cast of landmarks on London’s iconic skyline nestled between Liverpool Street, The Gherkin, and St. Paul's Cathedral. Luxury brands a short walk away including the Royal Exchange; a host to a great number of high-end fashion brands including Louis Vuitton, Smythson, Tiffany & Co, Gucci And Bulgari. Comprises a new half-acre public piazza, 600,000 sqft of state-of-the-art office space and 20,000 sqft of retail space. The latter includes a lively offering of bars, cafés, restaurants and fashionable boutiques. Michelin-starred dining, newly emerging artists the River Thames and 5 star services also all at your fingertips!

address: Principal Place, Worship Street, London EC2A
detailedDescription:
Principal Tower enjoys a prestigious location overlooking the heart of the City of London, the top global financial centre, and Shoreditch, the trend-setting capital of the world, it is where the most influential financial district in the City meets the innovative tech hub of Silicon Roundabout and infused with the fascinating creativity from Shoreditch.

Adding to London's iconic contemporary skyline, Principal Tower was designed inside and out by Foster + Partners.

Situation

detailedDescription:
If you are unable to buy a property outright on the open market, then Shared Ownership could be the ideal solution for you. It is a part-buy, part-rent scheme, which enables purchasers to buy an initial share of usually between 25% and 75% the value of the property and pay a subsidised rent on the remainder. A service charge may also be payable to cover the cost of communal maintenance. Shared Ownership properties are designed as a stepping stone to completely owning your own home, allowing you to buy as much as you can afford when you can afford it.

A resale is a Shared Ownership property that the current owner bought new from us or as a resale. Buying a resale property makes you an owner-occupier because you are buying at least the current owner's share on the existing lease. The great thing about choosing to buy a re-sale shared ownership property is that it gives you the opportunity to speak to the previous owner and to find out more about the area.

detailedDescription:
An impressive Victorian family home built in 1860 adjacent to De Beauvoir Square. Arranged over four floors with an enviable amount of lateral space nearing 3,200 sq ft and offering four/five bedrooms and three bathrooms. The property has been renovated to an exacting standard throughout but retains period charm and numerous original features. It has been architecturally extended to the rear to create a full width double storey extension with air conditioning, floor to ceiling glass and bi folding doors opening out on to the garden, flooding the property with natural light and capitalizing on the east-west aspect. The raised ground floor boasts an L-shaped double through reception with sash windows, working shutters, high ceilings, coving and ceiling rose, dual fireplaces and wooden flooring. The lower ground floor is home to the bespoke kitchen and dining space leading to a landscaped garden set in York stone with composite decking, complete with summer house or optional additional gym/studio or work from home space. On the same floor is an additional soundproofed audio visual room which could easily be adapted to a guest or nanny’s bedroom. A utility room with double butler sinks and granite worktops and another bathroom complete this floor. The principal suite occupies the entire first floor with a beautifully selfish dressing room and limestone tiled Hansgrohe bathroom. The top floor offers three further bedrooms and additional walk in shower room.

Situation
De Beauvoir Town is nestled between the boroughs of Hackney and Islington, ideally situated for local amenities including the popular De Beauvoir Deli. The area has a cosmopolitan feel, promoting a community atmosphere. Transport links are plentiful including Essex Road (0.25 miles) and Hagerstown (0.4 miles).

detailedDescription:
Chptr London Fields, is an exciting and unique boutique collection of 21 one, two and three bedroom apartments tucked away at the east side of London Fields. The development is gated, and the light and spacious high-spec apartments are grouped around a landscaped central courtyard and all have private terraces or balconies.

All apartments have underfloor heating, engineered wood flooring and 'feature' concrete walls. The kitchen has Bosch integrated appliances, 'J' pull style cabinets and stone worktops & splash backs. There are high quality, fixtures and fittings, with black/brushed bronze ironmongery throughout. This three bedroom apartment has a South-Easterly facing terrace off the living area and a Westerly facing balcony off two of the bedrooms.

This increasingly sought-after neighborhood offers the best of city living in the creative heart of Hackney. Artists, brewers, makers and bakers sit alongside pioneering new workspaces and developments. An intoxicating mix of the old and new reflects the area’s industrial heritage, with converted warehouses, loft style new build apartments and a wide range of artisan shops, bars and restaurants in and around the nearby railway arches.

Everything you need is on your doorstep, from a wide range of local shops, to nearby green space and excellent transport connections. The popular Broadway Market is a short walk away, offering everything from a local fishmonger, butcher and baker to eclectic vintage, books and clothing stores in addition to numerous coffee shops, bars and restaurants. Also nearby are the high street stores of central Hackney and the designer outlet at Hackney Walk.

** The images are not of the exact unit within the development, they are of a similar unit within the same development **

Hackney has the most green space of any inner London borough and is the cycling capital of the UK. At chptr you are surrounded by opportunities for a walk or ride in the park, from London Fields (a mere 2 minutes’ walk) and the Regents’ canal towpath, to Haggerston Park, Victoria Park and the extensive Olympic Park. The area is surrounded by a cycle route network and criss-crossed by dedicated cycle routes.

Public transport links are excellent, with easy access to three Overground lines via nearby London Fields, Hackney Central and Dalston Junction or Haggerston, and Bethnal Green Underground station just a mile away.

detailedDescription: A characterful, four storey, 3 double bedroom Victorian freehold, with an impressive, full height, top floor principal bedroom suite and granted planning permission (P2020/3511/ful), situated within the Arlington Conservation area. Accommodation is generously proportioned comprising; a light filled double reception room that occupies the raised ground floor and retains ornate period details, the spacious kitchen/dining room is housed on the lower level and provides access to the light well at the front, and patio to the rear. There is a W.C and storage on the lower half landing in between the raised and lower levels, that provides access to the secluded rear garden. It should be noted that there is granted planning permission (P2020/3511/ful) to create a rear extension. There are two double bedrooms and the family bathroom suite on the first floor, and an impressive principal suite on the top floor, featuring full head height, which is rare within the area, with a separate shower room, and stand alone bath, as well as bi-folding doors across the rear of the room. A really impressive space. Linton Street is one of the Arlington conservation areas quieter and most sought after roads as there is no access via New North road, moments from the greenery of Arlington Square. The many amenities of Islington Green, Upper Street, Angel and Broadway Market are a short walk away, with the canal providing a wonderful tranquil passage. A plethora of transportation links encompassing' many bus routes to the City and West End van be found at New North Road and Essex Road, with Essex Road station providing National Rail trains to Moorgate. The trendy bars, restaurants, galleries and boutique shops of Hoxton, Shoreditch, London Fields & Old Street are all easily accessible.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
Spanning the ground and lower floors of an original warehouse building once a cigar factory, this circa 1,145 sqft ground and lower floor 1 bed 1 bath apartment is set out to be utilised as a perfect live / work space and even comes complete with the furniture, as seen.

Recently refurbished to a high standard with interior design finishes throughout, the property benefits from simple access to the front and has high ceilings providing a good sense of space. A charming original hoist from the former factory days hangs in the entrance as a reminder to the industrial times of Shoreditch. Featuring a self-contained access to the front with a second larger door for easy loading plus a void to the front which provides daylight to the lower floor kitchen and a light well to the rear of the property. The ground floor is highly versatile with a layout enabling a simple home office set up or equally a large open living space. Taking the central stairs down to the lower floor, there is a large open kitchen/diner with clever design touches to make maximum use of the space. To the rear of the lower floor there is a large double bedroom complete with walk in closet area plus a separate shower room.

Cowper Street forms a parade of original warehouse buildings right next to Old Street Tube Station making transport connections simple and convenient. The Tabernacle Street Quarter of Shoreditch is set just west of the popular Shoreditch Triangle where many of the area’s best known coffee houses, retail boutiques, bars and restaurants are located including o-Zone, Mr Start, McQueens & Tramshed.

Leasehold: 125 years from 2008

Service charge: £2000 per annum (approx.)

Ground rent: £100 per annum (approx.)

address: Royle Building, 31 Wenlock Road, Hoxton, London N1
detailedDescription: Formerly the Royle printworks, this landmark building was converted into one of the first loft style residential buildings in the area. The 3 metre high ceilings and enormous windows overlooking the basin captured an ever changing scenic view of Canal life. The Royle offers a rugged mix of concrete, open spaces and metal windows and balcony doors overlooking the basin. This light and spacious one bedroom loft apartment takes in the Westerly views and afternoon light with dreamy views over Wenlock Basin and Regents Canal. The building is very well cared for by a weekday concierge. There is a cycle store and an internal passenger lifts to all floors. The Royle is position on this prominent and picturesque corner of Wenlock Basin and Regents Canal with its own private wharf. The Royle is an easy walk from Upper Street past the Narrow Boat pub or along the Canal to Angel. Old Street roundabout is a little further showing how conveniently sited The Royle is for work and social living.

On the first floor the main bathroom, 2 bedrooms and a box room / study, with the 3rd bedroom with ensuite on the second floor in a loft conversion.

detailedDescription:
A spacious two bedroom two bathroom apartment with impressive views of the city, situated on a quiet street in the heart of Dalston.

Located on the 6th floor, this well proportioned apartment comprising two bedrooms and two bathrooms benefits from generous storage throughout, intercom system and kitchen with integrated appliances and peninsula design. The open plan kitchen and living space has a fantastic triple aspect with large sliding, floor to ceiling, double doors opening out onto an impressive curved balcony, with uninterrupted views towards the city.

In addition, there is a terrace with a play area for communal enjoyment and a green and a brown roof for urban wildlife.

This apartment is perfectly located to take full advantage of the ever-evolving East London scene. Dalston roof park, High water Bar, Ridley Road Market and the renowned Arcola Theatre are all nearby along with the popular Jidori and Chick 'n' Sours. For those who relish fashionable cafes, restaurants and bars you will be spoilt for choice here.

For easy access across town, Daltson and Dalston Kingsland station are all a 8 minute walk away or London Fields Overground is a 20 minute walk by the ever popular Broadway Market. Alternatively, buses run down Kingsland Road for access to Shoreditch, the city and the West End.

address: Mortimer Road, De Beauvoir, London N1
detailedDescription:
A stunning 3 double bedroomed Georgian Terrace house, with a fabulous garden, situated in one of De Beauvoir's most desirable locations. This house is generously arranged over 3 floors, including a sumptuous 25ft double reception room, complemented by a plethora of original features. On the lower ground floor, there is a superb kitchen with an adjoining family area. On the upper floor, there are two double bedrooms and two bathrooms.

Mortimer Road is a wide picturesque tree-lined street, off De Beauvoir Square, which is a much sort after area with a children's area and rose garden. The property is conveniently positioned for the great shopping on Kingsland Road as well as not being too far from Upper Street. Access into the City or West End is made possible by the many local bus routes as well as the London Overground at Haggerston (approx. 5 mins away).

Comments from the owner:

What do you love most about your home? The friendly neighbours, the peace and quiet - its a no through road, so only cars delivering or from owners of other houses come down the road. The garden at the back has an abundance of birds and our local Robin. I have also cultivated palm trees and a wooden patio which is great for bbq and sunbathing and again is really quiet. There is also amazing light in the house, the sun comes up on the front of the house and is on the back garden in the afternoon - something I really love.

Why are you moving? Very sad to be giving up this house where you can see the sunset and take amazing pics.

What do you love about the area? It's a real urban house, near everything. Easy access to the river thames, coffee shops, restaurants, cinema, the city, cannery wharf, west end. There are a couple of organic pubs/restaurants too, and on the canal of course there are even more restaurants and places to have breakfast as you watch the narrow boats go by. Ref: Isl

address: Stone Studios, 80-84 Wallis Road, Hackney Wick E9
detailedDescription:
A spacious three bedroom apartment, boasting a large open plan kitchen/ living area and a south facing balcony.

Description

Built on the site of a former metal works, Stone Studios is a micro neighbourhood of five distinctive buildings, just 0.1 miles from Hackney Wick Station.

The development features 110 expansive, light-filled apartments above shared creative workspaces, a café, gallery and a courtyard.

Homes at Stone Studios have been designed for comfortable, luxury loft-style living, with floor to ceiling windows, private outside space, high spec kitchens and flexible, free-flow living space.

Stone Studios benefits from having some of London's best green spaces nearby, including Victoria Park, Queen Elizabeth Olympic Park, and Hackney Marshes.

Hackney Wick is home to many aspiring young artists, musicians and creatives, making it a vibrant and diverse community to live in. 'The Wick' is fast becoming one of London's most important work and cultural hubs.

With its array of independent cafes, trendy restaurants and eateries, and some of London's best breweries and canal-side bars, you'll be spoilt for choice when exploring your new neighbourhood.

Stone Studios offers direct access to Hackney Wick Overground station, with 16 arrivals and departures per hour, bringing the rest of the city into easy reach.

Square Footage: 1043 sq ft

Leasehold with approximately 998 years remaining

detailedDescription:
Very spacious two bedroom lower ground flat with garden patio available within easy walking distance to Stoke Newington Church Street, Clapton, the lush Hackney and Walthamstow Marshes with wetlands, River Lea, Hackney Downs.

The location is perfect for young families with many amenities in close reach and great school catchment area. The street has an amazing community feel (check out the website) with street parties, extensive history knowledge, caroling and active support chat group. Tram Store 4min walk (Cafe, Sunday Roast, blok fitness) Sodo pizza, world food store with lots of health food options. We absolutely love the location.

Quiet no through road, with Clapton Overground Station (2min walk, Walthamstow (5min)/ Chingford (17min)/ Liverpool street station (12min)) at the end. Rectory Station (5min walk) and good bus connections.

Both double bedrooms are large with room for lots of furniture and could fit an emperor bed easily. Large windows/ doors.

Good sized bathroom with room for separate shower and bathtub as well as storage cupboard and small window.

Separate entrance.

Stylish and practical rubber tiling throughout.

Open plan living room and sit-in kitchen have enough space for several living areas.

Large entrance hallway with room for wardrobes and storage shelves as well as a good sized separate storage room.

South facing well maintained patio with top quality ceramic tiling from Germany with vines (edible grapes!), Jasmine and Camellia. Quiet and green outlook. Kind and quiet, young professional neighbours.

Share of freehold, long lease.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
35 Shore Road is an exceptional collection of just thirteen one, two and three bedroom apartments. Situated on a peaceful one-way residential street, it is just a few minute's walk from Broadway Market and Victoria Park Village.

Most apartments have a unique layout and each will have outside space in the form of a balcony or terrace. The high specification finish includes built-in Bosch appliances, underfloor heating, LED lighting and video entry systems.

This beautifully finished one bedroom apartment is situated on the first floor, is 613 square feet with a west facing balcony and is now ready for occupation.

Ideally situated between Victoria Park and London Fields, 35 Shore Road offers 245 acres of parkland within a 5 minute walk from the front door. London Fields offers the only 50 metre heated lido in London, a cricket pitch, tennis courts and an outdoor gym as well as a multi-use games area, playgrounds and summertime meadow, while Victoria Park has a boating lake, Sunday Market and also hosts a number of renowned music festivals in the summer.

Broadway Market is home to an eclectic mix of restaurants, coffee shops and independents, and the thriving Saturday market sells a wide range of food, vintage clothing and artisan products, while Victoria Park village offers a range of boutique shops including Ginger Pig, Bottle Apostle, Gails & Loaf as well as a wide range of pubs, bars and eateries including The Empress & My Neighbours The Dumplings.

The area is very well connected, with fast Overground links and numerous buses to Central London. Hackney is the cycling capital of London, and London Fields offers a wide variety of traffic-free routes via the canal towpath (to Islington or Stratford and beyond) or many green spaces. The City is a mere ten minute cycle or 30 minute walk away.

* Photos in this listing are indicative only

detailedDescription:
This charming two double bedroom third floor flat with private balcony, is superbly presented with far-reaching views of the shard, and as well as neighbouring areas. The property has lift access and includes residents' parking with a good shared use of large front gardens. Set within a popular development in the desirable location of Stoke Newington, a stone’s throw from Clissold Park and the buzzing area of Church Street, it is within the catchment area of desirable schools. The property is well-appointed, bright west-facing and spacious throughout. Much care has been taken to maximise the use of space which includes a generous light and airy, open plan kitchen-living area. There are two well proportioned bedrooms, a bathroom, as well as a separate toilet. Further features include bespoke made-to-measure plantation shutters, wood flooring, gas central heating, double glazing, ample inbuilt storage, and no onward chain.

Accommodation comprises of lobby area and entrance hall with security entry phone with a designated cloak hall, leading into the bright and spacious open plan reception/kitchen area with a inbuilt box seat storage, customised ceiling-hung shelving feature with matching wing shelving, double glazed windows and a door out onto the private balcony boasting high views. The renovated kitchen has walnut wood work surfaces and breakfast bar area, incorporating inset ceramic sink unit with a stylish single lever chrome mixer tap, inset 5 burner stainless steel gas hob under a range hood with outdoor extraction, double wall mounted electric oven and ample space for appliances. There are also tall inbuilt storage cupboards, one housing the Vaillant combination boiler. The two well sized bedrooms each have double glazed windows with shutters and inbuilt wardrobes. The bathroom has a wall mounted shower over the bath and conveniently the toilet suit is separate.

Viewings of this beautiful property are highly recommended.

Location

The property is enviably located in Zone 2, on the much sought after Albion Road in the heart of Stoke Newington, between the beautiful big open space of Clissold Park, leafy Newington Green and the wonderful array of fashionable shops and cafes of Church Street. Trendy restaurants and bars of Stoke Newington High Street are within easy access, and the property is on the route of the frequent buses 73, N73 & 476. The area is well served by excellent local schools, which the property is within the catchment area of (Grasemere Primary School, William Patterson Primary School, Bettylayward Primary School and Stoke Newington High School). Other beautiful open spaces nearby include Abney Park and the Wetlands. Stoke Newington station (1.1 km) and Canonbury station (1.8km) are both easily accessible, as is Manor House Tube station (1.8km).

Lease Information

We understand the lease on the property is 113 years from 10 May 1999 - 93 years remaining. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries via a solicitor.

Service Charges

To be confirmed. All prospective purchasers are advised to make their own enquiries via a solicitor.

Disclaimer For Virtual Viewings

Some or all information pertaining to this property may have been provided solely by the vendor, and although we always make every effort to verify the information provided to us, we strongly advise you to make further enquiries before continuing.

If you book a viewing or make an offer on a property that has had its valuation conducted virtually, you are doing so under the knowledge that this information may have been provided solely by the vendor, and that we may not have been able to access the premises to confirm the information or test any equipment. We therefore strongly advise you to make further enquiries before completing your purchase of the property to ensure you are happy with all the information provided.

This classic warehouse loft apartment offers a cool and very flexible contemporary living experience in the East Canal facing part of this converted factory, in a quiet location between super cool Shoreditch and Islington. Located on the second floor, the entire outer wall of massive crittal windows throw huge amounts of natural light in the apartment, making it a perfect 'work from home' opportunity, as well as just a great flat.

The apartment centres around a large open/plan living area, which incorporates a fully fitted modern kitchen with a breakfast bar that morphs straight into a huge flexible reception area, which offers enough space to create a workspace, if needed. There is a very large master bedroom, with a private shower room and fitted wardrobes, plus a second bedroom and huge bathroom and great storage.

The Canal Building is a standout on the Shoreditch, Islington warehouse scene. Obviously very popular for its windows and factory aesthetic, the building also offers a 24-hour porter, great security and off-street parking. The location is quiet and yet accessible to a number of classic London hubs, with Clerkenwell, Shoreditch and Old Street Roundabout one way and then Upper Street, Angel Islington just a 10-minute stroll down the canal in the other direction.

Transport links are superb, with Old Street and Angel tube stations within walking distance and King’s Cross St. Pancras being quickly accessible via bus or taxi, with its amazing transformation into a world-class travel and lifestyle destination.

detailedDescription:
Spacious modern one-bedroom apartment in the highly desired City View Apartments in Woodberry Down, N4.

An extremely well-presented ground floor apartment with access to a great sized private terrace.

The property offers open plan kitchen and living area with all the desired integrated branded appliances. The living area has wooden laminate flooring and floor to ceiling windows allowing a great source of natural sunlight with an access to your own private terrace.

The Bedroom offers spacious built in sliding wardrobe, carpet flooring and floor to ceiling windows.

The bathroom is of a great size with shower over bath, and tile walls and flooring.

City View Apartments is a highly regarded block at the heart of this award-winning waterside development. The development has a 24-hour concierge service, a residents lounge with a separate workspace room, and a residents-only fully equipped gym with yoga studio, stunning 15m indoor pool, jacuzzi, steam room, and sauna.

Further residents benefits include a bicycle storage room and local amenities on your doorstep. These include; 2 family-run cafés, an Italian pizzeria, 2 local supermarkets, a post office, dry cleaners, a childrens playground, the Naturalist Pub, and stunning landscaped gardens with East and West Reservoirs, part of the famous Woodberry Wetlands.

The area serves a multitude of fantastic social spots and transports links; including Stoke Newington and Finsbury Park only short walks away with a wide variety of restaurants, pubs, and cafes and the wide-open green spaces of Clissold Park and Finsbury Park.

Local transport links include Manor House Station (Piccadilly line, Zones 2 & 3) Finsbury Park station (Piccadilly and Victoria lines, Zone 2, National Rail / Thameslink), and Stamford Hill overground station.

Benefitting from excellent natural light thanks to the floor-to-ceiling windows and dual aspect, the open-plan living area has ample space for relaxing and dining whilst the kitchen is stylish with integrated modern appliances. Both double bedrooms have a bright and airy feel to them and are of excellent proportions. Further benefits include a chic family bathroom in addition to ample storage throughout.

Haggerston Studios is located in central Haggerston which is known for the array of restaurants, bars and other amenities available to residents. The nearby Regents Canal offers a pleasant walk in either direction to both Islington and Victoria Park. Haggerston Station is moments away and provides access to both Shoreditch High Street and Highbury & Islington. There are numerous bus routes along with the newly developed cycle highway which both offer direct access into London Town. Offered chain free.

title: 2 bed flat for sale

detailedDescription:
One bedroom purpose built flat located on the fourth floor within a small rise block in a highly sought after location.

The south facing reception room is one of the main draws to the property being flooded with natural light and there is ample space for a dining table making it ideal to both relax and entertain.

Access to the private balcony is off the reception room.

The separate kitchen offer plenty of work surface and cupboards further adding to the enjoyment of living in the property.

The bedroom is a great size and further benefits from a built in wardrobe.

The bathroom is well proportioned for the size of the property.

Location;

The flat is off Kingsland Road with an array of everyday amenities alongside a lot of award-winning bars, restaurants, and independent shops.

Shoreditch Park is a short walk away and the property is placed perfectly for access to the City.

The shops, bars, and restaurants of Islington, Shoreditch, Hoxton, and Clerkenwell are within easy reach.

The Barbican Centre is a 20-minute walk.

Significant redevelopment and investment continue to take place in the area of City Basin and Old Street’s ‘Silicon Roundabout’, attracting investment from tech companies and creative talent from around the world.

Transport;

Hoxton Overground is less than five minutes away provides an easy link with Dalston and Highbury and with Canary Wharf and New Cross.

Both Angel and Old Street tube stations are nearby, both on the Northern Line and connecting to other quick routes to Central London, The West End and beyond.

Ideal for first-time buyers and a Pied-à-Terre.

An early viewing is highly recommended.

This beautifully presented apartment is situated on a highly sought after street and forms part of a substantial and very attractive Victorian building. Living accommodation spans approx 637sq ft across the second floor.

Our client has meticulously interior designed the property to create a truly impressive home, its perfect for the first time buyer looking to get onto the London property ladder.

Property is entered via smart communal areas and comprises – two double bedrooms both of which are comfortable and decorated to a high standard, a striking Kitchen diner with modern fitted units, stylish shower room and a charming reception room that leads directly to the private terrace. The terrace really is a little gem, it's a quiet area to relax or entertain and completes this wonderful home.

Located just 0.5 miles from Finsbury Park Station, you're surrounded by a glorious array of delectable restaurants, independent delicatessens, boutique shops and countless other amenities from in and around the Finsbury Park, Highbury and Stoke Newington areas.
The nearest transport links are at Finsbury Park with its underground (Piccadilly and Victoria lines) and National Railway station, providing easy access to almost anywhere.

The kitchen is modern with high-specification appliances with ample space for dining alongside. There are three well-proportioned double bedrooms all of which have access to en-suite facilities in addition to a communal WC. The upper floor houses the master suite which also boasts access to a private terrace area.

Tottenham Road is regarded as one of the premier destinations within De Beauvoir, N1. This tree-lined street is enviably located and provides easy access to the bountiful array of amenities the local area has to offer ranging from independent eateries to gastro pubs all within walking distance. The green spaces of De Beauvoir Square are a short walk from the property whilst both Dalston Kingsland and Dalston Junction Overground Stations are easily accessible and offer direct routes to Highbury and Islington (Victoria line), Stratford (Central line and Westfield Shopping Centre) and Canary Wharf. detailedDescription:
Yopa Online Auctions is a new, innovative, and pioneering platform for buying and selling property. It provides all the benefits synonymous with traditional auctions, including: Speed and certainty of sale, transparency and zero risk of gazumping or double-selling but with the added advantage of being able to bid pressure-free from the comfort of your own home or office via desktop, tablet or mobile phone. Yopa also offer a Buy-it-Now feature which allows you to place an offer and purchase before the Auction end date.

If you request a viewing of this property, then you agree that your personal information (name and contact details) will be shared with goto Auctions (Yopa’s Online Auction partner) to enable them to ensure that you understand the auction process

To book a viewing visit Yopa.

This property is open to cash buyers only.

A great opportunity to purchase this 2 double bedroom flat located on the 9th floor of this iconic building in the heart of Hackney and Clapton.

The flat consists of a spacious hallway leading to the good sized living room with big bright windows and incredible views of the London skyline. 2 good sized double bedrooms. A modern eat in kitchen diner and a family bathroom with bath and hand basin and a separate WC. The flat would make an ideal buy to let investment for any investor or even possibly a first time purchase. Offered with the added benefit of plenty of storage space, a concierge service as well as lift access and a lease in excess of 107 years, this is a great option for anyone familiar with the area.

The flat is located in Seaton Point, an iconic building in the heart of E5 close to all the local shops and restaurants of both Hackney and Clapton and being right on the edge of Hackney Downs. Both Clapton and Hackney Downs Overground stations are nearby for easy access in and out of the City.

Auctioneer's Comments:
This property is for sale by Online Auction which is a flexible and buyer friendly method of purchase. The purchaser will not be exchanging contracts on the fall of the virtual hammer but will be given 56 working days in which to complete the transaction, from the date the Draft Contract are issued by the seller’s solicitor. By giving a buyer time to exchange contracts on the property, means normal residential finance can be sort.

The Buyer’s Premium secures the transaction and takes the property off the market. Fees paid to the Auctioneer may be considered as part of the chargeable consideration for the property and be included in the calculation for stamp duty liability. Further clarification on this must be sought from your legal representative. The buyer will be required to sign a Reservation form to confirm acceptance of terms prior to solicitors being instructed. Copies of the Reservation form and all terms and conditions can be found in the Info Pack which can be downloaded for free from our website or requested from our Auction Department.

Upon close of a successful auction or if the vendor accepts an offer during the auction, the buyer will be required to make payment of a non-refundable Buyers Premium of £9,600 including VAT plus an administration charge of £354 including VAT, a total of £9,954. This secures the transaction and takes the property off the market.

The Buyer’s Premium and administration charge are in addition to the final negotiated selling price.
