agency_name: Urban Spaces Loft Living & Unique Properties
detailedDescription:
A striking 3 bedroom home measuring just over 1000 sq/ft and forming part of a contemporary development designed by the admired architect Amin Taha, which was previously shortlisted for a prestigious riba award.

The building occupies the site of a former shoe factory in the Dalston regeneration zone, next the new Hackney fashion hub designed by David Adjaye. It contains 9 apartments, set behind a gate on Belsham Street. Each one has its own front door, accessed from a new pedestrian walkway, giving each one the feeling of a small house. This particular unit is quietly located towards the rear of the development and offers both security and privacy.

The property was originally sold with three bedrooms, but the current owner uses one of the downstairs rooms as a sitting room. Upon entering on the ground floor, there is a hallway with video entry-phone. To one side is a double bedroom with wardrobe. Adjacent is a WC and then a kitchen/dining/reception room with full- height windows overlooking the courtyard garden below.

The lower ground floor contains two further double bedrooms, one with a generous an en-suite bathroom and built-in wardrobe and a separate bathroom. Both bedrooms open onto a private courtyard which also provides useful additional storage.

The interior will please lovers of Brutalism, with raw blockwork walls, polished concrete floors and exposed concrete ceilings. One of the benefits of this modern development is the low running costs. The apartment has under-floor heating throughout and retains the heat well. On the other hand, it remains cool during the increasingly hot London summer.

Belsham Street benefits from all the amenities of Hackney Central and Mare Street, as well as the green spaces and weekend markets at Victoria Park, London Fields and Lower Clapton.

Transport links are excellent with Hackney Central a 5-minute walk away (0.2m) offering fast trains into Stratford and Highbury & Islington. Hackney Downs is a 10-minute walk (0.4m) which provides access into Liverpool Street Station in a further 10 minutes.

The property is being sold chain-free, in excellent condition and with a long lease of 244 years remaining.

The property has been finished to an extremely high standard and comprises of a large kitchen/living room leading into a balcony, double bedroom with built in wardrobes, spacious bathroom and storage solutions.

In addition, it benefits from under floor heating, Duravit sanitary ware in the bathroom, Siemens kitchen appliances and Deltalight light fittings.

detailedDescription:
A fantastic top floor two bedroom former warehouse apartment situated within the heart of the Shoreditch Triangle. The property boasts high ceilings, wood flooring and bright interiors through a number of original sash windows.

Comprising two good sized bedrooms, a fantastic dual aspect reception and open plan kitchen, shower room and good storage spaces.

Rivington Street is located in the heart of the Shoreditch Triangle at the junction with Curtain Road. The amenities of Shoreditch and Hoxton are all within easy reach, including its collection of fashion boutiques, restaurants, cafes and bars. The markets of Columbia Road and Spitalfields are nearby, whilst Hoxton Square is within walking distance.

Transport links are vast with Liverpool Street Station (Hammersmith & City, Circle, District and Central lines, British Rail), Shoreditch Overland Station (East London Line) and Old Street Station all within a 0.5miles of the apartment.

Offered with no onward chain, this property would make a fantastic purchase and investment in an area benefitting from major investment, attracting some of the world's biggest tech firms and hotel chains.

An award winning development, celebrating its industrial heritage with impressive brick facades, saw-toothed roofs and contemporary metal balconies.

address: Spurhouse, 4-14 Spurtowe Terrace, Hackney Downs, London E8
detailedDescription:
Situated in the creative heart of Hackney, yet only eight minutes by train from the City, Spurhouse is the epitome of modern city living.

Spurhouse's four floors offer a perfect mix of one, two and three bedroom apartments, with four penthouse apartments on the 4th floor offering extended living and outdoor space. All apartments (and their balconies) face South West to make the most of the sunshine and overlook Spurstowe Terrace, a quiet side road only a minute from Hackney Downs Station.

This beautifully finished one bedroom apartment is situated on the 2nd floor, has a South West facing balcony and can be purchased off plan with practical completion expected Autumn 2021.

All apartments are beautifully styled, with open plan kitchen/diner/livings spaces flooded with natural light, featuring private balcony's, engineered oak flooring, premium integrated ceramic hobs with brushed steel ovens and built-in microwaves. Bedrooms have been designed to combine a relaxed chic atmosphere with contemporary touches and modern convenience and feature premium weave carpets, build in wardrobes and feature walls. Bathrooms are created to instil a feeling of calm and restfulness whilst featuring recessed vapour resistant lighting and wall-hung ceramic fittings, large mirrors and monobloc basin taps. Underfloor heating is provided throughout the whole property.

From its rich industrial past as home to many of London's timber yards and livestock traders, Hackney has evolved into one of the city's most desirable neighbourhoods. Spurhouse sits in the centre of Hackney, nestled midway between the open green spaces of Hackney Downs and the renowned recreational facilities at leafy London Fields. A unique location, moments from the social hotspots of Hackney Central and the cool nightlife of Dalston, yet within touching distance of the City of London and its neighbouring areas of Spitalfields, Shoreditch and Hoxton.

Its open spaces, thriving nightlife and burgeoning community of creative and tech start-ups ensure a bustling energy and a rich cultural mix. The area also now boasts an eclectic mix of independent retailers and specialist street markets selling everything from fresh produce to vintage goods. A slew of pubs, bars and restaurants are no established, it is no surprise that Hackney is so sought after by London's stylish young professionals.

address: The Factory, 1 Nile Street, London N1.
detailedDescription:
A spacious and beautifully presented two bedroom loft apartment which is located on the first floor of The Factory in the heart of Tech City.

Spanning in excess of 1,870sqft the property offers a fantastic feeling of space which is assisted by high ceilings, the accommodation briefly comprises a huge reception room with an open plan fitted kitchen. There is a utility room, a principal bedroom with a large en suite bathroom with separate walk in shower and a connecting study. An additional double bedroom and bathroom complete the accommodation.

A wealth of warehouse character remain, to include exposed brick walls, crittal windows and loading doors which open out onto a Juliette balcony. The apartment is sold with a share of Freehold, an allocated parking space, an internal communal courtyard and the factory also has a dedicated porter.

Owing to our commitment to keep both our colleagues and clients safe during this period of recommended isolation, we have many self-serve viewing options available to you. These include video walkthroughs, 360 virtual reality viewings and enhanced comprehensive photography.

Originally re-developed by Manhattan Loft Corporation, The Factory remains one of the most iconic conversions in the Old Street district with a number of bus routes to choose within close proximity as is Old Street station (Northern Line/Main Line). There are also a number useful amenities close to hand. Some of the capitals best bars and restaurants can also be found in Shoreditch, Hoxton, and Clerkenwell.

detailedDescription:
Beautifully residing across the ground floor of this unique and modern bespoke built building awaits this one bedroom maisonette, complete with private outside space and located in the heart of popular Stroud Green Road.

This striking apartment boasts a wealth of unique features and contemporary design throughout, not least in the open plan layout across the main living space, incorporating enough space for a lounge/diner, with a smart modern kitchen to your left. Here you’ll find fresh, pale mint walls, recessed spot lighting and brilliantly polished cabinets in a light concrete effect grey, copper handles, slick modern range hood with glass elements and a matching oven with an gas stove. From this space you have access to the yard outside via sliding doors, providing more room for al fresco dining and hosting outdoor get togethers. Though to the hallway you’ll find the bathroom, fully fitted with full sized bath tub and over head shower, modern silver accents and bold, oversized terracotta tiling adding even more personality. To the front of the property lies the double bedroom, featuring solid oak floorboards found throughout the apartment, complemented by crisp white walls and lit via two windows, one providing views out to the yard beyond. This is the ideal home for young professionals wishing to discover a slice of calm in the bustling and covetable surrounds of Stroud Green Road.

Located on the ground floor of this unique modern building, 51a sits proudly on the vibrant Stroud Green Road awash with award winning local eateries and independent retail. What’s more you are a mere 0.6 miles away from Finsbury Park Station with direct access to the City and East London.
